text2: Tɔʋ , Tacaa niŋ ká kpa nyá tɔɔ kɛ ́ nɔɔnɔɔ . N ká yʋlʋmɩ , n kaa keesi ilim kɛ wɛɛ naalɛ . Tənaɣa pə yu Ɩlimasɩ ɩsɛntɔɔ kɛ kpakpaa na ɩ ́ tuti ɩ təɣɩ səkpɛtʋɣʋ tɛɛ . Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ ɩ sʋʋ tutuɣu ɩsɩɩ ɩ ́ na nɔɣɔlʋ na ɩ ́ hɔmɩ - ɩ .

text: Then the deputy , when he saw what was done , believed , being astonished at the doctrine of the Lord .
text2: Kʋfənɛɛ ná pə təna mpi pə lapa mpʋ tɔ , ɩlɛna ɩ ́ mʋ Ɩsɔ Tɔm . Pə taɣa pʋlʋ , Tacaa tɔm nti pa sɛɣɛsa - ɩ tɔ tə lapa - ɩ sɔɣɔntʋ kɛ teu kɛ ́ .

text: Now when Paul and his company loosed from Paphos , they came to Perga in Pamphylia : and John departing from them returned to Jerusalem .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Pɔɔlɩ na ɩ taapalaa pa sʋʋ kpɩɩlʋɣʋ kɛ Pafɔɔsɩ na pá tɛɛna Pɛɛsɩ kɛ Pamfili tɛtʋ taa . Ama Yohaanɩ Maləkɩ ná yela - wɛɣɛ təna na ɩ ́ məlɩ Yosalɛm .

text: But when they departed from Perga , they came to Antioch in Pisidia , and went into the synagogue on the sabbath day , and sat down .
text2: Pa lɩɩ Pɛɛsɩ , ɩlɛna pá tɛɛna Antiyɔka kɛ Pisiti tɛtʋ taa . Pə tala kʋyakʋ kʋhɛɛsʋɣʋ wule , ɩlɛna pá sʋʋ Yuta nyə ́ ma təkotile taa na pá caɣa .

text: And after the reading of the law and the prophets the rulers of the synagogue sent unto them , saying , Ye men and brethren , if ye have any word of exhortation for the people , say on .
text2: Pa tɛma Moisi takəlasɩ na Ɩsɔ kʋyɔɣɔtʋtʋ tɛləsəlaa nyəŋsɩ kɛ kalʋɣʋ , ɩlɛna Yuta nyə ́ ma təkotile nyʋɣʋ nyə ́ ma tili na pá heeli - wɛ sɩ : Ta taapalaa mɛ , ye ɩ ́ wɛna natələɣɩ pəcɔ sɩ ɩ ́ ká heeli samaa na pə ́ səna - wɛ , ɩ ́ yɔɣɔtɩ ɩlɛ .

text: Then Paul stood up , and beckoning with his hand said , Men of Israel , and ye that fear God , give audience .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Pɔɔlɩ kʋlaa na ɩ ́ la - wɛɣɛ kaafala na ɩ ́ tɔ sɩ : Ɩsɛɣɛlɩ nyə ́ ma na mpa mɛ ɩ ́ sɛɛkɩ Ɩsɔ tɔ ɩ ́ nɩɩ ma tɔm .

text: The God of this people of Israel chose our fathers , and exalted the people when they dwelt as strangers in the land of Egypt , and with an high arm brought he them out of it .
text2: Ɩsɛɣɛlɩ yəlaa panɛ pa Ɩsɔ ləsəna tá caanaa caanaa na ɩ ́ la na pá huki waatʋ wei paa caɣa caɣalətʋ kɛ Icipiti tɔ , na ɩ ́ ləsɩ - wɛɣɛ təna na toŋ na toŋ .

text: And about the time of forty years suffered he their manners in the wilderness .
text2: Na ɩ ́ tɔkɩ - wɛ ɩsɩɩ pɩɩsɩ nɩɩlɛ kɛ wʋlaɣa tɛtʋ taa .

text: And when he had destroyed seven nations in the land of Chanaan , he divided their land to them by lot .
text2: Haləna ɩ ́ kpiisi piitimnaa naatosompɔɣɔlaɣa kɛ Kanaaŋ tɛtʋ taa , na ɩ ́ kpaɣa pa tɛtʋnaa na ɩ ́ cɛla ɩ Ɩsɛɣɛlɩ nyə ́ ma na tə ́ pəsɩ pa nyəntʋ .

text: And after that he gave unto them judges about the space of four hundred and fifty years , until Samuel the prophet .
text2: Na pá caɣa tə taa ɩsɩɩ pɩɩsɩ nasəlɛ na nɩɩlɛ na naanʋwa ( 450 ) . Pəlɛ pə waalɩ ɩ kpa - wɛɣɛ tɔm hʋʋlaa , haləna pə tala Ɩsɔ kʋyɔɣɔtʋtʋ tɛləsʋlʋ Samiyɛɛlɩ waatʋ taa .

text: And afterward they desired a king : and God gave unto them Saul the son of Cis , a man of the tribe of Benjamin , by the space of forty years .
text2: Ɩlɛna pá sələmɩ wulaʋ , kɛna Ɩsɔ kpa Pɛnsamɛɛ lʋlʋɣʋ taa tʋ wei pa yaa sɩ Kisi tɔ ɩ pəyalʋ Sayuli , na ɩ ́ lɛ ́ ɩ tɔɣɔ kawulaɣa kɛ pɩɩsɩ nɩɩlɛ təcu .

text: And when he had removed him , he raised up unto them David to be their king ; to whom also he gave testimony , and said , I have found David the son of Jesse , a man after mine own heart , which shall fulfil all my will .
text2: Ɩsɔ kɔma na ɩ ́ kisi Sayuli tɔm kɛ ́ , ɩlɛna ɩ ́ kpa - wɛɣɛ Tafiiti kɛ wulaʋ . Haləna ɩ ́ ləsɩ ɩ ́ lɛ ́ ɩ nyɩɩlʋɣʋ sɩ : Ma hika Sesee pəyalʋ Tafiiti ɩ kɛ ́ ma luɣu tɛɛ yʋlʋ . Ɩ ká la pə təna mpi ma sɔɔlaa sɩ ɩ ́ la tɔ .

text: Of this man ' s seed hath God according to his promise raised unto Israel a Saviour , Jesus :
text2: Tafiiti ɩnɩ ɩ lʋləna na pə ́ lʋlɩ , haləna pə ́ tala Yesu wei Ɩsɔ sɩɩwa sɩ ɩ ́ waasɩ Ɩsɛɣɛlɩ nyə ́ ma tɔ , ɩsɩɩ ɩ ka yɔɣɔtʋɣʋ sɩ ɩ ká la tɔ .

text: When John had first preached before his coming the baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel .
text2: Yesu taa kɔnta tɔ , Yohaanɩ lapa ɩ waasʋ na ɩ ́ heeliɣi yəlaa təna sɩ pá laɣasɩ tɔntɛ na pá sɔ - wɛɣɛ Ɩsɔ lʋm .

text: And as John fulfilled his course , he said , Whom think ye that I am ? I am not he . But , behold , there cometh one after me , whose shoes of his feet I am not worthy to loose .
text2: Pə kɔma na pə wʋsəna Yohaanɩ səm tɔ ɩ tɔma sɩ : Ɩ ́ hʋʋ sɩ ma kɛ ́ aweɣelɛ ye ? Ma ta kɛ wei ɩ ́ taŋaa sɩ ɩ kɔŋ tɔ . Ama ɩ ́ nyənɩ , ma waalɩ nɔɣɔlʋ ká kɔɔ . Ma ta tala má hɩɩsɩ ɩ nɔɔhɛɛ taa ntaŋkpala mʋsʋɣʋ maɣamaɣa .

text: Men and brethren , children of the stock of Abraham , and whosoever among you feareth God , to you is the word of this salvation sent .
text2: Ta taapalaa , Apəlaham piya mɛ , na mə təna mpa mɛ ɩ ́ kɔma cənɛɣɛ Ɩsɔ sɛɛʋ tɔ , taɣa pə heeliɣi yapʋ tɔm tənɛ sɩ tə ́ nɩɩ .

text: For they that dwell at Jerusalem , and their rulers , because they knew him not , nor yet the voices of the prophets which are read every sabbath day , they have fulfilled them in condemning him .
text2: Tampana tɔɔ ɩsəntɔ Yosalɛm yəlaa ná taa cɛkəna Ɩsɔ kʋyɔɣɔtʋtʋ tɛləsəlaa tɔm nti pa kalaɣa paa kʋyakʋ kʋhɛɛsʋɣʋ ŋku tɔ . Na pa kʋɣʋ Yesu tɔm tɔ , Ɩsɔ kʋyɔɣɔtʋtʋ tɛləsəlaa nɔɔsɩ taa tɔm kɛ pa lapa təkɛlɛ .

text: And though they found no cause of death in him , yet desired they Pilate that he should be slain .
text2: Paa na pa pɛɛka mpi paa pusina na pá kʋ - ɩ na pá laŋ tɔ , pa sələma Pilatɩ sɩ ɩ ́ kʋ - ɩ mpʋ .

text: And when they had fulfilled all that was written of him , they took him down from the tree , and laid him in a sepulchre .
text2: Pa tɛma lapʋ kɛ tə təna nti Ɩsɔ Tɔm takəlasɩ ka yɔɣɔta ɩ tɔɔ tɔ , ɩlɛna pá tisi - ɩ səm tesika tɔɔ , na pá pimi - ɩ pəlaaʋ taa .

text: But God raised him from the dead :
text2: Ama Ɩsɔ feesa - ɩ .

text: And he was seen many days of them which came up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem , who are his witnesses unto the people .
text2: Kʋyɛɛŋ paɣalɛ taa ɩ lɩɩkaɣa ɩ ́ na mpa pa lɩɩna Kalilee na pá polo Yosalɛm tɔ pa tɔɔ . Na pənɛntɛ mpɛ ɩnɩ pa heeliɣina Ɩsɛɣɛlɩ piitim kɛ tɔm nti pa nawa tɔ tə tampana .

text: And we declare unto you glad tidings , how that the promise which was made unto the fathers ,
text2: Na tá tɔtɔ , Laapaalɩ Kʋpaŋ ɩnəɣɩ tə kɔna - mɛ . Mpi mpi Ɩsɔ ka tɔma sɩ ɩ ká la tá caanaa caanaa tɔ ,

text: God hath fulfilled the same unto us their children , in that he hath raised up Jesus again ; as it is also written in the second psalm , Thou art my Son , this day have I begotten thee .
text2: pə maɣamaɣa kɛ ɩ lapa ta kiŋ kɛ waatʋ wei ɩ feesa Yesu tɔ , ɩsɩɩ pa ŋmaaʋ Yontu naalɛ nyəntʋ taa tɔ sɩ : Nyaɣalɛ ma pəyaɣa , saŋa ma pəsa nyá Caa kɛ ́ .

text: And as concerning that he raised him up from the dead , now no more to return to corruption , he said on this wise , I will give you the sure mercies of David .
text2: Ɩsɔ ka tɛma yɔɣɔtʋɣʋ sɩ ɩ ká feesi - ɩ , sɩ pə fɛɩ sɩ ɩ ká tasa . Ɩ ka yɔɣɔta ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ sɩ : Kʋpantʋnaa mpa ma faɣasaa sɩ má la Tafiiti tɔ , maa la - mɛɣɛ wɛ .

text: Wherefore he saith also in another psalm , Thou shalt not suffer thine Holy One to see corruption .
text2: Pə tɔɔ kɛ ́ tiili tɔtɔ ɩ yɔɣɔtaa na pə pɩɩ təcəŋcəŋ sɩ : N kaa yele sɩ nyá yʋlʋ kʋpaŋ má ma tɩɩ sɔŋ pəcɔ maɣamaɣa .

text: For David , after he had served his own generation by the will of God , fell on sleep , and was laid unto his fathers , and saw corruption :
text2: Mpi Ɩsɔ sɩɩwa tɔ , mpəɣɩ Tafiiti ná lapa ɩ ́ lɛ ́ ɩ pɔɔlɛ taa . Pə waalɩ ɩ səpa na pá pimi - ɩ ɩ caanaa caanaa kiŋ na ɩ ́ tasa .

text: But he , whom God raised again , saw no corruption .
text2: Ama Ɩsɔ feesa wei tɔ , ɩ ta tasa se .

text: Be it known unto you therefore , men and brethren , that through this man is preached unto you the forgiveness of sins :
text2: Ta taapalaa , pə wɛɛ sɩ ɩ ́ nyɩ sɩ Yesu tənna pa heela - mɛɣɛ mə ɩsaɣatʋ hɩɩsʋɣʋ tɔm . Na paa yʋlʋ wei ɩ ́ tɛma - ɩ na ɩ taa , ɩ ləsəɣɩ pʋntʋ kɛ ɩ ɩsaɣatʋ təna taa . Moisi kʋsəsɩɩtʋ təŋʋɣʋ ná taa pəsɩ na tə ́ la mpʋ .

text: Beware therefore , lest that come upon you , which is spoken of in the prophets ;
text2: Ye mpʋ ɩlɛ , ɩ ́ la laakalɩ na pə ́ taa kɔɔ na pə ́ la - mɛ ɩsɩɩ Ɩsɔ kʋyɔɣɔtʋtʋ tɛləsəlaa ka yɔɣɔtaa tɔ sɩ :

text: Behold , ye despisers , and wonder , and perish : for I work a work in your days , a work which ye shall in no wise believe , though a man declare it unto you .
text2: Footilaa sɔsaa mɛ ɩ ́ tʋ ɩsɛ . Pə ́ la - mɛɣɛ ha , na ɩ ́ saalɩ yem . Pə taɣa pʋlʋ tɔɔ , maa la mə pɔɔlɛ taa kɛ ́ təmlɛ kʋpampantɛ natəlɩ , nte paa paa kɛɛsa - mɛɣɛ tə tɔm , ɩ ́ taa tisi tɔ .

text: And when the Jews were gone out of the synagogue , the Gentiles besought that these words might be preached to them the next sabbath .
text2: Waatʋ wei Pɔɔlɩ na Paanapasɩ pa lɩɩ Yuta nyə ́ ma təkotile taa tɔ , pa tɔma - wɛ sɩ pá la suulu na pá kɔɔ cele waalɩ kʋyakʋ kʋhɛɛsʋɣʋ wule , na pá tasa tɔm tənɛ ɩnəɣɩ yɔɣɔtʋɣʋ .

text: Now when the congregation was broken up , many of the Jews and religious proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas : who , speaking to them , persuaded them to continue in the grace of God .
text2: Pa kɔma na pá ya ɩlɛna Yuta nyə ́ ma na mpa paa sʋʋ Yuta nyə ́ ma Ɩsɔsɛɛlɛ taa kɛ ́ kʋsʋʋ tɔ , pa paɣalɛ hu Pɔɔlɩ na Paanapasɩ pa waalɩ . Na pɛlɛ pá sɔɔsɩ - wɛɣɛ apalʋtʋ sɩ pá yoo toŋ kɛ Ɩsɔ pɛɛlɛɛ tɔm taa .

text: And the next sabbath day came almost the whole city together to hear the word of God .
text2: Kʋyakʋ kʋhɛɛsʋɣʋ lɛŋkʋ kɔma na kʋ tala tɔ , pə wɛ ɩsɩɩ ɩcatɛ yəlaa təna kotina sɩ pa nɩɩkɩ Tacaa tɔm .

text: But when the Jews saw the multitudes , they were filled with envy , and spake against those things which were spoken by Paul , contradicting and blaspheming .
text2: Yuta nyə ́ ma nawa samaa kota mpʋ , ɩlɛna pə haŋ pa taa kɛ ́ teu , na pá tɔŋ sɩ nti Pɔɔlɩ yɔɣɔtəɣɩ tɔ tə fɛɩ mpʋ , na pá tʋʋkɩ - ɩ .

text: Then Paul and Barnabas waxed bold , and said , It was necessary that the word of God should first have been spoken to you : but seeing ye put it from you , and judge yourselves unworthy of everlasting life , lo , we turn to the Gentiles .
text2: Tənaɣa Pɔɔlɩ na Paanapasɩ pa heela - wɛ na apalʋtʋ sɩ : Pɩɩ wɛɛ sɩ mɛɣɛ pá caaləna Ɩsɔ Tɔm heeluɣu təcəcɩ na pə ́ cɔ ́ . Ama timpi ɩ ́ kisa - tɩ na ɩ ́ na sɩ ɩ ́ ta kɛ ́ weesuɣu ŋku kɩɩ tɛŋ tɔ kʋ nyə ́ ma tɔ , tɔʋ , tá mələɣəna mpa pa ta kɛ Yuta nyə ́ ma tɔ pɛlɛ pa tɔɔ ɩlɛ .

text: For so hath the Lord commanded us , saying , I have set thee to be a light of the Gentiles , that thou shouldest be for salvation unto the ends of the earth .
text2: Nti Tacaa heela - tʋ tɔɣɔlɛ sɩ : Ma sɩɩ - mɛɣɛ piitimnaa hɛkʋ ɩsɩɩ fətəla kɛ ́ . Ɩ ́ la na mpa pa wɛ hatoo pooluŋ taa tɔ pə ́ ya pa nyɔɔŋ .

text: And when the Gentiles heard this , they were glad , and glorified the word of the Lord : and as many as were ordained to eternal life believed .
text2: Mpa pa ta kɛ Yuta nyə ́ ma tɔ , pa nɩɩ tɔm tənɛ , ɩlɛna pa laŋa hʋlʋmɩ sɔsɔm , na pá sʋʋ Tacaa tɔm kɛ pʋɣʋlʋɣʋ . Pa təna mpa pa kɛ ́ sɩ pá hiki weesuɣu ŋku kɩɩ tɛŋ tɔ pa mʋwa Tacaa tɔm .

text: And the word of the Lord was published throughout all the region .
text2: Tacaa tɔm tɔŋna yɛkʋɣʋ kɛ hɔɣɔlʋɣʋ ŋkʋ kʋ təna kʋ taa .

text: But the Jews stirred up the devout and honourable women , and the chief men of the city , and raised persecution against Paul and Barnabas , and expelled them out of their coasts .
text2: Ama Yuta nyə ́ ma sɔsa alaa toŋtʋnaa mpa pa təŋaɣa Yuta nyə ́ ma mpaaʋ tɔ , na pá kpɛŋna ɩcatɛ nyʋɣʋ nyə ́ ma napəlɩ tɔtɔ . Tənaɣa pa sʋʋ Pɔɔlɩ na Paanapasɩ kɛ kʋnyɔŋ tʋɣʋ , na pá ləsɩ - wɛɣɛ tɛtʋ .

text: But they shook off the dust of their feet against them , and came unto Iconium .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Pɔɔlɩ - wɛ pa lɩɩwa , ɩlɛna pá kpiisi pa ntaŋkpala mʋsʋɣʋ , na pá tɛɛ Ɩkʋniyɔm .

text: And the disciples were filled with joy , and with the Holy Ghost .
text2: Tacaa təŋlaa mpa pa wɛ Antiyɔka tɔ pa laŋhʋlʋmlɛ fɛɩ kɛɛsʋɣʋ , na Feesuɣu Naŋŋtʋ toŋ tɔɔ pa kiŋ kɛ sɔsɔm .

text: And it came to pass in Iconium , that they went both together into the synagogue of the Jews , and so spake , that a great multitude both of the Jews and also of the Greeks believed .
text2: Pɔɔlɩ na Paanapasɩ pa tala Ɩkʋniyɔm . Ɩlɛna pá sʋʋ Yuta nyə ́ ma təkotile taa na pá yɔɣɔtɩ ɩsəna mpi pə wɛɛ tɔ . Haləna Yuta nyə ́ ma na mpa pa ta kɛ Yuta nyə ́ ma tɔ pa tuutuuma tisi na pá mʋ Ɩsɔ Tɔm .

text: But the unbelieving Jews stirred up the Gentiles , and made their minds evil affected against the brethren .
text2: Tənaɣa Yuta nyə ́ ma mpa pa kisa Ɩsɔ Tɔm ntɩ tə mʋɣʋ tɔ , pa sɔta mpa pa ta kɛ Yuta nyə ́ ma tɔ sɩ pá nyənɩ tá taapalaa kɛ asaɣaa .

text: Long time therefore abode they speaking boldly in the Lord , which gave testimony unto the word of his grace , and granted signs and wonders to be done by their hands .
text2: Pɔɔlɩ na Paanapasɩ pa caɣa Ɩkʋniyɔm na pə ́ leeli . Pa lakaɣa pa faacinaa na apalʋtʋ , na pá wɛna naani kɛ sɔsɔm kɛ Tacaa tɔɔ . Pə ́ cɔ ́ Tacaa ná hʋlaɣaa sɩ waasʋnaa mpa pa tɔŋna lapʋ kɛ ɩ pɛɛlɛɛ tɔm tɔɔ tɔ pa wɛna tampana . Pə taɣa pʋlʋ , ɩ yelaa na pá pəsɩ na pá lakɩ Ɩsɔ kɔkɔlɔ nyəm na piti təma .

text: But the multitude of the city was divided : and part held with the Jews , and part with the apostles .
text2: Tənaɣa ɩcatɛ yəlaa faɣa tɔm naalɛ , lɛlaa ná wɛ Yuta nyə ́ ma tɔɔ , na lɛlaa kɛ tillaa tɔɔ .

text: And when there was an assault made both of the Gentiles , and also of the Jews with their rulers , to use them despitefully , and to stone them ,
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Yuta nyə ́ ma na mpa pa ta kɛ Yuta nyə ́ ma tɔ na pa sɔsaa pa caɣaa na pá yɔɣɔtɩ sɩ paa tʋ tillaa sɔsaa mpɛɣɛ kʋnyɔŋ . Paa yoo - wɛɣɛ pɛɛ na pá kʋ .

text: They were ware of it , and fled unto Lystra and Derbe , cities of Lycaonia , and unto the region that lieth round about :
text2: Pɛlɛ pa nɩɩ mpʋ , ɩlɛna pá se na pá məŋna Lisitəla na Tɛləpɩ na pə cɔlɔ acalɛɛ kɛ Likaonii tɛtʋ taa .

text: And there they preached the gospel .
text2: Ɩlɛna pá sʋʋ Laapaalɩ Kʋpaŋ heeluɣu kɛ təna .

text: And there sat a certain man at Lystra , impotent in his feet , being a cripple from his mother ' s womb , who never had walked :
text2: Apalʋ nɔɣɔlʋ ɩ ka wɛ Lisitəla na ɩ ́ wɛ atɛɣɛ tam , nɔɔhɛɛ tɔɔ ɩɩ səŋəɣɩ . Pa lʋla - ɩ na kaakalətʋ , ɩ ta tɩɩ fɛlɩ ɩ nɔɔhɛɛ tɔɔ kɛ ́ fɛlʋɣʋ maɣamaɣa .

text: The same heard Paul speak : who stedfastly beholding him , and perceiving that he had faith to be healed ,
text2: Ɩ caɣaa na ɩ ́ nɩɩkɩ Pɔɔlɩ tɔm , ɩlɛna ɩ ́ lɛ ́ ɩ ́ nyənɩ - ɩ təpiŋŋ , na ɩ ́ ná sɩ ɩ wɛna naani sɩ ɩ ká hiki alaafəya .

text: Said with a loud voice , Stand upright on thy feet . And he leaped and walked .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Pɔɔlɩ tɔma - ɩ na nɔɣɔ sɔsaɣa sɩ : Kʋlɩ , səŋ təye kɛ ́ nyá nɔɔhɛɛ tɔɔ . Tənaɣa apalʋ ɩnɩ ɩ ŋmaa ɩ nɔɔhɛɛ tɔɔ na ɩ ́ sʋʋ tɔntɛ .

text: And when the people saw what Paul had done , they lifted up their voices , saying in the speech of Lycaonia , The gods are come down to us in the likeness of men .
text2: Samaa nawa mpi Pɔɔlɩ lapa mpʋ tɔ , ɩlɛna pá má kapusi na Likaonii tɔm taa sɩ : Pʋwɛ , tɩɩŋ pəsa yəlaa na ɩ ́ kɔɔ tá hɛkʋ .

text: And they called Barnabas , Jupiter ; and Paul , Mercurius , because he was the chief speaker .
text2: Ɩlɛna pá ha Paanapasɩ kɛ hətɛ sɩ Susi na Pɔɔlɩ sɩ Helemɛsɩ . Mpi tɔ , Pɔɔlɩ kɛna pa tɔm yɔɣɔtʋlʋ .

text: Then the priest of Jupiter , which was before their city , brought oxen and garlands unto the gates , and would have done sacrifice with the people .
text2: Tənaɣa wei ɩ ka fɛɛnaɣa pa tʋɣʋ Susi ŋku kʋ kutuluɣu ka wɛ ɩcatɛ nɔɣɔ tɔ , ɩ kɔna nɔnɔɔsɩ tɛɛ kɛ ́ latəcɛnaa na pá tema - wɛɣɛ yaayenaa . Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ ɩ ́ na samaa pa luuŋ lapa sɩ pá fɛɛnɩ tillaa .

text: Which when the apostles , Barnabas and Paul , heard of , they rent their clothes , and ran in among the people , crying out ,
text2: Ama tillaa naalɛ ɩnɩ ɩ nɩɩ mpʋ . Ɩlɛna pá cəlɩ pa wontu , na pá se na pá polo samaa taa , na pá pɔɔsɩ - wɛ na nɔɣɔ sɔsaɣa sɩ :

text: And saying , Sirs , why do ye these things ? We also are men of like passions with you , and preach unto you that ye should turn from these vanities unto the living God , which made heaven , and earth , and the sea , and all things that are therein :
text2: Apalaa mɛ , pepe tɔɔ kɛ ́ ɩ ́ lakɩ mpʋ ? Tá kɛ ́ yəlaa kɛ ́ ɩsɩɩ mɛ mɛɛ . Laapaalɩ Kʋpaŋ kɛ tə kɔna - mɛ , na tə heeliɣi - mɛ sɩ ɩ ́ yele mə nyɛntɛ tɩɩŋ , na ɩ ́ məlɩ Ɩsɔ wei ɩ wɛɛ tɔ ɩ kiŋ . Ɩnɩ ɩ lapəna atɛ na teŋku na ɩsɔtaa na pə təna mpi pə wɛ pə taa tɔ .

text: Who in times past suffered all nations to walk in their own ways .
text2: Pɩɩsɩ nsi sɩ tɛɛwa tɔ sɩ taa Ɩsɔ ɩnɩ ɩ yelaa sɩ paa yəlaa mpa pá təŋ mpaaŋ wei pa nɔkaa tɔ .

text: Nevertheless he left not himself without witness , in that he did good , and gave us rain from heaven , and fruitful seasons , filling our hearts with food and gladness .
text2: Pəyele tam ɩ lapa sɩ pá nana - ɩ na kʋpantʋnaa mpa ɩ lakɩ tɔ pa kiŋ . Hatoo ɩsɔtaa kɛ ́ ɩ yekina na ye pə ́ tala tɛʋ nɩɩʋ kʋ nɩɩ - mɛ , na pə ́ tala kʋtɔɣɔʋ pɩɩʋ kʋ pɩɩ na ɩ ́ hiki , na ɩ ́ haakɩ - mɛɣɛ tɔɣɔnaɣa na laŋhʋlʋmlɛ kʋɣɩ - mɛɣɛ sɔsɔm .

text: And with these sayings scarce restrained they the people , that they had not done sacrifice unto them .
text2: Paa na tillaa kɛɛsa samaa kɛ tɔmnaa panɛ tɔ , kam na kam kɛ ́ na pə ́ cɔ ́ pá pəsɩ na pá taŋ - wɛ sɩ pá taa fɛɛnɩ - wɛ .

text: And there came thither certain Jews from Antioch and Iconium , who persuaded the people , and , having stoned Paul , drew him out of the city , supposing he had been dead .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Yuta nyə ́ ma napəlɩ pa lɩɩna Pisiti Antiyɔka na Ɩkʋniyɔm na pá tala . Ɩlɛna pá la na samaa mʋ pa ləmaɣasəlɛ , na pá yoo Pɔɔlɩ kɛ pɛɛ sɩ pa kʋɣɩ - ɩ . Pə kɔma na pá hʋʋ sɩ ɩ tɛma səpʋ , ɩlɛna pá tuu - ɩ na pá pɛtɩ - ɩ ɩcatɛ na waalɩ .

text: Howbeit , as the disciples stood round about him , he rose up , and came into the city : and the next day he departed with Barnabas to Derbe .
text2: Ama Ɩsɔ sɛɛlaa kɔma na pá kotina - ɩ , ɩlɛna ɩ ́ kʋlɩ na ɩ ́ sʋʋ ɩcatɛ taa . Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ pə tɛʋ kʋfemuɣu ɩ na Paanapasɩ pa tɛɛ Tɛləpɩ .

text: And when they had preached the gospel to that city , and had taught many , they returned again to Lystra , and to Iconium , and Antioch ,
text2: Pɔɔlɩ na Paanapasɩ pa nika Laapaalɩ Kʋpaŋ heeluɣu kɛ Tɛləpɩ , ɩlɛna pá hiki yəlaa paɣalɛ mpa pa təŋəɣɩ Tacaa tɔ . Pəlɛ pə waalɩ pa məla Lisitəla , na Ɩkʋniyɔm , na Pisiti Antiyɔka .

text: Confirming the souls of the disciples , and exhorting them to continue in the faith , and that we must through much tribulation enter into the kingdom of God .
text2: Na pá sɔɔsəɣɩ Ɩsɔ sɛɛlaa kɛ toŋ , na pá tasəɣɩ - wɛɣɛ apalʋtʋ sɩ pá tɔkɩ Ɩsɔ mpaaʋ kɛ teu təkeŋkeŋke . Na pá heeliɣi - wɛ sɩ wahala na wahala kɛ ́ na pə ́ cɔ ́ tə ́ sʋʋ Ɩsɔ Kawulaɣa .

text: And when they had ordained them elders in every church , and had prayed with fasting , they commended them to the Lord , on whom they believed .
text2: Paa Yesu sɛɛlaa kpekəle nte tə taa , pa kpa nyʋɣʋ nyə ́ ma , na pá hɔkɔ nɔɔsɩ na pá sələmɩ Ɩsɔ . Ɩlɛna pá tʋ - wɛɣɛ Tacaa wei ɩ tɔɔ pa tisa pa yuŋ tɔ ɩ niŋ taa .

text: And after they had passed throughout Pisidia , they came to Pamphylia .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ tillaa faɣana Pisiti hɔɣɔlʋɣʋ taa na pá tala Pamfili hɔɣɔlʋɣʋ taa .

text: And when they had preached the word in Perga , they went down into Attalia :
text2: Pa heela Ɩsɔ Tɔm kɛ Pɛɛsɩ , ɩlɛna pá tɛɛ Atalii .

text: And thence sailed to Antioch , from whence they had been recommended to the grace of God for the work which they fulfilled .
text2: Pa kʋla təna , ɩlɛna pá sʋʋ kpɩɩlʋɣʋ sɩ pa tɛɛkɩ Antiyɔka . Antiyɔka tənaɣa paa sələməna - wɛ na Ɩsɔ sɩ ɩ ́ səna - wɛ na pə ́ cɔ ́ pá sʋʋ pa təmlɛ nte pa tɛma lapʋ kɛ ɩsəntɔ tɔ tə taa .

text: And when they were come , and had gathered the church together , they rehearsed all that God had done with them , and how he had opened the door of faith unto the Gentiles .
text2: Tillaa tala Antiyɔka , ɩlɛna pá koti Yesu sɛɛlaa , na pá kɛɛsɩ - wɛɣɛ mpi Ɩsɔ lapa pa kiŋ tɔ , na ɩsəna ɩ ha mpaaʋ sɩ mpa pa ta kɛ Yuta nyə ́ ma tɔ pɛlɛ pa maɣamaɣa pá mʋ Ɩsɔ Tɔm tɔ .

text: And there they abode long time with the disciples .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ pá na Ɩsɔ sɛɛlaa pa caɣaa na pə ́ leeli pəcɔ .

text: And certain men which came down from Judaea taught the brethren , and said , Except ye be circumcised after the manner of Moses , ye cannot be saved .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ yəlaa napəlɩ pa lɩɩna Yuta na pá kɔɔ Antiyɔka , na pá sʋʋ tá taapalaa kɛ sɛɣɛsʋɣʋ sɩ : Ye ɩ ́ ta pɛlɩ ɩsɩɩ Moisi sɩɩwa tɔ , pə kaa ya mə nyɔɔŋ .

text: When therefore Paul and Barnabas had no small dissension and disputation with them , they determined that Paul and Barnabas , and certain other of them , should go up to Jerusalem unto the apostles and elders about this question .
text2: Tənaɣa Pɔɔlɩ na Paanapasɩ pa kpɛɛsəna - wɛɣɛ - tɩ . Ɩlɛna pá hɔ pə tɔɔ kɛ ́ sɔsɔm pə tɩɩ fɛɩ . Tənaɣa pa tɔma sɩ : Ye mpʋ Pɔɔlɩ na Paanapasɩ na Antiyɔka nyə ́ ma napəlɩ paa polo Yosalɛm , na pá pɔɔsɩ tɔm tənɛɣɛ tillaa na nyʋɣʋ nyə ́ ma .

text: And being brought on their way by the church , they passed through Phenice and Samaria , declaring the conversion of the Gentiles : and they caused great joy unto all the brethren .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Yesu sɛɛlaa kʋsa Pɔɔlɩ - wɛ na pá tili , na pá təŋna Fenisii na Samalii , na pá kɛɛsəɣɩ yəlaa kɛ ɩsəna mpa pa ta kɛ Yuta nyə ́ ma tɔ kaɣana pa pəsəna Ɩsɔ tɔɔ tɔ . Tá taapalaa təna nɩɩ tɔm tənɛ , ɩlɛna pa laŋa hʋlʋmɩ sɔsɔm .

text: And when they were come to Jerusalem , they were received of the church , and of the apostles and elders , and they declared all things that God had done with them .
text2: Pa tala Yosalɛm , ɩlɛna Yesu sɛɛlaa mʋ - wɛɣɛ teu , na pə ́ kpɛŋna tillaa na nyʋɣʋ nyə ́ ma . Ɩlɛna pá kɛɛsɩ - wɛɣɛ ɩsəna Ɩsɔ lapəna pa niŋ tɔ .

text: But there rose up certain of the sect of the Pharisees which believed , saying , That it was needful to circumcise them , and to command them to keep the law of Moses .
text2: Tənaɣa Falisanaa kpekəle nyə ́ ma napəlɩ , mpa pa mʋ Tacaa tɔm tɔ , pa kʋlaa na pá tɔ sɩ : Mpa pa ta kɛ Yuta nyə ́ ma na pá sʋʋ Ɩsɔ sɛɛʋ tɔ , pə wɛɛ sɩ pá pɛlɩ kɛ ́ , na pá təŋ Moisi kʋsəsɩɩtʋ .

text: And the apostles and elders came together for to consider of this matter .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ tillaa na nyʋɣʋ nyə ́ ma pa kotaa sɩ pa paasəɣəna tɔm tənɛ .

text: And when there had been much disputing , Peter rose up , and said unto them , Men and brethren , ye know how that a good while ago God made choice among us , that the Gentiles by my mouth should hear the word of the gospel , and believe .
text2: Pa hɔma tə tɔɔ kɛ ́ teu , ɩlɛna Piyɛɛ kʋlɩ na ɩ ́ yɔɣɔtɩ sɩ : Ma taapalaa mɛ , mə maɣamaɣa ɩ ́ nyəmá sɩ saa nɔɣɔlʋ Ɩsɔ ləsa - m mə hɛkʋ , sɩ má polo má heeli mpa pa ta kɛ Yuta nyə ́ ma tɔɣɔ Laapaalɩ Kʋpaŋ na pá nɩɩ na pá mʋ .

text: And God , which knoweth the hearts , bare them witness , giving them the Holy Ghost , even as he did unto us ;
text2: Na Ɩsɔ wei ɩ nyəmá yəlaa lotunaa tɔ , ɩ ha - wɛɣɛ Feesuɣu Naŋŋtʋ ɩsɩɩ ɩ ka ha tá tɔ , sɩ pə ́ hʋ ́ lɩ ́ sɩ ɩ mʋ - wɛ .

text: And put no difference between us and them , purifying their hearts by faith .
text2: Ɩ ta faɣasɩ ta na - wɛɣɛ paa pəcɔ . Ɩ taɣana pa lotunaa taa kɛ ́ pa mʋɣʋ Ɩsɔ Tɔm tɔ pə tɔɔ .

text: Now therefore why tempt ye God , to put a yoke upon the neck of the disciples , which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear ?
text2: Ye mpʋ ɩlɛ , ɩ ́ caa ɩ ́ maɣasɩ Ɩsɔ na ɩ ́ sʋkəna Ɩsɔ sɛɛlaa kɛ təlasɩ kɛ səɣəla nna ta na ta caanaa caanaa tə ta pəsɩ na tə ́ səɣəlɩ tɔ suwe ?

text: But we believe that through the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ we shall be saved , even as they .
text2: Ama tə nyəmá teu sɩ pə yapa tá nyɔɔŋ kɛ Yesu pɛɛlɛɛ tɔɔ kɛ ́ teitei ɩsɩɩ pə lapʋ pɛlɛ pa kiŋ tɔ .

text: Then all the multitude kept silence , and gave audience to Barnabas and Paul , declaring what miracles and wonders God had wrought among the Gentiles by them .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ kotuɣu taa yəlaa suma təkulum na pá keŋ ŋkpaŋŋ . Ɩlɛna Pɔɔlɩ na Paanapasɩ pá kɛɛsəɣɩ - wɛɣɛ ɩsəna Ɩsɔ lapəna pa niŋ kɛ kɔkɔlɔ nyəm na piti təma kɛ mpa pa ta kɛ Yuta nyə ́ ma tɔ pa hɛkʋ tɔ .

text: And after they had held their peace , James answered , saying , Men and brethren , hearken unto me :
text2: Pɔɔlɩ - wɛ pa tɛma kɛɛsʋɣʋ kɛ pa nyəntʋ , ɩlɛna Saakɩ náá kʋlɩ na ɩ ́ tɔ sɩ : Ma taapalaa ɩ ́ nɩɩ ma tɔm .

text: Simeon hath declared how God at the first did visit the Gentiles , to take out of them a people for his name .
text2: Simɔŋ kɛɛsa ɩsəna hatoo pə kancaalaɣa Ɩsɔ paasəna mpa pa ta kɛ Yuta nyə ́ ma tɔ sɩ ɩ ləsəɣɩ pa taa kɛ ́ yəlaa na pá pəsɩ ɩ nyə ́ ma tɔ .

text: And to this agree the words of the prophets ; as it is written ,
text2: Na mpʋ ɩnɩ pə lɩɩ teitei ɩsɩɩ Ɩsɔ kʋyɔɣɔtʋtʋ tɛləsəlaa ka yɔɣɔtaa tɔ . Mpʋ ɩnəɣɩ pa tɩɩ ŋmaa Ɩsɔ Tɔm taa sɩ :

text: After this I will return , and will build again the tabernacle of David , which is fallen down ; and I will build again the ruins thereof , and I will set it up :
text2: Tacaa yɔɣɔta mpʋ sɩ , pəlɛ pə waalɩ ɩlɛ maa məlɩ . Na maa kʋsɩ Tafiiti təyaɣa ŋka kaa yɔkaa tɔ . Maa taɣanɩ ɩ ncaa . Maa səŋsɩ ɩ təyaɣa ŋkɛ .

text: That the residue of men might seek after the Lord , and all the Gentiles , upon whom my name is called , saith the Lord , who doeth all these things .
text2: Na pə ́ ha mpaaʋ kɛ yəlaa lɛlaa təna na pá pɛɛkɩ Tacaa . Ɩlɛna pə ́ kpɛŋna piitimnaa təna mpa ma yaawa sɩ pá pəsɩ ma nyə ́ ma tɔ .

text: Known unto God are all his works from the beginning of the world .
text2: Tacaa wei ɩ yelaa na pá nyɩ tɔm tənɛɣɛ hatoo lɔŋ tɔ , ɩnɩ ɩ yɔɣɔtəna mpʋ .

text: Wherefore my sentence is , that we trouble not them , which from among the Gentiles are turned to God :
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Saakɩ tasaa sɩ : Pə tɔɔ kɛ ́ má , ma nawa sɩ , pə fɛɩ ɩsɩɩ pá tʋ wahala kɛ mpa pa ta kɛ Yuta nyə ́ ma na pá pəsəna Ɩsɔ tɔɔ tɔ .

text: But that we write unto them , that they abstain from pollutions of idols , and from fornication , and from things strangled , and from blood .
text2: Ama nti tɔɣɔlɛ sɩ , tɩɩ la - wɛɣɛ takəlaɣa sɩ pá kii asilima nantʋ kʋlalaatʋ , na pá yele tɛtɛlakasɩ . Pá taa tɔɣɔ mpi pa ta lɛntɩ tɔ pə nantʋ , na caləm tɔtɔ .

text: For Moses of old time hath in every city them that preach him , being read in the synagogues every sabbath day .
text2: Pə taɣa pʋlʋ tɔɔ , hatoo sɔsaa taa yəlaa tɔŋna Moisi kʋsəsɩɩtʋ sɛɣɛsʋɣʋ kɛ paa ɩcatɛ nte tə taa , na pá kaləɣɩ - təɣɩ Yuta nyə ́ ma təkotilenaa taa kɛ ́ paa kʋyakʋ kʋhɛɛsʋɣʋ ŋku .

text: Then pleased it the apostles and elders , with the whole church , to send chosen men of their own company to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas ; namely , Judas surnamed Barsabas , and Silas , chief men among the brethren :
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ tillaa na nyʋɣʋ nyə ́ ma na Yesu sɛɛlaa təna tɔma sɩ paa ləsɩ pa hɛkʋ kɛ napələɣɩ , na pá na Pɔɔlɩ na Paanapasɩ pá polo Antiyɔka . Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ pa ləsa Yuti wei pa yaa sɩ Paasapasɩ tɔ na Silaasɩ . Tá taapalaa tʋkaɣana apalaa mpɛ pa naalɛɣɛ .

text: And they wrote letters by them after this manner ; The apostles and elders and brethren send greeting unto the brethren which are of the Gentiles in Antioch and Syria and Cilicia :
text2: Ɩlɛna pá tʋ takəlaɣa kɛ pa niŋ taa . Pa yɔɣɔta ka taa sɩ : Tá taapalaa mpa mɛ ɩ ́ tá kɛ ́ Yuta nyə ́ ma na ɩ ́ wɛ Antiyɔka na Silii na Silisii pə tɛtʋ taa tɔ , taɣa tillaa na nyʋɣʋ nyə ́ ma kɛ cənɛ , tə ha - mɛɣɛ sɛɛtʋ .

text: Forasmuch as we have heard , that certain which went out from us have troubled you with words , subverting your souls , saying , Ye must be circumcised , and keep the law : to whom we gave no such commandment :
text2: Tə nɩɩwa sɩ yəlaa lɩɩ tá hɛkʋ cənɛ na pá pona - mɛɣɛ tɔmnaa , na pə ́ liɣiti - mɛ na pə ́ tʋ - mɛɣɛ piti . Nti pa heela - mɛɣɛ mpʋ ɩnɩ tɔ tə ta lɩɩna tá kiŋ yoo .

text: It seemed good unto us , being assembled with one accord , to send chosen men unto you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul ,
text2: Pə tɔɔ kɛ ́ tə maɣasaa na tá təna təpaɩ tə ́ tisi sɩ tə ́ ləsɩ yəlaa na tə ́ tili - wɛɣɛ mə cɔlɔ . Tə caa sɩ pá təŋ tá taapalaa kʋpama Paanapasɩ na Pɔɔlɩ ,

text: Men that have hazarded their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ .
text2: mpa səm cɛɛ Tacaa Yesu Kilisiti təmlɛ tɔɔ tɔ , na pá kpɛntɩ mpaaʋ .

text: We have sent therefore Judas and Silas , who shall also tell you the same things by mouth .
text2: Pə tɔɔ kɛ ́ tə tiliɣi Yuti na Silaasɩ sɩ pá kɛɛsɩ - mɛ na pa nɔɔsɩ kɛ tɔmnaa mpa tə ŋmaa takəlaɣa taa cənɛ tɔ .

text: For it seemed good to the Holy Ghost , and to us , to lay upon you no greater burden than these necessary things ;
text2: Pə taɣa pʋlʋ tɔɔ , Feesuɣu Naŋŋtʋ na tá maɣamaɣa tə sɩɩwa sɩ , tə kaa sʋkɩ - mɛɣɛ səɣəla naalɩ na pə tá kɛ ́ nti tə kɛ ́ sɔsɔɔntʋ na tə ́ kɛ ́ paa wei ɩ ́ tɔkɩ tɔ .

text: That ye abstain from meats offered to idols , and from blood , and from things strangled , and from fornication : from which if ye keep yourselves , ye shall do well . Fare ye well .
text2: Ntəɣəlɛ sɩ ɩ ́ kii nantʋ kʋlalaatʋ , na caləm , na wontu nti pa ta lɛntɩ tɔ . Ɩ ́ yele tɛtɛlakasɩ təkpataa . Ye ɩ kii mpʋ ɩnɩ pə təna pə maɣaa . Pə lapa wulee .

text: So when they were dismissed , they came to Antioch : and when they had gathered the multitude together , they delivered the epistle :
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ pa ya təma , na mpa pa tila mpʋ tɔ pá tɛɛ Antiyɔka , na pá tala na pá koti Ɩsɔ sɛɛlaa kpekəle təna , na pá cɛlɛ - wɛɣɛ takəlaɣa kanɛ .

text: Which when they had read , they rejoiced for the consolation .
text2: Pa kala takəlaɣa kanɛ , ɩlɛna pa laakalənaa caɣa təntəmlɛ na pa laŋa hʋlʋmɩ .

text: And Judas and Silas , being prophets also themselves , exhorted the brethren with many words , and confirmed them .
text2: Yuti na Silaasɩ pɛlɛ pa maɣamaɣa paa kɛ ́ Ɩsɔ kʋyɔɣɔtʋtʋ tɛləsəlaa kɛ ́ , tənaɣa pa lapa tá taapalaa kɛ faaci kɛ sɔsɔm , na pə ́ ha - wɛɣɛ apalʋtʋ na toŋ .

text: And after they had tarried there a space , they were let go in peace from the brethren unto the apostles .
text2: Pa caɣa tənaɣa wɛɛ naalɛ , ɩlɛna tá taapalaa yele - wɛ sɩ pá məlɩ mpa paa tila - wɛ tɔ pa kiŋ , na pá kooli sɩ Ɩsɔ ɩ ́ ha - wɛɣɛ mpaaʋ kʋpaŋkʋ .

text: Notwithstanding it pleased Silas to abide there still .
text2: Ama Silaasɩ luɣu ná lapa na ɩ ́ saalɩ təna .

text: Paul also and Barnabas continued in Antioch , teaching and preaching the word of the Lord , with many others also .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Pɔɔlɩ na Paanapasɩ pa caɣa Antiyɔka na pá sɛɣɛsəɣɩ Tacaa tɔm na pá lakɩ waasʋ . Pá na yəlaa lɛlaa paɣalɛ pa lakaɣana pə tənaɣa mpʋ .

text: And some days after Paul said unto Barnabas , Let us go again and visit our brethren in every city where we have preached the word of the Lord , and see how they do .
text2: Pə kɔma na pə ́ leeli , ɩlɛna Pɔɔlɩ tɔ Paanapasɩ sɩ : Tə məlɩ tə cɔɔ acalɛɛ nna a taa tə heela Tacaa tɔm tɔ , na tə ́ ná ta taapalaa cakəlɛ wɛ ɩsəna tɔ .

text: And Barnabas determined to take with them John , whose surname was Mark .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Paanapasɩ luɣu ná lapa sɩ pá kpɛŋna Yohaanɩ wei pa cuɣusaa sɩ Maləkɩ tɔ .

text: But Paul thought not good to take him with them , who departed from them from Pamphylia , and went not with them to the work .
text2: Ama Pɔɔlɩ ná nawa sɩ pə ta nəɣəsəna pá tasa - ɩ kpaɣaʋ . Pə taɣa pʋlʋ tɔɔ , ɩ ka tɛma - wɛɣɛ yeluɣu kɛ hatoo Pamfili na ɩ ́ tɛɛ . Ɩ ta tasa - wɛɣɛ təŋʋɣʋ kɛ pa təmlɛ təlatɛ taa kɛ ́ tiili .

text: And the contention was so sharp between them , that they departed asunder one from the other : and so Barnabas took Mark , and sailed unto Cyprus ;
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ pa hɔma tə tɔɔ kɛ ́ sɔsɔm na pá ya təma , na Paanapasɩ kpaɣa Maləkɩ na pá sʋʋ kpɩɩlʋɣʋ na pá tɛɛ Sipili .

text: And Paul chose Silas , and departed , being recommended by the brethren unto the grace of God .
text2: Ɩlɛna Pɔɔlɩ náá nyənɩ na ɩ ́ kpaɣa Silaasɩ na tá taapalaa sələməna - wɛɣɛ Ɩsɔ . Ɩlɛna pá kpaɣa mpaaʋ .

text: And he went through Syria and Cilicia , confirming the churches .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ pa tɔma Silii na Silisii pa tɛtʋnaa taa , na pá sɔɔsəɣɩ Yesu sɛɛlaa kɛ apalʋtʋ kɛ Ɩsɔ mpaaʋ taa .

text: Then came he to Derbe and Lystra : and , behold , a certain disciple was there , named Timotheus , the son of a certain woman , which was a Jewess , and believed ; but his father was a Greek :
text2: Pɔɔlɩ tala Tɛləpɩ , ɩlɛna ɩ ́ tɛɛ Lisitəla . Ɩsɔ sɛɛlʋ nɔɣɔlʋ ɩ ka wɛ təna na pá yaa - ɩ sɩ Timotee . Ɩ too ka kɛ ́ Yuta tʋ , ama ɩ ka pəsa Kilisiti təŋlʋ , ɩ caa ná kɛ ́ Kəlɛɛkɩ tʋ .

text: Which was well reported of by the brethren that were at Lystra and Iconium .
text2: Ta taapalaa mpa paa wɛ Lisitəla na Ɩkʋniyɔm tɔ pa pʋɣʋlaɣa - ɩ teu .

text: Him would Paul have to go forth with him ; and took and circumcised him because of the Jews which were in those quarters : for they knew all that his father was a Greek .
text2: Pɔɔlɩ luɣu lapa sɩ ɩ təŋsəɣɩ - ɩ ɩ waalɩ , ɩlɛna ɩ kpaɣa - ɩ . Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ ɩ pɛla - ɩ Yuta nyə ́ ma mpa paa wɛ hɔɣɔləŋ ɩnɩ ɩ taa tɔ pa tɔɔ . Pə taɣa pʋlʋ tɔɔ , pa təna paa nyəmá sɩ ɩ caa kɛ ́ Kəlɛɛkɩ tʋ .

text: And as they went through the cities , they delivered them the decrees for to keep , that were ordained of the apostles and elders which were at Jerusalem .
text2: Ye Pɔɔlɩ - wɛ , pa tala paa ɩcatɛ nte , pa kɛɛsəɣɩ Ɩsɔ sɛɛlaa kɛ pə təna mpi Yosalɛm tillaa na nyʋɣʋ nyə ́ ma pa sɩɩwa tɔ , na pa heeliɣi - wɛ sɩ pá təŋ nti pɛlɛ pa yɔɣɔtaa tɔ .

text: And so were the churches established in the faith , and increased in number daily .
text2: Yesu sɛɛlaa tɔŋna toŋ hikuɣu kɛ pa Ɩsɔ sɛɛʋ taa na pa nyɔɔŋ tɔŋna sɔɔsʋɣʋ kɛ paa ɩfemle nte .

text: Now when they had gone throughout Phrygia and the region of Galatia , and were forbidden of the Holy Ghost to preach the word in Asia ,
text2: Feesuɣu Naŋŋtʋ kisina - wɛ sɩ pá taa heeli Ɩsɔ Tɔm kɛ Asii tɛtʋ taa . Ɩlɛna pá faɣana Filicii na Kalatɩ tɛtʋ taa na pá tɛɛ .

text: After they were come to Mysia , they assayed to go into Bithynia : but the Spirit suffered them not .
text2: Pa tala Misii cɔlɔ ɩlɛna pá lʋ sɩ pá tɛɛ Pitinii . Ama Yesu Feesuɣu ta ha - wɛɣɛ mpaa .

text: And they passing by Mysia came down to Troas .
text2: Ɩlɛna pá təŋna Misii na pá tala Tʋlʋwasɩ kɛ kpɩɩləŋ təsəŋlɛ .

text: And a vision appeared to Paul in the night ; There stood a man of Macedonia , and prayed him , saying , Come over into Macedonia , and help us .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ pə lapa Pɔɔlɩ ɩsɩɩ toosee taka kɛ ahoo taa , na ɩ ́ ná Masetoni apalʋ nɔɣɔlʋ na ɩ ́ səŋaa na ɩ ́ wiikina - ɩ sɩ : Kɔɔ Masetoni na ń waasɩ - tʋ .

text: And after he had seen the vision , immediately we endeavored to go into Macedonia , assuredly gathering that the Lord had called us for to preach the gospel unto them .
text2: Pɔɔlɩ tɛma ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ naʋ ɩlɛna tə ́ la sɔɔlʋ sɩ tə tɛɛkɩ Masetoni . Pə taɣa pʋlʋ tɔɔ , tə nawaɣa təkelekele sɩ Ɩsɔ yaa - tʋɣʋ sɩ tə ́ polo tə ́ heeli Laapaalɩ Kʋpaŋ kɛ hɔɣɔlʋɣʋ ŋkʋ kʋ nyə ́ ma .

text: Therefore loosing from Troas , we came with a straight course to Samothracia , and the next day to Neapolis ;
text2: Tə sʋʋ kpɩɩlʋɣʋ kɛ Tʋlʋwasɩ ɩcatɛ , ɩlɛna tə ́ tɛɛ kpakpaa kɛ tɛtʋ nti lʋm cɔɔnaa na pá yaakɩ - tɩ sɩ Samatʋlasɩ tɔ . Tɛʋ fema , ɩlɛna tə ́ polo Neyapolisi ɩcatɛ .

text: And from thence to Philippi , which is the chief city of that part of Macedonia , and a colony : and we were in that city abiding certain days .
text2: Tə kʋla təna ɩlɛna tə ́ polo Masetoni hɔɣɔlʋɣʋ kancaalaɣa nyəŋkʋ ɩcatɛ nte Lom nyə ́ ma tɔkaa na pá yaa - tɛ sɩ Filipʋ tɔ . Tə caɣa wɛɛ paɣalɛ kɛ ɩcatɛ ńtɛ ́ tə taa .

text: And on the sabbath we went out of the city by a river side , where prayer was wont to be made ; and we sat down , and spake unto the women which resorted thither .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ kʋyakʋ kʋhɛɛsʋɣʋ wule tə lɩɩ ɩcatɛ taa na tə ́ polo pɔɣɔ nɔɣɔ sɩ ntanyɩ tɩɩ ná Yuta nyə ́ ma Ɩsɔ təsələmlɛ natəlɩ . Tə caɣaa ɩlɛna tə ́ yɔɣɔtəna alaa mpa pa kota təna tɔ .

text: And a certain woman named Lydia , a seller of purple , of the city of Thyatira , which worshipped God , heard us : whose heart the Lord opened , that she attended unto the things which were spoken of Paul .
text2: Pa yaa alaa mpɛ pa taa nɔɣɔlʋ sɩ Liti . Ɩ lɩɩna ɩcatɛ nte pa yaa sɩ Tiyatii tɔ , na ɩ paɣataɣaa pɔɔŋ kʋpampaŋ wei ɩ sɛɛwa tɔ , na ɩ sɛɛkaɣa Ɩsɔ . Ɩ caɣaa na ɩ ́ keŋna tá tɔm , ɩlɛna Tacaa tʋ ɩ lotu taa kɛ ́ nyəm sɩ ɩ ́ cɛkəna nti Pɔɔlɩ tɔŋna yɔɣɔtʋɣʋ tɔ .

text: And when she was baptized , and her household , she besought us , saying , If ye have judged me to be faithful to the Lord , come into my house , and abide there . And she constrained us .
text2: Tənaɣa pa sɔ Liti kɛ Ɩsɔ lʋm na halɩ pə ́ kpɛŋna ɩ təyaɣa nyə ́ ma . Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ alʋ ɩnɩ ɩ tɔma - tʋ sɩ : Ye ɩ ́ tɛma - m na mə taa sɩ ma mʋ Tacaa tɔm na tampana , ɩ ́ kɔɔ ɩ ́ sʋʋ ma tɛ . Liti sɛɛsa ɩsəlɛ kɛ sɔsɔm , ɩlɛna táá polo na tə ́ sʋʋ ɩ tɛ .

text: And it came to pass , as we went to prayer , a certain damsel possessed with a spirit of divination met us , which brought her masters much gain by soothsaying :
text2: Kʋyakʋ nakʋlɩ tə pukaɣa təsələməlɛ , ɩlɛna yom alʋ nyəŋ nɔɣɔlʋ ɩ ́ suli - tʋ . Ɩ ka nyəna ɩlɔɣɔʋ na ɩ ́ lakɩ na ɩ ́ naakɩ mpi pɩɩ la cele tɔ . Na ɩ nyə ́ ma hikaɣaa liɣitee kɛ sɔsɔm kɛ ɩ pee naʋ tɔɔ .

text: The same followed Paul and us , and cried , saying , These men are the servants of the most high God , which shew unto us the way of salvation .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ ɩ sʋʋ tá na Pɔɔlɩ kɛ təŋʋɣʋ , na ɩ ́ təkəɣɩ tá ŋkpaŋŋ sɩ : Apalaa panɛ pa kɛ ́ ɩsɔtaa Ɩsɔ Sɔsɔ təmlɛ lataa kɛ ́ . Mpaaʋ ŋku kʋ puki waasʋɣʋ kiŋ tɔ ŋkʋɣʋ pa hʋ ́ lə ́ ɣɩ ́ - mɛ .

text: And this did she many days . But Paul , being grieved , turned and said to the spirit , I command thee in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her . And he came out the same hour .
text2: Alʋ ɩnɩ ɩ təkaɣa tá ŋkpaŋŋ kɛ ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ wɛɛ paɣalɛ kɛ ́ . Pə kɔma na pə ́ nɩɩ Pɔɔlɩ na pááná kpa - ɩ , ɩlɛna ɩ ́ pəsəna ɩ tɔɔ na ɩ ́ tɔ ɩlɔɣɔʋ sɩ : Na Yesu Kilisiti toŋ , se alʋ ɩnɩ ɩ waalɩ . Tənaɣa ɩlɔɣɔʋ se alʋ waalɩ kɛ ́ kpakpaa ɩnɩ .

text: And when her masters saw that the hope of their gains was gone , they caught Paul and Silas , and drew them into the marketplace unto the rulers ,
text2: Alʋ ɩnɩ ɩ nyə ́ ma kɔma na pá ná sɩ pa liɣitee təhikile lepa , ɩlɛna pá tɔkɩ Pɔɔlɩ na Silaasɩ təkem , na pá hɔ - wɛ na pá pona ɩcatɛ sɔsaa ɩsɛntaa kɛ ́ ɩcatɛ patəma taa .

text: And brought them to the magistrates , saying , These men , being Jews , do exceedingly trouble our city ,
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ pa kpaɣa - wɛ na pá pona - wɛɣɛ Lom toŋtʋnaa kiŋ , na pá tɔ - wɛ sɩ : Ɩ ́ naa yəlaa panɛ tɔ , pa kɔŋna yooŋ kɛ tá ɩcatɛ taa . Pa kɛ ́ Yuta nyə ́ ma .

text: And teach customs , which are not lawful for us to receive , neither to observe , being Romans .
text2: Na Lom nyə ́ ma tá , mpi pə kisina - tʋ sɩ tə taa mʋ yaa tə taa la tɔ , ntəɣɩ mpɛ pa hʋ ́ lə ́ ɣɩ ́ yəlaa sɩ pá la .

text: And the multitude rose up together against them : and the magistrates rent off their clothes , and commanded to beat them .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ samaa maɣamaɣa ná təna pa tɔɔ , ɩlɛna toŋtʋnaa mpɛ pá tɔ sɩ pá wɔɣɔsɩ Pɔɔlɩ na Silaasɩ pa wontu na pá ma - wɛɣɛ akpatɛɛ .

text: And when they had laid many stripes upon them , they cast them into prison , charging the jailor to keep them safely :
text2: Pa tɛma - wɛɣɛ mapʋ kɛ ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ teu , ɩlɛna pá sʋsɩ - wɛɣɛ saləka taa , na pá heeli taŋlʋ sɩ ɩ ́ nyənəɣɩ - wɛɣɛ teu .

text: Who , having received such a charge , thrust them into the inner prison , and made their feet fast in the stocks .
text2: Taŋlʋ ná nɩɩ mpʋ ɩlɛna ɩ ́ pona - wɛɣɛ saləka naŋya ŋka ka wɛ hatoo lɔlɔ tɔ , na pá ka - wɛɣɛ ŋkeɣelee .

text: And at midnight Paul and Silas prayed , and sang praises unto God : and the prisoners heard them .
text2: Pɔɔlɩ na Silaasɩ pa tɔŋna sələmʋɣʋ na pá yooki yontu na pá saŋ Ɩsɔ , na saləkatʋnaa lɛlaa keŋna - wɛ , na ahoo pɩɩ a taa kɛ ́ teu .

text: And suddenly there was a great earthquake , so that the foundations of the prison were shaken : and immediately all the doors were opened , and every one ' s bands were loosed .
text2: Pə kɛɛsaa ɩlɛ tɛtʋ ciɣitaa kɛlɛ sɔsɔm , halɩ saləka kutuluɣu kite sele , na saləka nɔnɔɔsɩ təna tʋlɩ kpakpaa , na alukpala nna pa tʋ saləka nyə ́ ma təna tɔ a hɛtɩ .

text: And the keeper of the prison awaking out of his sleep , and seeing the prison doors open , he drew out his sword , and would have killed himself , supposing that the prisoners had been fled .
text2: Tənaɣa saləka taŋlʋ fema na ɩ ́ ná saləka nɔnɔɔsɩ tʋlaa . Ɩlɛna ɩ ́ kpɛɛ laɣatɛ sɩ ɩ kʋɣɩ ɩ tɩ . Pə taɣa pʋlʋ tɔɔ , ɩ hʋʋwa sɩ ɩsəntɔ saləkatʋnaa lɩɩwa na pá se .

text: But Paul cried with a loud voice , saying , Do thyself no harm : for we are all here .
text2: Tənaɣa Pɔɔlɩ holina toŋ sɩ : Kaɩ , taa la nyá təɣɩ asalaʋ , tá təna təpaɩ tə wɛɛ .

text: Then he called for a light , and sprang in , and came trembling , and fell down before Paul and Silas ,
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ saləka taŋlʋ tɔma sɩ pá kɔna - ɩ kɔkɔ . Ɩlɛna ɩ ́ sʋʋ saləka naŋya ŋkɛ ka taa kɛ ́ lɔŋ . Na ɩ ́ hoti Pɔɔlɩ na Silaasɩ pa tɛɛ , na ɩ ́ seliɣina sɔɣɔntʋ .

text: And brought them out , and said , Sirs , what must I do to be saved ?
text2: Ɩlɛna ɩ ́ kpaɣa - wɛ na ɩ ́ lɩɩna na ɩ ́ pɔɔsɩ - wɛ sɩ : Ma cɛnaa , ɩsənaɣa maa la na pə ́ ya - m ?

text: And they said , Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ , and thou shalt be saved , and thy house .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Pɔɔlɩ na Silaasɩ pa cɔ - ɩ sɩ : Mʋ Yesu tɔm na pə ́ ya nyá na nyá təyaɣa nyə ́ ma .

text: And they spake unto him the word of the Lord , and to all that were in his house .
text2: Pəlɛ pə waalɩ pa lapa ɩ ́ na ɩ təyaɣa nyə ́ ma tənaɣa waasʋ .

text: And he took them the same hour of the night , and washed their stripes ; and was baptized , he and all his , straightway .
text2: Taŋlʋ kpaɣa - wɛɣɛ ahoo anɩ a maɣamaɣa na ɩ ́ polo ɩ ́ nyaalɩ pa hiŋnaa . Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Pɔɔlɩ - wɛ pa sɔ ɩ ́ na ɩ təyaɣa nyə ́ ma kɛ Ɩsɔ lʋm kɛ kʋyakʋ ŋkʋ kʋ maɣamaɣa .

text: And when he had brought them into his house , he set meat before them , and rejoiced , believing in God with all his house .
text2: Ɩlɛna ɩ ́ kpaana Pɔɔlɩ na Silaasɩ kɛ ɩ təyaɣa na ɩ ́ cɛlɛ - wɛɣɛ tɔɣɔnaɣa . Apalʋ ɩnɩ na ɩ təyaɣa nyə ́ ma pa laŋhʋlʋmlɛ fɛɩna taka . Pə taɣa pʋlʋ , pa tɛma Ɩsɔ na pa taa tɔ pə tɔɔ kɛ ́ .

text: And when it was day , the magistrates sent the serjeants , saying , Let those men go .
text2: Pə kɔma na pə nyaalɩ , ɩlɛna Lom toŋtʋnaa mpɛ pá tili sɩ taŋlʋ ɩ ́ tʋlɩ Pɔɔlɩ - wɛ .

text: And the keeper of the prison told this saying to Paul , The magistrates have sent to let you go : now therefore depart , and go in peace .
text2: Tənaɣa taŋlʋ polaa na ɩ ́ heeli Pɔɔlɩ sɩ : Sɔsaa tɔma sɩ má cɛ - mɛ . Mpʋ tɔ ɩ ́ lɩɩ na ɩ ́ tɛɛ mə nyəŋkʋ .

text: But Paul said unto them , They have beaten us openly uncondemned , being Romans , and have cast us into prison ; and now do they thrust us out privily ? nay verily ; but let them come themselves and fetch us out .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Pɔɔlɩ tɔma mpa pa tila mpʋ tɔ sɩ : Halɩ taɣa Lom nyə ́ ma na pá yele na pá ma - tʋɣʋ samaa taa . Pəyele pa ta tɩɩ wiili tá tɔm taa sɩ pa naa sɩ ɩsənaɣa pə wɛɛ . Pə ́ cɔ ́ pəlɛ pə waalɩ na pá kpaɣa - tʋ na pá tʋ saləka . Ɩlɛna nɔɔnɔɔ pá caakɩ sɩ pá cɛ - tʋɣʋ mukaɣa tɛɛ ? Pə ta la . Pá kɔɔ pa maɣamaɣa na pá cɛ - tʋ .

text: And the serjeants told these words unto the magistrates : and they feared , when they heard that they were Romans .
text2: Pa kpaɣa tɔm ntɩ na pá polo pa heeli toŋtʋnaa . Pɛlɛ pa nɩɩ mpʋ sɩ Pɔɔlɩ na Silaasɩ pa kɛ ́ Lom nyə ́ ma . Ɩlɛna sɔɣɔntʋ kpa - wɛɣɛ sɔsɔm .

text: And they came and besought them , and brought them out , and desired them to depart out of the city .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ pa kɔma pa maɣamaɣa na pá həntɩ - wɛɣɛ atɛ , na pá tʋlɩ - wɛ , na pá tɔ - wɛ sɩ : Ɩ ́ la suulu na ɩ ́ lɩɩ tá ɩcatɛ taa .

text: And they went out of the prison , and entered into the house of Lydia and when they had seen the brethren , they comforted them , and departed .
text2: Pɔɔlɩ na Silaasɩ pa lɩɩ saləka taa kɛ ́ mpʋ , ɩlɛna pá polo Liti tɛ na pá ná pa taapalaa na pá sɔɔsɩ - wɛɣɛ apalʋtʋ . Ɩlɛna mpɛ pa tɛɛ pa nyəŋkʋ .

text: Now when they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia , they came to Thessalonica , where was a synagogue of the Jews :
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Pɔɔlɩ na Silaasɩ pa təŋna Aŋfipolisi na Apolonii , ɩlɛna pá tala Tɛsalonikɩ . Pə pamna Yuta nyə ́ ma naa wɛna təkotile kɛ təna .

text: And Paul , as his manner was , went in unto them , and three sabbath days reasoned with them out of the scriptures ,
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Pɔɔlɩ sʋʋ pa təkotile ntɛ tə taa ɩsɩɩ ɩ tɩɩ lakɩ tɔ . Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ kʋyɛɛŋ kʋhɛɛsəŋ tooso , ɩ ́ na mpa paa wɛ təna tɔ pa caɣaa na pá paasəna Ɩsɔ Tɔm tɔɔ kɛ ́ hɔm .

text: Opening and alleging , that Christ must needs have suffered , and risen again from the dead ; and that this Jesus , whom I preach unto you , is Christ .
text2: Ɩ sɛɣɛsa - wɛ na ɩ ́ hʋ ́ lə ́ ɣɩ ́ - wɛ təcɛɩcɛɩ kɛ ́ ŋmaatʋ ntɩ tə taa kɛ ́ ɩsəna pɩɩ wɛɛ sɩ Mesii ká tɔɣɔ kʋnyɔŋ kɛ teu na pə waalɩ ɩ ká fe tɔ . Nti ɩ heela - wɛ tɔɣɔlɛ sɩ Yesu wei ɩnɩ ɩ tɔm ma kɛɛsəɣɩ - mɛ ɩsəntɔ tɔ ɩnəɣəlɛ Mesii .

text: And some of them believed , and consorted with Paul and Silas ; and of the devout Greeks a great multitude , and of the chief women not a few .
text2: Tənaɣa Tɛsalonikɩ nyə ́ ma taa lɛlaa tɛma Pɔɔlɩ tɔm na pa taa na pá na Pɔɔlɩ na Silaasɩ pá kpɛntɩ , na Kəlɛɛkɩ nyə ́ ma paɣalɛ mpa pa sɛɛkaɣa Ɩsɔ tɔ pa kpɛnta Pɔɔlɩ pa tɔɔ kɛ ́ mpʋ , na alaa tuutuuma paɣalɛ tɔtɔ .

text: But the Jews which believed not , moved with envy , took unto them certain lewd fellows of the baser sort , and gathered a company , and set all the city on an uproar , and assaulted the house of Jason , and sought to bring them out to the people .
text2: Mpʋ ɩnɩ pə lapa Yuta nyə ́ ma kɛ ɩsəsɛɛmlɛ na pə ́ wɩɩ - wɛ . Ɩlɛna pá cɔɔ ɩcatɛ taa na pá hiki mpa pa kpisa pa tɩ na pá cɔɔkɩ yem tɔ , na pá tilisi yoou kɛ samaa hɛkʋ na ɩcatɛ cʋkɩ . Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ pa pola Yasɔŋ təyaɣa taa na pá pɛɛkəɣɩ Pɔɔlɩ na Silaasɩ sɩ pa lɩɩkəna - wɛɣɛ samaa taa .

text: And when they found them not , they drew Jason and certain brethren unto the rulers of the city , crying , These that have turned the world upside down are come hither also ;
text2: Pa pɛɛka - wɛ na pá kpisi , ɩlɛna pá tɛna Yasɔŋ na tá taapalaa lɛlaa . Pa tana - wɛɣɛ ɩcatɛ sɔsaa kiŋ , ɩlɛna pá kpaalɩ sɩ : Apalaa panɛ pa cɔɔkɩ keteŋa tənaɣa na pá yoosiɣi yəlaa . Pa tala cənɛɣɛlɛ nɔɔnɔɔ .

text: Whom Jason hath received : and these all do contrary to the decrees of Caesar , saying that there is another king , one Jesus .
text2: Na Yasɔŋ ná tisaa na pá sʋʋ ɩ tɛ . Mpi tɛtʋ tɔkʋlʋ kisaa tɔ pə maɣamaɣa kɛ pa lakɩ . Pa tɔŋ sɩ wulaʋ sɔsɔ nɔɣɔlʋ ɩ wɛɛ , pa yaakɩ - ɩ sɩ Yesu .

text: And they troubled the people and the rulers of the city , when they heard these things .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ tɔm tənɛ tə haŋa samaa na ɩcatɛ sɔsaa .

text: And when they had taken security of Jason , and of the other , they let them go .
text2: Haləna pá pɛlɩ Yasɔŋ - wɛɣɛ kəmlɛ , ɩlɛna pə ́ cɔ ́ pá cɛ - wɛ .

text: And the brethren immediately sent away Paul and Silas by night unto Berea : who coming thither went into the synagogue of the Jews .
text2: Ahoo kɔma na a yu , ɩlɛna tá taapalaa heeli Pɔɔlɩ na Silaasɩ sɩ : Ɩ ́ polo Pelee . Pa tala təna , ɩlɛna pá polo Yuta nyə ́ ma təkotile taa .

text: These were more noble than those in Thessalonica , in that they received the word with all readiness of mind , and searched the scriptures daily , whether those things were so .
text2: Təna Yuta nyə ́ ma ləmaɣasɛɛ ná wɛ teu na pə ́ kəlɩ Tɛsalonikɩ nyə ́ ma , pa mʋ Ɩsɔ Tɔm na luɣu kʋlʋmʋɣʋ kɛ ́ . Paa ɩfemle nte pa wiilaɣa Ɩsɔ Tɔm takəlasɩ taa kɛ ́ sɩ pa naa sɩ , tɔm nti Pɔɔlɩ heeliɣi - wɛ tɔ tə wɛ mpʋ yaa ɩsəna .

text: Therefore many of them believed ; also of honourable women which were Greeks , and of men , not a few .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ pa taa paɣalɛ mʋ Ɩsɔ Tɔm . Na pə ́ kaasa Kəlɛɛkɩ nyə ́ ma taa alaa toŋtʋnaa paɣalɛ , na apalaa paɣalɛ tɔtɔ ná mʋ - tɩ .

text: But when the Jews of Thessalonica had knowledge that the word of God was preached of Paul at Berea , they came thither also , and stirred up the people .
text2: Tɛsalonikɩ Yuta nyə ́ ma kɔma na pá nɩɩ sɩ Pɔɔlɩ tɔŋna waasʋ lapʋ kɛ Pelee , ɩlɛna pá kʋlɩ na pá polo təna , na pá sʋʋ kɔlɔmɔtɔ lapʋ na pá yoosiɣi samaa .

text: And then immediately the brethren sent away Paul to go as it were to the sea : but Silas and Timotheus abode there still .
text2: Tənaɣa ta taapalaa mpa pa wɛ təna tɔ pa kpaɣa Pɔɔlɩ kɛ kpakpaa na pá təŋna - ɩ na teŋku cɔlɔ tɔɔ , na pə ́ kaasɩ Silaasɩ na Timotee pɛlɛ pa naalɛɣɛ Pelee .

text: And they that conducted Paul brought him unto Athens : and receiving a commandment unto Silas and Timotheus for to come to him with all speed , they departed .
text2: Mpa pa kpaɣa Pɔɔlɩ kɛ mpʋ tɔ pa tana - ɩ hatoo Atɛɛnɩ . Pa kɔma pá mələɣɩ , ɩlɛna Pɔɔlɩ heeli - wɛ sɩ : Ye ɩ ́ talaa , ɩ ́ heeli Silaasɩ na Timotee sɩ pá la kookalɩ na pá maɣana - m Atɛɛnɩ kɛ lɔŋ , pə taa leeli .

text: Now while Paul waited for them at Athens , his spirit was stirred in him , when he saw the city wholly given to idolatry .
text2: Pɔɔlɩ caɣa təna na ɩ ́ keŋna Timotee na Silaasɩ pa tɔɔ . Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ ɩ nawa ɩsəna tɩɩŋ kʋlalaaŋ su Atɛɛnɩ ɩcatɛ taa tɔ pə ta maɣa - ɩ .

text: Therefore disputed he in the synagogue with the Jews , and with the devout persons , and in the market daily with them that met with him .
text2: Na ɩ ́ na Yuta nyə ́ ma mpa pa sɛɛkaɣa Ɩsɔ tɔ pa lakaɣa Ɩsɔ Tɔm faaci kɛ Yuta nyə ́ ma təkotile taa , na pá hɔ tə tɔɔ . Haləna pə ́ kpɛŋna mpa mpa ɩ suliɣi kʋyɛɛŋ taa yaa nɔnɔɔsɩ tɛɛ tɔ .

text: Then certain philosophers of the Epicureans , and of the Stoicks , encountered him . And some said , What will this babbler say ? other some , He seemeth to be a setter forth of strange gods : because he preached unto them Jesus , and the resurrection .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Ɩpikuli na Sɔtɔyi nyə ́ ma sɛɣɛsəlaa sɔsaa napəlɩ pa kɔma ɩ kiŋ sɩ pá na - ɩ pá yɔɣɔtɩ . Pa taa lɛlaa sɩ : Tɔm ntiɣi nɔɔleleŋ tʋ ɩnɩ ɩ yɔɣɔtəɣɩ ye ? Lɛlaa sɩ : Pə caɣa ɩsɩɩ tɩɩŋ kʋfaŋ nɩɩlɩ ɩ tɔm kɛ ɩ yɔɣɔtəɣɩ . Mpi pə tɔɔ pɛlɛ pa yɔɣɔtaɣa mpʋ tɔ , Yesu tɔm na sətaa fem tɔm kɛ Pɔɔlɩ heelaɣa - wɛ .

text: And they took him , and brought him unto Areopagus , saying , May we know what this new doctrine , whereof thou speakest , is ?
text2: Tənaɣa pa kpaɣa - ɩ na pá pona - ɩ Aleyopaasɩ kotuɣu taa , na pá tɔmɩ - ɩ sɩ : Tɔʋ , heeli - tʋɣʋ kʋfatʋ nti nyá kɔnaa tɔ na tə ́ nɩɩ ɩlɛ .

text: For thou bringest certain strange things to our ears : we would know therefore what these things mean .
text2: Pə taɣa pʋlʋ tɔɔ , tɔmnaa mpa n heeliɣi - tʋ tɔ pa wɛ piti kɛ ́ . Tə caa sɩ tə ́ cɛkəna pə yaasi .

text: ( For all the Athenians and strangers which were there spent their time in nothing else , but either to tell , or to hear some new thing . )
text2: Atɛɛnɩ nyə ́ ma təna na caɣalaa mpa paa wɛ təna tɔ pa nyəntɛ ntɛ ́ tɔmnaa kʋfatʋ yɔɣɔtaɣa na tə nɩɩʋ .

text: Then Paul stood in the midst of Mars ' hill , and said , Ye men of Athens , I perceive that in all things ye are too superstitious .
text2: Tənaɣa Pɔɔlɩ səŋa Aleyopaasɩ kotuɣu hɛkʋ taa təna na ɩ ́ tɔ - wɛ sɩ : Atɛɛnɩ nyə ́ ma mɛ , ma nawa ɩsəna ɩ ́ sɔpa nyʋɣʋ na mə tɩɩŋ pə tɩɩ fɛɩ tɔ .

text: For as I passed by , and beheld your devotions , I found an altar with this inscription , TO THE UNKNOWN GOD . Whom therefore ye ignorantly worship , him declare I unto you .
text2: Saa wei ma cɔɔkaɣa mə ɩcatɛ taa na má keŋna mə tɩɩŋ tɔ , ma na təlaalɛ kɛ tiili , na pá ŋmaawa tə tɔɔ sɩ : Ɩsɔ wei nɔɣɔlʋ ta nyɩ tɔɣɔlɔ . Tampana ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ , Ɩsɔ wei ɩ ́ sɛɛkɩ na ɩ ́ ta nyəmɩ - ɩ tɔ , ɩnɩ ɩ maɣamaɣa kɛ ma caa ma hʋ ́ lɩ ́ - mɛ .

text: God that made the world and all things therein , seeing that he is Lord of heaven and earth , dwelleth not in temples made with hands ;
text2: Ɩsɔ wei ɩ lapa antulinya ɩnɛ na pə təna mpi pə wɛ ɩ taa tɔ , ɩnɩ ɩ kɛna ɩsɔtaa na atɛ pə tʋ . Ɩɩ cakɩ kutuluŋ wei yəlaa maɣamaɣa ŋmawa tɔ ɩ taa .

text: Neither is worshipped with men ' s hands , as though he needed any thing , seeing he giveth to all life , and breath , and all things ;
text2: Pəlɛ pə paasi , pə fɛɩ ɩsɩɩ ɩ taŋaa sɩ yəlaa ɩ ́ tʋ - ɩ niŋ kɛ natəlɩ tə taa kɛ ́ paa pəcɔ . Pə taɣa pʋlʋ , ɩnɩ ɩ tənna yəlaa təna wɛna pa ɩsɛ na pá feesiɣi , na ɩnɩ ɩ haakəna - wɛɣɛ pə təna .

text: And hath made of one blood all nations of men for to dwell on all the face of the earth , and hath determined the times before appointed , and the bounds of their habitation ;
text2: Yʋlʋ kʋlʋm təkoŋ kɛ ́ ɩ caaləna lapʋ na ɩ ́ lɛ ́ ɩ ́ lá na pə ́ huki sɔsɔm , na ɩ ́ sɩɩ - wɛɣɛ tɛtʋ təna taa , na ɩ ́ laalɩ na ɩ ́ sɩɩ pə waatʋnaa kɛ teitei , na tɛtʋnaa mpa pa taa pa caɣaa tɔ tə toosi .

text: That they should seek the Lord , if haply they might feel after him , and find him , though he be not far from every one of us :
text2: Ɩ lapa ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ sɩ ye pa pɛɛkəɣɩ - ɩ , ntanyɩ pa hakʋɣʋ na pa pɛɛkʋɣʋ mpɩ pə taa pa kɔɔ pá na - ɩ . Na mpʋ tɔ , pə taɣa ɩsɩɩ ɩ wɛ - tʋ na pooluŋ se .

text: For in him we live , and move , and have our being ; as certain also of your own poets have said , For we are also his offspring .
text2: Pə taɣa pʋlʋ tɔɔ , Ɩsɔ yelina tə wɛna weesiŋ na tə ́ cɔɔkɩ na tə ́ wɛna tá ɩsɛ . Ntɩ tə maɣamaɣa kɛ mə yonyoolaa napəlɩ pa yoowa sɩ : Tə kɛ ́ ɩ piya tɔtɔ .

text: Forasmuch then as we are the offspring of God , we ought not to think that the Godhead is like unto gold , or silver , or stone , graven by art and man ' s device .
text2: Tɔʋ , ye tə kɛ ́ ɩ piya ɩlɛ , pə fɛɩ tɩɩ maɣasɩ sɩ , Ɩsɔ wɛ ɩsɩɩ caŋəm tʋ cakʋɣʋ na ɩ ́ maɣasɩ ɩ taa , na ɩ ́ lu pʋlʋpʋ na wʋla yaa nyəɣəlʋɣʋ kʋhʋlʋmʋɣʋ yaa pəlɛ , na pá sɩɩ na pá laakɩ tɔ .

text: And the times of this ignorance God winked at ; but now commandeth all men every where to repent :
text2: Mpi yəlaa lakaɣa səkpɛtʋɣʋ tɛɛ na pá taa nyɩ tɔ , Ɩsɔ ɩɩ tasəɣɩ təlɛɣɛ paasənaʋ . Ama pənɛntɛ ɩ yaa paa yʋlʋ wei kɛ ́ paa timpi sɩ ɩ ́ laɣasɩ tɔntɛ .

text: Because he hath appointed a day , in the which he will judge the world in righteousness by that man whom he hath ordained ; whereof he hath given assurance unto all men , in that he hath raised him from the dead .
text2: Ɩ tɛma kʋyakʋ sɩɩʋ ŋku kʋ wule ɩ ká yele na yʋlʋ wei ɩ ləsaa tɔ ɩ ́ təŋ ɩsəna tampana wɛɛ tɔ na ɩ ́ hʋʋna yəlaa tənaɣa tɔm . Pə maɣamaɣa pə tampana kɛ ɩ hʋla yəlaa tənaɣa waatʋ wei ɩ feesa - ɩ tɔ .

text: And when they heard of the resurrection of the dead , some mocked : and others said , We will hear thee again of this matter .
text2: Waatʋ wei pa nɩɩ Pɔɔlɩ yɔɣɔta səm na fem tɔm tɔ pa taa lɛlaa woŋa - ɩ , na lɛlaa náá tɔmɩ - ɩ sɩ : Wulee ɩlɛ n ká tasa - tɩ na tə ́ nɩɩ .

text: So Paul departed from among them .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Pɔɔlɩ yela - wɛ na ɩ ́ tɛɛ .

text: Howbeit certain men clave unto him , and believed : among the which was Dionysius the Areopagite , and a woman named Damaris , and others with them .
text2: Paa na mpʋ yəlaa pəcɔ təŋa - ɩ na pá sʋʋ Ɩsɔ sɛɛʋ . Pa yaa pa taa lɛlʋ sɩ Tenii , ɩ ́ lɛ ́ ɩ kɛ ́ Aleyopaasɩ kotuɣu taa nɔɣɔlʋ , na alʋ nɔɣɔlʋ tɔtɔ , pa yaa - ɩ sɩ Tamaliisi . Pə kaasa yəlaa paɣalɛ tɔtɔ .

text: After these things Paul departed from Athens , and came to Corinth ;
text2: Pəlɛ pə waalɩ Pɔɔlɩ kʋla Atɛɛnɩ na ɩ ́ tɛɛ Kɔlɛntɩ .

text: And found a certain Jew named Aquila , born in Pontus , lately come from Italy , with his wife Priscilla ; ( because that Claudius had commanded all Jews to depart from Rome : ) and came unto them .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ ɩ sula Yuta tʋ nɔɣɔlʋɣʋ təna , pa yaa - ɩ sɩ Akilaasɩ . Pa lʋla - ɩ Pɔŋ tɛtʋ taa . Ɩ ́ na ɩ alʋ Pilisila pa lɩɩna Ɩtalii kɛ nɔɔnɔɔ . Pə taɣa pʋlʋ tɔɔ , tɛtʋ təna tʋ Koloti kpaaləna sɩ Yuta nyə ́ ma təna ɩ ́ lɩɩ Lom taa . Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Pɔɔlɩ polaa na ɩ ́ maɣana - wɛɣɛ təna .

text: And because he was of the same craft , he abode with them , and wrought : for by their occupation they were tentmakers .
text2: Ɩsɩɩ ɩ ́ na - wɛ pa kaa təmlɛ tɔ , ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ ɩ caɣa pa tɛ na pá na - ɩ pá lakɩ - tɛ . Təmlɛ ntɛɣɛlɛ coka pɔɔŋ lʋʋʋ .

text: And he reasoned in the synagogue every sabbath , and persuaded the Jews and the Greeks .
text2: Paa kʋyakʋ kʋhɛɛsʋɣʋ ŋku , Pɔɔlɩ lakaɣa waasʋ kɛ Yuta nyə ́ ma təkotile taa kɛ ́ , na ɩ ́ lʋkɩ sɩ ɩ ́ hʋ ́ lɩ ́ Yuta nyə ́ ma na Kəlɛɛkɩ nyə ́ ma kɛ tampana na pá tisi .

text: And when Silas and Timotheus were come from Macedonia , Paul was pressed in the spirit , and testified to the Jews that Jesus was Christ .
text2: Silaasɩ na Timotee pa kɔma pá lɩɩna Masetoni na pá tala , ɩlɛna Pɔɔlɩ paasəna waasʋ tike sɩ Yuta nyə ́ ma ɩ ́ nyɩ sɩ Yesu kɛlɛ Mesii .

text: And when they opposed themselves , and blasphemed , he shook his raiment , and said unto them , Your blood be upon your own heads ; I am clean : from henceforth I will go unto the Gentiles .
text2: Ama Yuta nyə ́ ma kpɛɛsəna - ɩ na pá tʋʋ - ɩ . Ɩlɛna Pɔɔlɩ kpiisi ɩ wontu na ɩ ́ tɔ sɩ : Mə lepu kɛ mə nyɔɔŋ tɔm , pə ta kɛ ma tɔm tɔtɔ . Maa məŋna mpa pa ta kɛ Yuta nyə ́ ma tɔ pa tɔɔ .

text: And he departed thence , and entered into a certain man ' s house , named Justus , one that worshipped God , whose house joined hard to the synagogue .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Pɔɔlɩ kʋla təna na ɩ ́ polo apalʋ nɔɣɔlʋ ɩ tɛ , pa yaa - ɩ sɩ Titiyusi Yutusi . Apalʋ ɩnɩ ɩ sɛɛkaɣa Ɩsɔ kɛ ́ , na ɩ təyaɣa fɛɩ pooluŋ na Yuta nyə ́ ma təkotile .

text: And Crispus , the chief ruler of the synagogue , believed on the Lord with all his house ; and many of the Corinthians hearing believed , and were baptized .
text2: Yuta nyə ́ ma təkotile ntɛ tə taa , nyʋɣʋ tʋ nɔɣɔlʋ ɩ ka wɛɛ na pá yaakɩ - ɩ sɩ Kilisipusi , ɩ ́ lɛ ́ na ɩ təyaɣa nyə ́ ma təna pa mʋ Tacaa tɔm . Kɔlɛntɩ nyə ́ ma paɣalɛ nɩɩ Pɔɔlɩ tɔm , ɩlɛna pá mʋ Tacaa tɔm tɔtɔ , na pá sɔ - wɛɣɛ Ɩsɔ lʋm .

text: Then spake the Lord to Paul in the night by a vision , Be not afraid , but speak , and hold not thy peace :
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ pə lapa Pɔɔlɩ ɩsɩɩ toosee taka kɛ ́ ahoo naalɩ , na ɩ ́ ná Tacaa . Na ɩ ́ lɛ ́ ɩ heeliɣi - ɩ sɩ : Taa nyá , yɔɣɔtəɣɩ tam , taa su .

text: For I am with thee , and no man shall set on thee to hurt thee : for I have much people in this city .
text2: Ma wɛ nyá waalɩ , nɔɣɔlʋ fɛɩ wei ɩ ká tʋ niŋ kɛ nyá tɔɔ tɔ . Ma wɛna yəlaa paɣalɛ kɛ ɩcatɛ tənɛ tə taa .

text: And he continued there a year and six months , teaching the word of God among them .
text2: Mpʋ pə lapəna Pɔɔlɩ caɣa Kɔlɛntɩ kɛ pənaɣa na hɔɣɔlʋɣʋ , na ɩ ́ heeliɣi yəlaa kɛ Ɩsɔ Tɔm .

text: And when Gallio was the deputy of Achaia , the Jews made insurrection with one accord against Paul , and brought him to the judgment seat ,
text2: Saa wei Kaliyoŋ caɣa Lom kʋfənɛɛ kɛ Akayi tɔ , Yuta nyə ́ ma pɛɛla nɔɣɔ kɛ Pɔɔlɩ tɔɔ na pá yaa - ɩ nɔnɔɣɔ kɛ pəloo .

text: Saying , This fellow persuadeth men to worship God contrary to the law .
text2: Na pá tɔ sɩ : Apalʋ ɩnɛ ɩ ɩsɛ sɛɛna yəlaa kaanaʋ sɩ pá sɛɛ Ɩsɔ kɛ ́ ɩsəna mpi tɔ pə taɣa ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ pa sɩɩwa .

text: And when Paul was now about to open his mouth , Gallio said unto the Jews , If it were a matter of wrong or wicked lewdness , O ye Jews , reason would that I should bear with you :
text2: Pɔɔlɩ caakaɣa sɩ ɩ ́ cɔ - wɛ , ɩlɛna Kaliyoŋ təkɩ - ɩ , na ɩ ́ tɔ Yuta nyə ́ ma sɩ , ye ɩsɩɩ ɩsaɣatʋ sɔsɔɔntʋ kɛ ɩ ka lapa , yaa taalɩ sɔsɔ nɔɣɔlʋ , Yuta nyə ́ ma mɛ , pəlɛɣɛ maa nɩɩna - mɛ .

text: But if it be a question of words and names , and of your law , look ye to it ; for I will be no judge of such matters .
text2: Timpi pə lɩɩwa sɩ tɔmnaa kpaɩ nyəntʋ , na həla , na mə maɣamaɣa mə mpaaʋ pə tɔm tɔɔ kɛ ́ ɩ ́ hɔŋ tɔ , ɩ ́ polo ɩ ́ paasəna - təɣɩ mə maɣamaɣa . Maa caakɩ tɔmnaa ɩsɩɩ ntɩ wɛ tə lapʋ .

text: And he drave them from the judgment seat .
text2: Ɩlɛna ɩ ́ tɔɣɔnɩ - wɛɣɛ ɩ pəloo taa .

text: Then all the Greeks took Sosthenes , the chief ruler of the synagogue , and beat him before the judgment seat . And Gallio cared for none of those things .
text2: Tənaɣa pa təna pa kpa Yuta nyə ́ ma təkotile nyʋɣʋ tʋ Sɔsətɛɛnɩ na pá sʋʋ - ɩ mapʋ kɛ pəloo nɔɣɔ təna , na Kaliyoŋ suma .

text: And Paul after this tarried there yet a good while , and then took his leave of the brethren , and sailed thence into Syria , and with him Priscilla and Aquila ; having shorn his head in Cenchrea : for he had a vow .
text2: Pɔɔlɩ caɣa Kɔlɛntɩ kɛ teu , pəlɛ pə waalɩ ɩ na Pilisila na Akilaasɩ pa yela ta taapalaa na pá sʋʋ kpɩɩlʋɣʋ sɩ pa puki Silii . Na pə ́ cɔ ́ Pɔɔlɩ kʋləɣɩ təna tɔ , ɩ loola ɩ nyʋɣʋ kɛ Saŋkəlee kɛ ́ . Pə taɣa pʋlʋ , ɩ ka sɩɩ ɩ nɔɣɔ ŋka tɔ ka tɔɔ kɛ ́ .

text: And he came to Ephesus , and left them there : but he himself entered into the synagogue , and reasoned with the Jews .
text2: Pa kɔma na pá tala Ɩfeesu ɩlɛna Akilaasɩ na Pilisila pa na Pɔɔlɩ pa cɛ təma . Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Pɔɔlɩ ná pola Yuta nyə ́ ma təkotile taa , na ɩ ́ na - wɛ pá lakɩ faaci na pá hɔŋ tɔm .

text: When they desired him to tarry longer time with them , he consented not ;
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ pɛlɛ pa tɔma - ɩ sɩ ɩ ́ caɣa tənaɣa wɛɛ naalɛ . Ama ɩ ta tisi .

text: But bade them farewell , saying , I must by all means keep this feast that cometh in Jerusalem : but I will return again unto you , if God will . And he sailed from Ephesus .
text2: Ɩlɛna ɩ ́ heeli - wɛ sɩ : Ye Ɩsɔ ɩ tisaa maa məlɩ təna . Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ ɩ sʋʋ kpɩɩlʋɣʋ kɛ Ɩfeesu na ɩ ́ tɛɛ .

text: And when he had landed at Caesarea , and gone up , and saluted the church , he went down to Antioch .
text2: Ɩ kɔma na ɩ ́ tala Sesalee , ɩlɛna ɩ ́ tii na ɩ ́ polo Yosalɛm na ɩ ́ sɛɛ təna Yesu sɛɛlaa , ɩlɛna ɩ ́ məŋna Antiyɔka .

text: And after he had spent some time there , he departed , and went over all the country of Galatia and Phrygia in order , strengthening all the disciples .
text2: Ɩ caɣa tənaɣa wɛɛ naalɛ , ɩlɛna ɩ ́ kʋlɩ na ɩ ́ cɔɔ Kalatɩ na Filicii pə tɛtʋnaa taa , na ɩ ́ sɔɔsəɣɩ Tacaa təŋlaa kɛ apalʋtʋ kɛ pa Ɩsɔ mpaaʋ taa .

text: And a certain Jew named Apollos , born at Alexandria , an eloquent man , and mighty in the scriptures , came to Ephesus .
text2: Pə pamna Yuta tʋ nɔɣɔlʋ ɩ ka tala Ɩfeesu təna , pa yaa - ɩ sɩ Apɔlɔɔsɩ , pa lʋla - ɩ Alɛkəsantilii . Ɩ kɛ ́ nɔɔleleŋ tʋ kɛ ́ , ɩ Ɩsɔ tɔm takəlaɣa nyəm fɛɩna taka .

text: This man was instructed in the way of the Lord ; and being fervent in the spirit , he spake and taught diligently the things of the Lord , knowing only the baptism of John .
text2: Paa hʋla - ɩ Tacaa mpaaʋ tɔm , na ɩnɩ tɔtɔ ɩ heelaɣa na ɩ kilisaɣa Yesu tɔm na laŋhʋlʋmlɛ kɛ teu , ɩɩ cotiɣi paa pəcɔ . Ama Yohaanɩ lʋm sɔʋ tike kɛ ɩ nyəmá .

text: And he began to speak boldly in the synagogue : whom when Aquila and Priscilla had heard , they took him unto them , and expounded unto him the way of God more perfectly .
text2: Ɩ lakaɣa Yuta nyə ́ ma təkotile taa kɛ ́ waasʋ , ɩɩ nyaŋna pʋlʋ . Pilisila na Akilaasɩ pa ná mpʋ , ɩlɛna pá kpaɣa - ɩ na pá tɛɛsɩ - ɩ Ɩsɔ mpaaʋ yaasi kɛ kilisuɣu təcɛɩcɛɩ .

text: And when he was disposed to pass into Achaia , the brethren wrote , exhorting the disciples to receive him : who , when he was come , helped them much which had believed through grace :
text2: Pə kɔma na pə kɔɔ ɩlɛna Apɔlɔɔsɩ luɣu la sɩ ɩ puki Akayi . Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ ta taapalaa tisaa sɩ : Ɛɛ ɩ ́ polo . Ɩlɛna pá la takəlaɣa na pá cɛla Akayi Ɩsɔ sɛɛlaa sɩ ye Apɔlɔɔsɩ ɩ ́ tala təna pá tɔkɩ - ɩ teu . Saa wei ɩ kɔma na ɩ ́ tala təna tɔ ɩ tema mpa Ɩsɔ lapa pɛɛlɛɛ na pá mʋ Tacaa tɔm tɔ .

text: For he mightily convinced the Jews , and that publickly , shewing by the scriptures that Jesus was Christ .
text2: Pə taɣa pʋlʋ tɔɔ , tɔmnaa kantəlasɩ kɛ ɩ təŋaa tətete na ɩ ́ hʋləna Yuta nyə ́ ma təyaɩɩ sɩ pa toola kʋtoolu . Na Ɩsɔ Tɔm takəlaɣa kɛ ɩ kpaɣaa na ɩ ́ hʋləna - wɛ sɩ Yesu kɛna Mesii .

text: And it came to pass , that , while Apollos was at Corinth , Paul having passed through the upper coasts came to Ephesus : and finding certain disciples ,
text2: Saa wei Apɔlɔɔsɩ wɛ Kɔlɛntɩ tɔ Pɔɔlɩ ná cɔɔna Asii tɛtʋ pulasɩ acalɛɛ taa , haləna ɩ ́ kɔɔ ɩ ́ lɩɩ Ɩfeesu ɩcatɛ . Tənaɣa ɩ maɣana Tacaa təŋlaa napəlɩ .

text: He said unto them , Have ye received the Holy Ghost since ye believed ? And they said unto him , We have not so much as heard whether there be any Holy Ghost .
text2: Ɩlɛna ɩ ́ pɔɔsɩ - wɛ sɩ : Waatʋ wei ɩ ́ mʋ Tacaa tɔm tɔ , ɩ ́ hika Ɩsɔ Feesuɣu Naŋŋtʋ na ? Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ təŋlaa cɔ - ɩ sɩ : Tə ta nɩɩta ɩ tɔm kɛ nɩɩʋ maɣamaɣa .

text: And he said unto them , Unto what then were ye baptized ? And they said , Unto John ' s baptism .
text2: Tənaɣa Pɔɔlɩ tasa təŋlaa mpɛɣɛ pɔɔsʋɣʋ sɩ : Na Ɩsɔ lʋm mpiɣi pa sɔ - mɛ ɩlɛ ? Ɩlɛna təŋlaa mpɛ pá cɔ - wɛ sɩ : Yohaanɩ nyəm kɛ ́ .

text: Then said Paul , John verily baptized with the baptism of repentance , saying unto the people , that they should believe on him which should come after him , that is , on Christ Jesus .
text2: Tənaɣa Pɔɔlɩ heela - wɛ sɩ mpa pa laɣasa tɔntɛ tɔɣɔ Yohaanɩ sɔɔkaɣa Ɩsɔ lʋm , na ɩ ́ heeliɣi Ɩsɛɣɛlɩ yəlaa sɩ pá mʋ wei ɩ kɔŋ ɩnɩ ɩ waalɩ tɔ ɩ tɔm . Pʋntʋ ɩnəɣəlɛ Yesu .

text: When they heard this , they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus .
text2: Pa nɩɩ mpʋ , ɩlɛna pá yele na pá yaana Tacaa Yesu hətɛ na pá sɔna - wɛɣɛ Ɩsɔ lʋm .

text: And when Paul had laid his hands upon them , the Holy Ghost came on them ; and they spake with tongues , and prophesied .
text2: Ɩlɛna Pɔɔlɩ tənɩ pa tɔɔ kɛ ́ niŋ , na Feesuɣu Naŋŋtʋ tii pa tɔɔ . Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ pa sʋʋ tɔmnaa mpa nɔɣɔlʋ ɩɩ nɩɩkɩ tɔɣɔ yɔɣɔtʋɣʋ , na pá kpaaləɣɩ Ɩsɔ kʋheelitu .

text: And all the men were about twelve .
text2: Yəlaa mpɛ ɩnɩ , ye pa kpɛnta - wɛ , pa nyɔɔŋ tala ɩsɩɩ naanʋwa na naalɛɣɛ mpʋ .

text: And he went into the synagogue , and spake boldly for the space of three months , disputing and persuading the things concerning the kingdom of God .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ ɩsɔtʋnaa tooso taa Pɔɔlɩ wɛ təna na ɩ ́ sɛɣɛsəɣɩ Yuta nyə ́ ma təkotile taa , ɩɩ nyaŋna pʋlʋ . Na ɩ lakaɣa Ɩsɔ Kawulaɣa tɔm waasʋ , na ɩ ́ lʋkɩ teu sɩsɩ ɩ ́ hʋ ́ lɩ ́ ɩ nɩɩlaa kɛ tampana na pá tisi .

text: But when divers were hardened , and believed not , but spake evil of that way before the multitude , he departed from them , and separated the disciples , disputing daily in the school of one Tyrannus .
text2: Paa na mpʋ paɣalɛ lapa kaŋkana na pá kisi Tacaa tɔm mʋɣʋ , na pá footi ɩ mpaaʋ kɛ kotilaa samaa taa . Tənaɣa Pɔɔlɩ yela - wɛ , na ɩ ́ yaa Tacaa təŋlaa na pá lɩɩna pa mpaa , na pá polo pá caɣa Tilanusi ceu taa , na paa kʋyaŋku ɩ ́ sɛɣɛsəɣɩ - wɛɣɛ Ɩsɔ Tɔm kɛ təna .

text: And this continued by the space of two years ; so that all they which dwelt in Asia heard the word of the Lord Jesus , both Jews and Greeks .
text2: Pa lapa ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ pɩɩsɩ naalɛ , haləna Yuta nyə ́ ma na kpaɩ nyə ́ ma mpa paa wɛ Asii tɛtʋ taa tɔ pá nɩɩ Tacaa tɔm .

text: And God wrought special miracles by the hands of Paul :
text2: Ɩsɔ lakaɣa piti təma nna a fɛɩna taka tɔ na Pɔɔlɩ niŋ .

text: So that from his body were brought unto the sick handkerchiefs or aprons , and the diseases departed from them , and the evil spirits went out of them .
text2: Haləna pá kpakəɣɩ Pɔɔlɩ tɔɔ wontunaa na ɩ nyʋɣʋ saalasɩ na pá tənəɣɩ kʋtɔntʋnaa tɔɔ , na pa kʋtɔməŋ tɛŋ , na alɔɣaa seeki pa waalɩ .

text: Then certain of the vagabond Jews , exorcists , took upon them to call over them which had evil spirits the name of the Lord Jesus , saying , We adjure you by Jesus whom Paul preacheth .
text2: Yuta nyə ́ ma napəlɩ pa cɔɔkaɣa na pá looki kʋtɔntʋnaa kɛ pa alɔɣaa . Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ pa maɣasaa sɩ pa kpakəɣɩ Yesu hətɛ na pá loona alɔɣaa . Tənaɣa pa tɔŋaɣa alɔɣaa sɩ : Alɔɣaa mɛ , tə heeliɣi - mɛɣɛ kʋlʋmaɣa sɩ Yesu wei ɩ waasʋ Pɔɔlɩ lakɩ tɔ ɩ toŋ tɔɔ ɩ ́ se .

text: And there were seven sons of one Sceva , a Jew , and chief of the priests , which did so .
text2: ( Mpa ɩnɩ pa lakaɣa mpʋ tɔ pa kɛ ́ Yuta kɔtʋlʋ sɔsɔ wei pa yaa sɩ Sefa tɔ ɩ pəyalaa . Pa wɛ yʋlʋnyɔɔŋ naatosompɔɣɔlaɣa . )

text: And the evil spirit answered and said , Jesus I know , and Paul I know ; but who are ye ?
text2: Tənaɣa ɩlɔɣɔʋ pɔɔsa - wɛ sɩ : Ma nyəmá Yesu , na má nyɩ Pɔɔlɩ tɔtɔ , na mɛ mə kɛ ́ mpa ?

text: And the man in whom the evil spirit was leaped on them , and overcame them , and prevailed against them , so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded .
text2: Ɩlɔɣɔhilu kʋla pa tɔɔ na ɩ ́ kəlɩ pa təna , na ɩ ́ hɔɔkɩ - wɛɣɛ teu na pá se yem yem kɛ ́ təyaɣa taa na pá lɩɩ tapakpɛlɛɛ , na pə ́ kʋ - wɛɣɛ kʋɣʋ kʋɣʋ .

text: And this was known to all the Jews and Greeks also dwelling at Ephesus ; and fear fell on them all , and the name of the Lord Jesus was magnified .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Ɩfeesu nyə ́ ma təna , paa mpa pa kɛ ́ Yuta nyə ́ ma tɔ , paa kpaɩ nyə ́ ma , pa nɩɩ tɔm tənɛ , ɩlɛna pə ́ la - wɛɣɛ sɔɣɔntʋ kɛ sɔsɔm . Nɔɣɔlʋ ɩɩ tasəɣɩ Tacaa Yesu hətɛ kɛ leɣelinaʋ kɛ paa pəcɔ .

text: And many that believed came , and confessed , and shewed their deeds .
text2: Mpa mpa pa mʋ Tacaa tɔm tɔ pa taa paɣalɛ kɔŋaɣa samaa taa na pá kaaləɣɩ pa nɔɔsɩ na pá heeliɣi təfoo kɛ ́ ɩsaɣatʋ nti nti paa lapa tɔ .

text: Many of them also which used curious arts brought their books together , and burned them before all men : and they counted the price of them , and found it fifty thousand pieces of silver .
text2: Mpa pɛlɛ pa lakaɣa topotopo təma tɔ pa paɣalɛ kɔna pa takəlasɩ na pá sɔ - səɣɩ kɔkɔ kɛ yəlaa taa . Pa mapa takəlasɩ nsɩ sɩ liɣitee , ɩlɛna pə ́ lɩɩ liɣitee nyəɣətʋ iyisi nɩɩlɛ na naanʋwa ( 50000 ) .

text: So mightily grew the word of God and prevailed .
text2: Ta Caa tɔm tɔŋna yɛkʋɣʋ na toŋ na pə ́ hʋ ́ lə ́ ɣɩ ́ ɩ akpala .

text: After these things were ended , Paul purposed in the spirit , when he had passed through Macedonia and Achaia , to go to Jerusalem , saying , After I have been there , I must also see Rome .
text2: Pəlɛ pə waalɩ Pɔɔlɩ luɣu lapa sɩ ɩ ká təŋna Masetoni na Akayi na ɩ ́ polo Yosalɛm . Ɩ tɔŋaɣa sɩ : Ye ma tala təna , pə wɛɛ sɩ maa polo Lom kɛ ́ .

text: So he sent into Macedonia two of them that ministered unto him , Timotheus and Erastus ; but he himself stayed in Asia for a season .
text2: Tənaɣa ɩ heela ɩ pəyalaa Timotee na Ɩlasətɩ sɩ pɛlɛ pá polo Masetoni , na ɩnɩ ɩ maɣamaɣa ɩ ́ tasa caɣaʋ kɛ Asii tɛtʋ taa kɛ ́ wɛɛ naalɛ .

text: And the same time there arose no small stir about that way .
text2: Saa ɩnəɣɩ Tacaa mpaaʋ təŋʋɣʋ yelaa na kɔkɔlɔ sɔsɔ nɔɣɔlʋ ɩ ́ kʋlɩ Ɩfeesu ɩcatɛ taa .

text: For a certain man named Demetrius , a silversmith , which made silver shrines for Diana , brought no small gain unto the craftsmen ;
text2: Ɩsəna pə caalaa tɔ , apalʋ koolu nɔɣɔlʋ ɩ ka wɛnna na pá yaakɩ - ɩ sɩ Temetiyusi . Ɩ lukaɣa nyəɣəlʋɣʋ kʋhʋlʋmʋɣʋ kutulusi ɩsɩɩ tʋɣʋ Aatema kutuluɣu taka . Na mpa pa lakaɣa ɩ cɔlɔɣɔ təmlɛ tɔ pa waakaɣa pə taa kɛ ́ sɔsɔm .

text: Whom he called together with the workmen of like occupation , and said , Sirs , ye know that by this craft we have our wealth .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ koolu ɩnɩ ɩ kota - wɛ , na ɩ ́ yaa ɩ koolaa lɛlaa təna , na ɩ ́ tɔ - wɛ sɩ : Apalaa mɛ , pə taɣa pʋlʋ tɔɔ kɛ ́ ma kota - mɛ , saŋa taa ɩ ́ nawa sɩ təmlɛ tənɛɣɛ tá kʋləɣəna .

text: Moreover ye see and hear , that not alone at Ephesus , but almost throughout all Asia , this Paul hath persuaded and turned away much people , saying that they be no gods , which are made with hands :
text2: Na mə maɣamaɣa ɩ ́ nawa na ɩ ́ nɩɩwa Pɔɔlɩ ɩnɩ ɩ kʋlapʋtʋ . Ɩ cɔɔkɩ na ɩ ́ tɔŋ sɩ : Mpi yəlaa niŋ lakɩ na pá nyənəɣɩ sɩ pa weesiŋ tɔ , pə kɛ ́ yem kɛ ́ . Na yəlaa paɣalɛ mʋna ɩ tɔm ntɩ . Pə taɣa Ɩfeesu taa cənɛ tike , pə wɛ ɩsɩɩ Asii tɛtʋ tənaɣa .

text: So that not only this our craft is in danger to be set at nought ; but also that the temple of the great goddess Diana should be despised , and her magnificence should be destroyed , whom all Asia and the world worshippeth .
text2: Asalaʋ wei ɩ caa lapʋ kɛ ɩsəntɔ tɔ , pə taɣa ɩsɩɩ tá təmlɛ tike ká pəsəna yem . Ama pɩɩ kpɛŋna tʋɣʋ sɔsɔɔʋ alʋ nyəŋkʋ na Aatema kutuluɣu nyʋɣʋ na pə ́ kʋ na kʋ teeli saalɩ yem . Pəyele tʋɣʋ alʋ nyəŋkʋ ŋkʋɣʋ pa nyənəɣɩ Asii tɛtʋ taa cənɛ . Halɩ pə kpɛŋna antulinya təna .

text: And when they heard these sayings , they were full of wrath , and cried out , saying , Great is Diana of the Ephesians .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ koolaa mpɛ pa nɩɩ tɔm tənɛ ɩnɩ , ɩlɛna pááná kpa - wɛɣɛ sɔsɔm , na pá sʋʋ kpaalʋɣʋ sɩ Ɩfeesu nyə ́ ma Aatema kɛlɛ sɔsɔ .

text: And the whole city was filled with confusion : and having caught Gaius and Aristarchus , men of Macedonia , Paul ' s companions in travel , they rushed with one accord into the theatre .
text2: Tənaɣa ɩcatɛ təna cʋkaa , na yəlaa kpa Masetoni nyə ́ ma naalɛ , Kayusi na Alisitaakɩ , mpa na Pɔɔlɩ pa yɛlaɣaa tɔ , na pá kpɛŋna - wɛ na pá huliɣi kpetile kpetile na pá puki kataɣa taa .

text: And when Paul would have entered in unto the people , the disciples suffered him not .
text2: Pɔɔlɩ lʋpa sɩ ɩ puki pa kiŋ . Ama Ɩsɔ sɛɛlaa ta tisina - ɩ .

text: And certain of the chief of Asia , which were his friends , sent unto him , desiring him that he would not adventure himself into the theatre .
text2: Tɛtʋ ntɩ tə toŋtʋnaa napəlɩ pa tilaa na pá heeli Pɔɔlɩ sɩ ɩ ́ la suulu ɩ ́ taa polo kataɣa taa . Mpɛ ɩnɩ paa kɛ ́ ɩ taapalaa kʋpama napələɣɩ .

text: Some therefore cried one thing , and some another : for the assembly was confused ; and the more part knew not wherefore they were come together .
text2: Waatʋ ɩnəɣɩ mpʋ tɔ pə liɣita samaa tənaɣa na pá kiisiɣi yem , ɩnɛ sɩ ɩ ́ lɛ ́ ɩ nyəntʋ ntɔ , ɩnɛ sɩ ɩ ́ lɛ ́ ɩ nyəntʋ ntɔ . Haləna mpa pa ta tɩɩ nyəm mpi pə nyʋɣʋ tɔɔ pa kotaa tɔ pɛlɛ pa wiisina paɣalɛ .

text: And they drew Alexander out of the multitude , the Jews putting him forward . And Alexander beckoned with the hand , and would have made his defence unto the people .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ samaa ɩnɩ ɩ taa napəlɩ pa lɩɩwa na pá kɛɛsɩ Alɛkəsantəlɩ kɛ ɩsəna pə wɛɛ tɔ , na Yuta nyə ́ ma tuliɣi - ɩ sɩ ɩ ́ polo lɔlɔ . Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ ɩ nyəka - wɛɣɛ niŋ sɩ pá su . Ɩ caakaɣa tɔm yɔɣɔtʋɣʋ sɩ ɩ sɛɛna pa tɔɔ .

text: But when they knew that he was a Jew , all with one voice about the space of two hours cried out , Great is Diana of the Ephesians .
text2: Pa kɔma pá nɩɩ sɩ ɩ kɛ ́ Yuta tʋ ɩlɛna pá sʋʋ kpaalʋɣʋ sɩ : Ɩfeesu nyə ́ ma Aatema kɛna sɔsɔ , Ɩfeesu nyə ́ ma Aatema kɛna sɔsɔ , na pə ́ polo ɩsɩɩ kaləfunaa naalɛɣɛ mpʋ .

text: And when the townclerk had appeased the people , he said , Ye men of Ephesus , what man is there that knoweth not how that the city of the Ephesians is a worshipper of the great goddess Diana , and of the image which fell down from Jupiter ?
text2: Ɩcatɛ takəlasɩ ŋmaalʋ kɔma na ɩ ́ la na pá su təkulum , ɩlɛna ɩ ́ tɔ - wɛ sɩ : Ɩfeesu nyə ́ ma mɛ , antulinya ɩnɛ ɩ təna ɩ taa , awe tá nyəna sɩ Aatema kutuluɣu na ɩ lɛɛsʋɣʋ ŋku kʋ lɩɩna ɩsɔtaa tɔ , Ɩfeesu ɩcatɛ ntɛ ́ pə kite ?

text: Seeing then that these things cannot be spoken against , ye ought to be quiet , and to do nothing rashly .
text2: Nɔɣɔlʋ fɛɩ wei ɩ ka kpɛɛsɩ sɩ pə taɣa mpʋ tɔ . Pə tɔɔ kɛ ́ ɩ ́ ká kʋ mə pááná na ɩ ́ caɣa təpamm na ɩ ́ taa la mpi pə ta maɣa tɔ .

text: For ye have brought hither these men , which are neither robbers of churches , nor yet blasphemers of your goddess .
text2: Yəlaa mpa ɩ ́ kpa ɩsəntɔ tɔ pa ta wakəlɩ tá tʋɣʋ kutuluɣu nakʋlɩ . Pəyele pa ta tʋʋ tá tʋɣʋ alʋ nyəŋkʋ .

text: Wherefore if Demetrius , and the craftsmen which are with him , have a matter against any man , the law is open , and there are deputies : let them implead one another .
text2: Ye Temetiyusi na ɩ pəyalaa pa caa pa lana nɔɣɔlʋɣʋ tɔm ntɔ , hʋʋlɛ kʋyɛɛŋ wɛɛ mɛɛ . Pə ́ cɔ ́ pə kaasɩ tɔm hʋʋlaa wɛɛ tɔtɔ . Timpi pə wɛɛ sɩ pá pona - tɩ tɔɣɔlɛ .

text: But if ye inquire any thing concerning other matters , it shall be determined in a lawful assembly .
text2: Na ye ɩ ́ wɛna natəlɩ sɩ ɩ ́ caa ɩ maɣasɩ , ɩcatɛ sɔsaa kotuŋ taa kɛ ́ ɩ ́ ká pona - tɩ .

text: For we are in danger to be called in question for this day ' s uproar , there being no cause whereby we may give an account of this concourse .
text2: Pə təna mpi pə lapa ɩsəntɔ tɔ pa pəsəɣɩ pá kpa - tʋ sɩ tɛtʋ tɔkəlaa kɛ tə caa huɣu . Kotuɣu kʋnɛɣɛ saŋa , kʋ fɛɩna tampana , tá kaa pəsɩ na tə ́ cɛkəna pə kɛɛsʋɣʋ kɛ teitei .

text: And when he had thus spoken , he dismissed the assembly .
text2: Ɩ tɛma yɔɣɔtʋɣʋ kɛ mpʋ , ɩlɛna ɩ ́ yasɩ - wɛ .

text: And after the uproar was ceased , Paul called unto him the disciples , and embraced them , and departed for to go into Macedonia .
text2: Waatʋ wei kɔkɔtɛ hɛɛwa təpamm , ɩlɛna Pɔɔlɩ koti Ɩsɔ sɛɛlaa na ɩ ́ heeli - wɛ sɩ : Ɩ ́ tɔkɩ tɔnəŋ kɛ teu , ɩlɛna ɩ ́ la - wɛɣɛ pə lapa wulee na ɩ ́ tɛɛ Masetoni .

text: And when he had gone over those parts , and had given them much exhortation , he came into Greece ,
text2: Ɩ cɔɔwa na ɩ ́ la waasʋ kɛ hɔɣɔlʋɣʋ ŋkʋ kʋ nyə ́ ma , na pə ́ sɔɔsɩ - wɛɣɛ toma kɛ teu . Pəlɛ pə waalɩ , ɩlɛna ɩ ́ tɛɛ Kəlɛɛkɩ ,

text: And there abode three months . And when the Jews laid wait for him , as he was about to sail into Syria , he purposed to return through Macedonia .
text2: na ɩ ́ caɣa tənaɣa ɩsɔtʋnaa tooso . Waatʋ wei ɩ lapa sɔɔlʋ sɩ ɩ puki Silii ɩlɛna ɩ ́ nɩɩ sɩ Yuta nyə ́ ma tɔŋa ɩ mpaa kɛ pɛɛkʋɣʋ . Tənaɣa ɩ tɔma sɩ ɩ ká məŋna Masetoni tɔɔ kɛ ́ , tɔfɔ pə kaa la .

text: And there accompanied him into Asia Sopater of Berea ; and of the Thessalonians , Aristarchus and Secundus ; and Gaius of Derbe , and Timotheus ; and of Asia , Tychicus and Trophimus .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Pelee ɩcatɛ tʋ Pilusi pəyalʋ Sopatɛɛ ná təŋa - ɩ , na Tɛsalonikɩ nyə ́ ma Alisitaakɩ , na Sukunta na Tɛləpɩ tʋ Kayusi na Asii nyə ́ ma Timotee na Tisikɩ na Tʋlʋfim .

text: These going before tarried for us at Troas .
text2: Panɛ ɩnɩ pa tɛɛ - tʋɣʋ nɔɣɔ ɩlɛna pá polo pá taŋ - tʋɣʋ Tʋlʋwasɩ .

text: And we sailed away from Philippi after the days of unleavened bread , and came unto them to Troas in five days ; where we abode seven days .
text2: Kʋkʋsʋm fɛɩ potopotonaa acima tɛɛwa , ɩlɛna tə ́ sʋʋ kpɩɩlʋɣʋ kɛ Filipʋ , pə kɔma na pə ́ la wɛɛ kakpasɩ , ɩlɛna tə ́ maɣana - wɛɣɛ Tʋlʋwasɩ . Ɩlɛna tə ́ caɣa tənaɣa kʋyɛɛŋ naatosompɔɣɔlaɣa .

text: And upon the first day of the week , when the disciples came together to break bread , Paul preached unto them , ready to depart on the morrow ; and continued his speech until midnight .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Samatii ahoo tə kota təntəmlɛ kɛ tɔɣɔʋ . Ɩlɛna Pɔɔlɩ kʋlɩ na ɩ ́ la samaa kɛ waasʋ . Ɩ yɔɣɔta ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ haləna ahoo pɩɩ a taa . Pə taɣa pʋlʋ tɔɔ , pə wɛɛ sɩ kʋ fema ɩ ́ kʋlɩ .

text: And there were many lights in the upper chamber , where they were gathered together .
text2: Ɩsɔtaa kutuluɣu ŋku ɩnɩ kʋ taa tə kota mpʋ tɔ kʋ taa fətəlanaa ka tɔɔwa sɔsɔm .

text: And there sat in a window a certain young man named Eutychus , being fallen into a deep sleep : and as Paul was long preaching , he sunk down with sleep , and fell down from the third loft , and was taken up dead .
text2: Ɩfepu nɔɣɔlʋ ɩ ka caɣa tokolo tɔɔ , pa yaa - ɩ sɩ Ɩtike . Pɔɔlɩ waasʋ taɣalaa , ɩlɛna tom kpaɣa ɩfepu ɩnɩ na haləna ɩ ́ too teu . Tom kəla - ɩ tɛɛnaʋ , ɩlɛna ɩ ́ lɩɩ too ɩsɔtaa kutuluɣu tooso nyəŋkʋ taa na ɩ ́ hoti . Pa polaa pá kʋsɩ - ɩ ɩlɛna pá maɣana ɩ tɛma səpʋ .

text: And Paul went down , and fell on him , and embracing him said , Trouble not yourselves ; for his life is in him .
text2: Tənaɣa Pɔɔlɩ tiiwa na ɩ ́ luŋ ɩ tɔɔ na ɩ ́ kɛlɩ - ɩ ɩ niŋ taa . Ɩlɛna ɩ ́ tɔ sɩ : Ɩ ́ taa nəɣəsɩ , ɩ wɛna weesuɣu .

text: When he therefore was come up again , and had broken bread , and eaten , and talked a long while , even till break of day , so he departed .
text2: Pəlɛ pə waalɩ Pɔɔlɩ məla kpaʋ na ɩ ́ faɣa potopotonaa na tə tɔɣɔ . Ɩlɛna ɩ ́ məlɩ na ɩ ́ tasa waasʋ lapʋ kɛ mpʋʋ haləna pə nyaalɩ . Ɩlɛna ɩ ́ kpaɣa mpaaʋ na ɩ ́ tɛɛ .

text: And they brought the young man alive , and were not a little comforted .
text2: Ɩfepu ɩnɩ ɩ ́ lɛ ́ ɩ tɛɛna alaafəya təmammam , na mpʋ ɩnɩ pə ha pa tənaɣa apalʋtʋ kɛ sɔsɔm .

text: And we went before to ship , and sailed unto Assos , there intending to take in Paul : for so had he appointed , minding himself to go afoot .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ tá laala Pɔɔlɩ kɛ kʋlʋɣʋ sɩ tə puki tə ́ sʋʋ kpɩɩlʋɣʋ , na tə ́ tala Asɔɔsɩ na tə ́ kpaɣa - ɩ tənaɣa tá kpɩɩlʋɣʋ taa . Ɩ ka hʋʋwa sɩ ɩ puki təna , ɩlɛ nɔɔhɛɛ kɛ ɩ tɔŋaɣa .

text: And when he met with us at Assos , we took him in , and came to Mitylene .
text2: Tá na - ɩ tə sula təna , ɩlɛna ɩ ́ sʋʋ tá kpɩɩlʋɣʋ na tá na - ɩ tə ́ polo Mitilɛnɩ .

text: And we sailed thence , and came the next day over against Chios ; and the next day we arrived at Samos , and tarried at Trogyllium ; and the next day we came to Miletus .
text2: Tə kʋla təna na tɛʋ fe ɩlɛna tə loosiɣi Ciyo . Lɛŋkʋ fema ɩlɛna tə ́ lɩɩ Samɔɔsɩ tɔɔ . Pəlɛ pə tɛʋ kʋfemuɣu kɛ tə tala Mile .

text: For Paul had determined to sail by Ephesus , because he would not spend the time in Asia : for he hasted , if it were possible for him , to be at Jerusalem the day of Pentecost .
