text2: Pɔɔlɩ ta sɔɔlɩ sɩ ɩ ́ kʋ ɩ waatʋ kɛ Asii tɛtʋ taa , ɩlɛ ɩ ta nɔkɩ Ɩfeesu kɛ təŋʋɣʋ , ɩ cɔɔlaa na ɩ ́ tɛɛ . Ɩ lʋkaɣa sɩ pɩɩ takɩ Pɛntakɔnta acima wule tɔ pə maɣana ɩ wɛ Yosalɛm .

text: And from Miletus he sent to Ephesus , and called the elders of the church .
text2: Waatʋ wei Pɔɔlɩ wɛ Mile kɛ mpʋ tɔɣɔ ɩ tilaa sɩ pá heeli Ɩfeesu Yesu sɛɛlaa kpekəle nyʋɣʋ nyə ́ ma sɩ pá kɔɔ .

text: And when they were come to him , he said unto them , Ye know , from the first day that I came into Asia , after what manner I have been with you at all seasons ,
text2: Pa kɔma na pá tala , ɩlɛna ɩ ́ kaalɩ - wɛɣɛ tɔm pee sɩ : Ma na - mɛ tá caɣaʋ waatʋ təna taa ɩ ́ nyəmá tɔntɛ nte ma tɔma hatoo kʋyaŋku ma tala Asii tɛtʋ taa tɔ .

text: Serving the Lord with all humility of mind , and with many tears , and temptations , which befell me by the lying in wait of the Jews :
text2: Ma lapa Tacaa təmlɛ na ɩsəcaʋ fɛɩ pə taa . Yuta nyə ́ ma caɣa ma acaɣa tɔ ma wɩɩwa na má ná wahala kɛ teu .

text: And how I kept back nothing that was profitable unto you , but have shewed you , and have taught you publickly , and from house to house ,
text2: Ma ta pɛ - mɛɣɛ mpi ma nyəmá sɩ pɩɩ waasɩ - mɛ tɔ . Ma kpaala - mɛɣɛ pə təna , na má sɛɣɛsa yəlaa kɛ patəma taa na mə tɛɛsənaa taa tɔtɔ .

text: Testifying both to the Jews , and also to the Greeks , repentance toward God , and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ .
text2: Ma heela Yuta nyə ́ ma na mpa pa ta kɛ Yuta nyə ́ ma tɔ sɩ pá laɣasɩ tɔntɛ , na pá mələna Ɩsɔ tɔɔ , na pá mʋ Tacaa Yesu tɔm .

text: And now , behold , I go bound in the spirit unto Jerusalem , not knowing the things that shall befall me there :
text2: Tɔʋ , pənɛntɛ ma puki Yosalɛm . Feesuɣu Naŋŋtʋ caaləɣəna - m sɩ má polo , ma ta nyɩ mpi pɩɩ maɣana - m təna tɔ .

text: Save that the Holy Ghost witnesseth in every city , saying that bonds and afflictions abide me .
text2: Ama nti ma nyəmá tɔɣɔlɛ sɩ , paa ɩcatɛ nte tə taa kɛ ́ ma talaa , Feesuɣu Naŋŋtʋ kpaaləɣɩ - m ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ kpakpaa kɛ ́ sɩ saləka naŋŋ na wahalanaa taŋa - m .

text: But none of these things move me , neither count I my life dear unto myself , so that I might finish my course with joy , and the ministry , which I have received of the Lord Jesus , to testify the gospel of the grace of God .
text2: Paa na mpʋ maa nyənəɣɩ ma weesuɣu sɩ kʋ kɛ - m pʋlʋ . Təmlɛ nte Tacaa Yesu tʋ - m sɩ má hʋ ́ lɩ ́ Ɩsɔ pɛɛlɛɛ Laapaalɩ Kʋpaŋ tɔ , má nyəntɩ na má tɛ - tɛ te , má taa tuli tapəŋ .

text: And now , behold , I know that ye all , among whom I have gone preaching the kingdom of God , shall see my face no more .
text2: Mə tənaɣa ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ ma cɔɔwa na má la Ɩsɔ Kawulaɣa waasʋ . Nɔɔnɔɔ ma nyəmá teu sɩ , mə taa nɔɣɔlʋ ɩsəpəle kaa tasa - m keesuɣu .

text: Wherefore I take you to record this day , that I am pure from the blood of all men .
text2: Pə tɔɔ kɛ ́ ma heeliɣi - mɛɣɛ saŋa wʋlɛ tənɛ sɩ ye wei ɩ lepa pə kɛ ́ ɩ nyʋɣʋ tɔm , pə taɣa ma tɔm tɔtɔ .

text: For I have not shunned to declare unto you all the counsel of God .
text2: Ma sɛɣɛsa - mɛɣɛ ɩsəna Ɩsɔ sɩɩwa na ɩ ́ tɔŋna lapʋ tɔ pə tɔm təcɛɩcɛɩ , ma ta ŋmɛsɩ - mɛɣɛ natəlɩ .

text: Take heed therefore unto yourselves , and to all the flock , over the which the Holy Ghost hath made you overseers , to feed the church of God , which he hath purchased with his own blood .
text2: Mpʋ tɔ ɩ ́ nyɩ mə tɔntɛ . Pə kaasɩ na ɩ ́ tɔkɩ teu kɛ kaləkʋ ŋku Feesuɣu Naŋŋtʋ tʋ mə niŋ taa tɔ . Ɩ ́ paasəna Ɩsɔ sɛɛlaa kpekəle nte ɩ yapəna ɩ maɣamaɣa ɩ pəyaɣa caləm tɔ .

text: For I know this , that after my departing shall grievous wolves enter in among you , not sparing the flock .
text2: Pə taɣa pʋlʋ tɔɔ , ma nyəmá teu sɩ ma tɛɛʋ waalɩ yəlaa asaɣaa ká sʋʋ mə hɛkʋ ɩsɩɩ sʋnsʋməŋ sʋʋkʋɣʋ kaləkʋ taa tɔ , pə kaa la teu .

text: Also of your own selves shall men arise , speaking perverse things , to draw away disciples after them .
text2: Na mə hɛkʋ taa maɣamaɣa yəlaa ká kʋlɩ na pá sʋʋ kaloolaɣa tɔm yɔɣɔtʋɣʋ . Paa təŋsɩ Ɩsɔ sɛɛlaa kɛ pa waalɩ .

text: Therefore watch , and remember , that by the space of three years I ceased not to warn every one night and day with tears .
text2: Mpʋ tɔ ɩ ́ feŋ na ɩ ́ tɔɔsɩ sɩ saŋa taa pɩɩsɩ tooso kɔlɔ , tam kɛ ́ ma kpaaləɣɩ - mɛ na ɩsəlʋm , paa ahoo paa ilim .

text: And now , brethren , I commend you to God , and to the word of his grace , which is able to build you up , and to give you an inheritance among all them which are sanctified .
text2: Tɔʋ , pənɛntɛ ma kpaɣa - mɛ na má tʋ Ɩsɔ niŋ taa na ɩ tɔm kʋpantʋ taa tɔtɔ . Ɩnɩ ɩ pəsəɣəna na ɩ ́ sɔɔsɩ - mɛɣɛ toŋ na ɩ ́ la - mɛɣɛ kʋpantʋnaa mpa ɩ faɣasaa na ɩ ́ sɩɩ sɩ ɩ ká ha mpa pa kɛ ́ ɩ nyə ́ ma sɩ pə wɛɛ ɩsɩɩ pa kpancoou tɔ .

text: I have coveted no man ' s silver , or gold , or apparel .
text2: Ma ta nyɩɩlɩ nɔɣɔlʋ liɣitee yaa ɩ pəcɛkəlɛ .

text: Yea , ye yourselves know , that these hands have ministered unto my necessities , and to them that were with me .
text2: Mə maɣamaɣa ɩ nawa ɩsəna ma lapəna ma niŋ sɩ ma na mpa pa wɛ ma kiŋ tɔ tə kʋna ta pəkaatanaa tɔ .

text: I have shewed you all things , how that so labouring ye ought to support the weak , and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus , how he said , It is more blessed to give than to receive .
text2: Ma kʋlapʋtʋ təna taa ma caawa sɩ ɩ ́ nyɩ sɩ mə maɣamaɣa ɩ ́ ká la təmlɛ kɛ mpʋ na ɩ ́ hiki mpi ɩ ́ ká tena acamaa tɔ . Tə tɔɔsɩ tɔm nti Tacaa Yesu maɣamaɣa ka tɔma tɔ sɩ : Haʋ kəla laŋhʋlʋmlɛ kɛ mʋɣʋ .

text: And when he had thus spoken , he kneeled down , and prayed with them all .
text2: Pɔɔlɩ tɛma ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ yɔɣɔtaɣa , ɩlɛna ɩ ́ na pa təna pá luŋ na pá sələmɩ Ɩsɔ .

text: And they all wept sore , and fell on Paul ' s neck , and kissed him ,
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ pa təna pa sʋʋ wula na pá kpɛkəɣəna Pɔɔlɩ kɛ pa kpakpaa kpɛkʋɣʋ .

text: Sorrowing most of all for the words which he spake , that they should see his face no more . And they accompanied him unto the ship .
text2: Nti tə kəla pa laŋa wakəlʋɣʋ tɔɣɔlɛ ɩ tɔm sɩ pa kaa tasa ɩ ɩsəpəle taa kɛ ́ keesuɣu tɔ . Tənaɣa pa sɩɩ - ɩ na halɩ pá tana - ɩ kpɩɩlʋɣʋ kiŋ .

text: And it came to pass , that after we were gotten from them , and had launched , we came with a straight course unto Coos , and the day following unto Rhodes , and from thence unto Patara :
text2: Tə ya təmaɣa mpʋ , ɩlɛna táá sʋʋ kpɩɩlʋɣʋ na tə ́ tɛɛ Kɔɔsɩ kɛ kpakpaa . Kʋ fema ɩlɛna tə tala Lote . Tə kʋla təna , ɩlɛna tə tala Patala .

text: And finding a ship sailing over unto Phenicia , we went aboard , and set forth .
text2: Ɩlɛna tə ́ maɣana tənaɣa kpɩɩlʋɣʋ nakʋlɩ na kʋ puki Fenisii . Ɩlɛna tə ́ sʋʋ kʋlɛ na tə ́ tɛɛ .

text: Now when we had discovered Cyprus , we left it on the left hand , and sailed into Syria , and landed at Tyre : for there the ship was to unlade her burden .
text2: Tá kpɩɩlʋɣʋ kɔma na kʋ wʋsəna Sipili na tə ́ loosiɣi ɩcatɛ , ɩlɛna tə ́ kɛɛna tɛtʋ nti lʋm tama kotaɣa kɛ mpʋ tɔ tə pə tɛɛ tɔɔ na tə ́ məŋna Silii tɔɔ . Tə tala Tiii ɩlɛna tə ́ lɩɩ təna na pá tisi kpɩɩlʋɣʋ taa wontu .

text: And finding disciples , we tarried there seven days : who said to Paul through the Spirit , that he should not go up to Jerusalem .
text2: Na tə ́ maɣana Ɩsɔ sɛɛlaa kɛ təna , na tá na - wɛ tə ́ caɣa kʋyɛɛŋ naatosompɔɣɔlaɣa . Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Feesuɣu Naŋŋtʋ lapa na pá heeli Pɔɔlɩ sɩ ɩ ́ taa polo Yosalɛm .

text: And when we had accomplished those days , we departed and went our way ; and they all brought us on our way , with wives and children , till we were out of the city : and we kneeled down on the shore , and prayed .
text2: Tá na - wɛ tə tɛma caɣalɛ kɛ kʋyɛɛŋ naatosompɔɣɔlaɣa kɛ mpʋ , ɩlɛna táá kʋlɩ na tə ́ kpaɣa tá mpaaʋ . Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ pá na pa alaa na pa piya pa ləsa - tʋɣʋ mpaaʋ . Tə lɩɩ ɩcatɛ , ɩlɛna tá na - wɛ tə ́ luŋ akula kɛ teŋku nɔɣɔ na tə ́ sələmɩ Ɩsɔ .

text: And when we had taken our leave one of another , we took ship ; and they returned home again .
text2: Tá na - wɛ tə lapa təmaɣa pə lapa wulee , ɩlɛna táá kpa kpɩɩlʋɣʋ na pə ́ kaasɩ na mpɛ pá məlɩ kpente .

text: And when we had finished our course from Tyre , we came to Ptolemais , and saluted the brethren , and abode with them one day .
text2: Tə lɩɩʋ Tiii kɛ mpʋ tɔ hatoo Pətolomayisi kɛ tá kpɩɩlʋɣʋ sʋʋʋ sɩɩ tənaɣa . Tənaɣa tə lɩɩwa na tə ́ polo tə ́ sɛɛ tá taapalaa na tá na - wɛ tə ́ caɣa wʋlɛ kʋlʋmtəlɛ .

text: And the next day we that were of Paul ' s company departed , and came unto Caesarea : and we entered into the house of Philip the evangelist , which was one of the seven ; and abode with him .
text2: Tɛʋ fema ɩlɛna tə ́ taɣanɩ kʋlʋɣʋ na tə ́ polo Sesalee . Tə tala təna ɩlɛna tə ́ sʋʋ waasʋ yɛllʋ Filipʋ təyaɣa na tə ́ həntɩ ɩ tɛ . Filipʋ ɩnɩ ɩ ka kɛ ́ yəlaa naatosompɔɣɔlaɣa wei paa ləsəna pa mpaa kɛ Yosalɛm taa tɔ pa taa lɛlʋ .

text: And the same man had four daughters , virgins , which did prophesy .
text2: Ɩ wɛna pɛɛlaa kɛ liɣiti , pa ta saa apalaa , na pa kpaalaɣa Ɩsɔ kʋheelitu .

text: And as we tarried there many days , there came down from Judaea a certain prophet , named Agabus .
text2: Tə caɣa tənaɣa wɛɛ naalɛ , ɩlɛna apalʋ nɔɣɔlʋ lɩɩna Yuta na ɩ ́ kɔɔ , pa yaa - ɩ sɩ Akapusi . Ɩ ka kɛ ́ Ɩsɔ kʋyɔɣɔtʋtʋ tɛləsʋlʋ kɛ ́ .

text: And when he was come unto us , he took Paul ' s girdle , and bound his own hands and feet , and said , Thus saith the Holy Ghost , So shall the Jews at Jerusalem bind the man that owneth this girdle , and shall deliver him into the hands of the Gentiles .
text2: Apalʋ ɩnɩ ɩ kɔma tá kiŋ na ɩ ́ kpaɣa Pɔɔlɩ tampala na ɩ ́ hɔkɔ ɩ nɔɔhɛɛ na ɩ niŋ , na ɩ ́ tɔ sɩ : Ɩɩ naa nti Feesuɣu Naŋŋtʋ yɔɣɔtəɣɩ tɔ . Yuta nyə ́ ma ká hɔkɔ Yosalɛm taa kɛ ́ tampala ɩnɛ ɩ tʋ , na pá kpaɣa - ɩ na pá pɛtɩ - ɩ kpaɩ nyə ́ ma .

text: And when we heard these things , both we , and they of that place , besought him not to go up to Jerusalem .
text2: Tə nɩɩ mpʋ , ɩlɛna tá maɣamaɣa na Sesalee nyə ́ ma tə ́ wiina Pɔɔlɩ sɩ ɩ ́ taa polo Yosalɛm .

text: Then Paul answered , What mean ye to weep and to break mine heart ? for I am ready not to be bound only , but also to die at Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus .
text2: Tənaɣa ɩ tɔma sɩ : Pepe tɔɔ kɛ ́ ɩ ́ wiiki na ɩ ́ caa sɩ ɩ ́ la na pə ́ yɔɔlɩ - m . Ama má , ma sɔɔlʋ pɩɩwaɣa sɩ pə taa la hɔkʋɣʋ tɔm tike . Paa kʋɣʋ , pá kʋ - m Yosalɛm kɛ Tacaa Yesu nyʋɣʋ tɔɔ .

text: And when he would not be persuaded , we ceased , saying , The will of the Lord be done .
text2: Tə lapa Pɔɔlɩ kɛ pə təna na tə ́ kpisi ɩlɛna táá yele - ɩ wiinaʋ . Tənaɣa tə tɔma sɩ : Ye Tacaa ɩ ́ nɔka mpi , pəlɛ pə la .

text: And after those days we took up our carriages , and went up to Jerusalem .
text2: Tə lapa wɛɛ naalɛɣɛ təna , ɩlɛna tə ́ la sɔɔlʋ sɩ tə puki Yosalɛm .

text: There went with us also certain of the disciples of Caesarea , and brought with them one Mnason of Cyprus , an old disciple , with whom we should lodge .
text2: Tacaa təŋlaa napələɣɩ Sesalee ná təŋa - tʋ sɩ paa pona - tʋ na tə ́ həntɩ Sipili apalʋ nɔɣɔlʋ ɩ tɛ , pa yaa - ɩ sɩ Naasɔŋ . Ɩ sʋʋ Ɩsɔ sɛɛʋ tɔ pə taɣa saŋa .

text: And when we were come to Jerusalem , the brethren received us gladly .
text2: Tə kɔma na tə ́ tala Yosalɛm ɩlɛna tá taapalaa laŋlɛ hɛɛna tá kɔntɛ .

text: And the day following Paul went in with us unto James ; and all the elders were present .
text2: Kʋ fema ɩlɛna tá na Pɔɔlɩ tə ́ polo Saakɩ tɛ , Ɩsɔ təsɛɛlɛ sɔsaa təna kota təna .

text: And when he had saluted them , he declared particularly what things God had wrought among the Gentiles by his ministry .
text2: Ɩlɛna Pɔɔlɩ sɛɛ - wɛ na ɩ ́ kɛɛsɩ - wɛɣɛ pə təna mpi Ɩsɔ lapəna ɩ niŋ kɛ mpa pa ta kɛ Yuta nyə ́ ma tɔ pa hɛkʋ tɔ .

text: And when they heard it , they glorified the Lord , and said unto him , Thou seest , brother , how many thousands of Jews there are which believe ; and they are all zealous of the law :
text2: Pɛlɛ pa nɩɩ mpʋ , ɩlɛna pá sa Ɩsɔ , na pá tɔ Pɔɔlɩ sɩ : Tá taapalʋ , nyənɩ , Yuta nyə ́ ma iyisi iyisi mʋwa Tacaa tɔm . Pa təna pa ɩsɛ sɛɛna Moisi kʋsəsɩɩtʋ təŋʋɣʋ .

text: And they are informed of thee , that thou teachest all the Jews which are among the Gentiles to forsake Moses , saying that they ought not to circumcise their children , neither to walk after the customs .
text2: Pa heela - wɛ təfoo sɩ n heeliɣi Yuta nyə ́ ma mpa pa wɛ piitim lɛmpɩ hɛkʋ tɔ sɩ pá yele Moisi kʋsəsɩɩtʋ . Pá taa pɛlɩ pa piya . Pəyele sɩ pá taa təŋ Yuta nyə ́ ma kʋlapʋtʋ .

text: What is it therefore ? the multitude must needs come together : for they will hear that thou art come .
text2: Paa pɩɩ la ɩsəna paa nɩɩ nyá kɔntɛ tɔm . Tɔʋ , na ɩsənaɣalɛ ?

text: Do therefore this that we say to thee : We have four men which have a vow on them ;
text2: Tɩɩ hʋ ́ lɩ ́ - ŋ ɩsəna n ka la tɔ . Apalaa liɣiti nɔɣɔlʋ ɩ wɛ cənɛ mpa pa sɩɩ pa nɔɔsɩ na pá tɔŋna pə kɔtaɣa tɔ .

text: Them take , and purify thyself with them , and be at charges with them , that they may shave their heads : and all may know that those things , whereof they were informed concerning thee , are nothing ; but that thou thyself also walkest orderly , and keepest the law .
text2: Kpaɣa - wɛ na nyá na - wɛ ɩ ́ kpɛntɩ na ɩ ́ lá nyɔɔŋ tɔɔ asilima kɛɛlʋɣʋ kɔtaɣa . Caa liɣitee na pá looli pa nyɔɔŋ . Saa ɩnɩ paa wei ɩ ká nyɩ sɩ nti pa yɔɣɔtaa tɔ pa tʋ - ŋ - təɣɩ kʋtʋɣʋ kɛ ́ . Ama nyá , nyá tɔŋna Moisi kʋsəsɩɩtʋ kɛ təŋʋɣʋ .

text: As touching the Gentiles which believe , we have written and concluded that they observe no such thing , save only that they keep themselves from things offered to idols , and from blood , and from strangled , and from fornication .
text2: Ye mpa pa ta kɛ Yuta nyə ́ ma na pá pəsa Kilisiti nyə ́ ma ɩlɛ , tə tɛma pɛlɛɣɛ lɛɛtəlɩ ŋmaaʋ na tə ́ heeli - wɛɣɛ nti tə ləsaa na tə ́ sɩɩ tɔ sɩ , pá kii nantʋ kʋlalaatʋ , na caləm na kpəntɛ nte pa ta lɛntɩ tɔ , na pá yele tɛtɛlakasɩ təkpataa .

text: Then Paul took the men , and the next day purifying himself with them entered into the temple , to signify the accomplishment of the days of purifcation , until that an offering should be offered for every one of them .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Pɔɔlɩ kpaɣa yəlaa liɣiti ɩnɩ . Tɛʋ fema , ɩlɛna ɩ ́ na - wɛ pá kpɛntɩ na pá la nyɔɔŋ tɔɔ asilima kɛɛlʋɣʋ kɔtaɣa . Pəlɛ pə waalɩ , ɩlɛna ɩ ́ polo Ɩsɔ təsɛɛlɛ na ɩ ́ kpaalɩ kʋyaŋku pa kɔtaɣa ka sɩɩ tənaɣa tɔ . Pə wɛɛ sɩ kʋyakʋ ŋku paa la kɔtasɩ kɛ paa wei ɩ nyʋɣʋ tɔɔ tɔ .

text: And when the seven days were almost ended , the Jews which were of Asia , when they saw him in the temple , stirred up all the people , and laid hands on him ,
text2: Kʋyɛɛŋ naatosompɔɣɔlaɣa ɩnɩ ɩ kɔma sɩ ɩ yoosiɣi , ɩlɛ Yuta nyə ́ ma mpa pa lɩɩna Asii tɛtʋ tɔ pa ná Pɔɔlɩ kɛlɛ Ɩsɔ təsɛɛlɛ taa . Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ pa kpaasa yəlaa təna pááná na pá kpa - ɩ .

text: Crying out , Men of Israel , help : This is the man , that teacheth all men every where against the people , and the law , and this place : and further brought Greeks also into the temple , and hath polluted this holy place .
text2: Na pá makɩ kapusi sɩ Ɩsɛɣɛlɩ yəlaa ɩ ́ kɔɔ yoo . Apalʋ ɩnɛ ɩ cɔɔna na ɩ ́ lakɩ waasʋ kɛ paa timpi na ɩ ́ yoosiɣi yəlaa təna na Ɩsɛɣɛlɩ nyə ́ ma na ɩ ́ saɣatəɣɩ Moisi kʋsəsɩɩtʋ , na Ɩsɔ təsɛɛlɛ tənɛ . Na ɩ tasa nɔɔnɔɔ kɛ ́ sʋsʋɣʋ kɛ Ɩsɔ təsɛɛlɛ taa kɛ ́ mpa pa ta kɛ Yuta nyə ́ ma tɔ , na pá wakəlɩ katɛ təcaɣalɛ tənɛ .

text: ( For they had seen before with him in the city Trophimus an Ephesian , whom they supposed that Paul had brought into the temple . )
text2: Pə taɣa pʋlʋ tɔɔ kɛ ́ pa yɔɣɔta mpʋ , pa na Pɔɔlɩ na Ɩfeesu Tʋlʋfim kɛ ɩcatɛ taa na pa hʋʋwa sɩ Pɔɔlɩ kpɛŋna - ɩ na ɩ ́ sʋsɩ Ɩsɔ təsɛɛlɛ taa .

text: And all the city was moved , and the people ran together : and they took Paul , and drew him out of the temple : and forthwith the doors were shut .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ ɩcatɛ təna cʋkaa na yəlaa seekina paa timpiɣi kpilikpili na pá kɔŋ . Tənaɣa pa kpá Pɔɔlɩ na pá hɔmɩ - ɩ na pá lɩɩna awalɩ , ɩlɛna pá təkɩ Ɩsɔ təsɛɛlɛ nɔnɔɔsɩ kɛ kpakpaa .

text: And as they went about to kill him , tidings came unto the chief captain of the band , that all Jerusalem was in an uproar .
text2: Pa caakaɣa sɩ pá kʋ - ɩ , ɩlɛ laapaalɩ tala Lom yoolaa tintiɣile kʋmataŋ kɛlɛ sɩ , Yosalɛm təna cʋkaa .

text: Who immediately took soldiers and centurions , and ran down unto them : and when they saw the chief captain and the soldiers , they left beating of Paul .
text2: Tənaɣa ɩ kpaɣa yoolaa na pa sɔsaa kɛ kpakpaa na pá se na pá polo samaa kiŋ . Pa nawa kʋmataŋ ɩnɩ na ɩ yoolaa , ɩlɛna pá yele Pɔɔlɩ kɛ mapʋ .

text: Then the chief captain came near , and took him , and commanded him to be bound with two chains ; and demanded who he was , and what he had done .
text2: Tənaɣa kʋmataŋ pola Pɔɔlɩ kiŋ , na ɩ ́ tɔ sɩ pá kpa - ɩ na pá hɔkɔ - ɩ na alukpala naalɛ . Pə waalɩ kɛ ́ ɩ pɔɔsaa sɩ , ɩ kɛ ́ awe , na pepeɣe ɩ lapa ?

text: And some cried one thing , some another , among the multitude : and when he could not know the certainty for the tumult , he commanded him to be carried into the castle .
text2: Ɩlɛna samaa ɩnɩ ɩ taa , ɩnɛ sɩ ɩ nyəntʋ , ɩnɛ ɩ ́ lɛ ́ sɩ ɩ nyəntʋ . Yoolaa kʋmataŋ ɩnɩ ɩ nawa sɩ ɩ kaa pəsɩ na ɩ ́ cɛkəna pə tɔm kɛ teitei kɛ ́ cʋkʋɣʋ pənɛ pə taa . Ɩlɛna ɩ ́ tɔ sɩ pá tɛɛna Pɔɔlɩ kɛ yoolaa yoou kutuluɣu taa .

text: And when he came upon the stairs , so it was , that he was borne of the soldiers for the violence of the people .
text2: Pa kɔma na pá tana - ɩ timpi pa kpaa na pá sʋʋkɩ kutuluɣu ŋkʋ kʋ taa tɔ , ɩlɛna yəlaa huliɣi - ɩ . Tənaɣa yoolaa kpaɣa - ɩ na pá hɔɣɔlɩ - ɩ heeheempaa .

text: For the multitude of the people followed after , crying , Away with him .
text2: Pə taɣa pʋlʋ tɔɔ , yəlaa təna təŋaɣa - ɩ kɛ ́ na pá tɔŋ sɩ ɩ ́ kʋ - ɩ .

text: And as Paul was to be led into the castle , he said unto the chief captain , May I speak unto thee ? Who said , Canst thou speak Greek ?
text2: Pa kɔma sɩ pa sʋsəɣɩ Pɔɔlɩ kɛ yoolaa kutuluɣu , ɩlɛna ɩ ́ tɔ kʋmataŋ sɩ : N kaa ha - m mpaa na má heeli - ŋ natələɣɩ pəcɔ ? Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ kʋmataŋ pɔɔsa Pɔɔlɩ sɩ : N nɩɩkɩ Kəlɛɛkɩ tɔm kɛ ?

text: Art not thou that Egyptian , which before these days madest an uproar , and leddest out into the wilderness four thousand men that were murderers ?
text2: Ye mpʋ pə taɣa nyaɣalɛ Icipiti tʋ wei wulenaa taa ɩ kʋlaa na ɩ ́ kpɛɛsəna tɛtʋ tɔkəlaa tɔ ? Wei ɩ kpaɣa yʋlʋkʋlaa iyisi liɣiti ( 4000 ) na ɩ ́ tɛɛna wʋlaɣa tɛtʋ taa tɔ ?

text: But Paul said , I am a man which am a Jew of Tarsus , a city in Cilicia , a citizen of no mean city : and , I beseech thee , suffer me to speak unto the people .
text2: Tənaɣa Pɔɔlɩ cɔ - wɛ sɩ : Pə taɣa ma . Ma kɛ ́ Yuta tʋ kɛ ́ , na pa lʋla - m Taasɩ kɛ Silisii tɛtʋ taa . Ma kɛ ́ ɩcatɛ sɔsɔɔlɛ taa tɛtʋ pu . La suulu na ń yele na má yɔɣɔtəna samaa .

text: And when he had given him licence , Paul stood on the stairs , and beckoned with the hand unto the people . And when there was made a great silence , he spake unto them in the Hebrew tongue , saying ,
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ yoolaa kʋmataŋ ha - ɩ nɔɣɔ sɩ ɩ ́ yɔɣɔtɩ . Tənaɣa Pɔɔlɩ səŋa timpi pa kpaa na pá sʋʋkɩ kutuluɣu taa tɔ , na ɩ ́ nyəkɩ yəlaa kɛ niŋ . Pa təna pa suma tətiɣitiɣi , ɩlɛna Pɔɔlɩ yɔɣɔtəna - wɛ na Alaamee tɔm taa sɩ :

text: Men , brethren , and fathers , hear ye my defence which I make now unto you .
text2: Ma taapalaa na ma caanaa mɛ , ɩ ́ nɩɩ nti ma caa ma heeli - mɛɣɛ ma tɔm tɔɔ kɛ ́ nɔɔnɔɔ tɔ .

text: ( And when they heard that he spake in the Hebrew tongue to them , they kept the more silence : and he saith , )
text2: Pa nɩɩ ɩ yɔɣɔtəna - wɛɣɛ Alaamee tɔm , ɩlɛna pá laɣasɩ caɣalɛ . Tənaɣa Pɔɔlɩ tɔma sɩ :

text: I am verily a man which am a Jew , born in Tarsus , a city in Cilicia , yet brought up in this city at the feet of Gamaliel , and taught according to the perfect manner of the law of the fathers , and was zealous toward God , as ye all are this day .
text2: Ma kɛ ́ Yuta tʋ na pa lʋla - m Taasɩ kɛ Silisii tɛtʋ taa . Ama Yosalɛm cənɛɣɛ ma pɩɩ Kamaliyɛɛ niŋ taa . Kamaliyɛɛ ɩnɩ ɩ yelina na má nyɩ tá caanaa kɔtasɩ təpaɩpaɩ . Na ma sɛɛsa ɩsəlɛ kɛ teu na mpi pə kɛ ́ Ɩsɔ luɣu nyəntʋ tɔ pə lapʋ taa kɛ ́ teitei ɩsɩɩ mə lakʋɣʋ saŋa kɛ ɩsəntɔ tɔ .

text: And I persecuted this way unto the death , binding and delivering into prisons both men and women .
text2: Ma tʋ Tacaa mpaaʋ kʋnɛ kʋ nyə ́ ma kɛ kʋnyɔŋ , haləna lɛlaa caŋ na pá sɩ . Ma kpa apalaa na alaa na má pɛtɩ saləka taa .

text: As also the high priest doth bear me witness , and all the estate of the elders : from whom also I received letters unto the brethren , and went to Damascus , to bring them which were there bound unto Jerusalem , for to be punished .
text2: Kɔtʋlʋ sɔsɔ na nyʋɣʋ nyə ́ ma nyʋɣʋ nyə ́ ma nyəmá mpʋ təkelekele . Mpɛ pa cɛləna - m takəlasɩ nsi pa ŋmaa tá tɛɛtʋnaa Yuta nyə ́ ma mpa pa wɛ Tamasɩ tɔ . Ma pukaɣa tənaɣa sɩ má kpa mpa pa wɛ təna na pá mʋ Tacaa tɔm tɔ na má kɔna - wɛɣɛ Yosalɛm kɛ saləka tʋɣʋ .

text: And it came to pass , that , as I made my journey , and was come nigh unto Damascus about noon , suddenly there shone from heaven a great light round about me .
text2: Ma tɔŋna tɔntɛ na má kpətəna Tamasɩ kɛ ilim sikuɣu , ɩlɛ pə lɩɩna ɩsɔ kɛlɛ na pə ́ lá ma ɩsɛntɔɔ tənyalulu ɩsɩɩ kɔkɔ kɛ tɔm kʋlʋm tɔɔ na pə ́ ná na pə ́ cɔɔna - m .

text: And I fell unto the ground , and heard a voice saying unto me , Saul , Saul , why persecutest thou me ?
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ ma hota atɛ na má nɩɩ pə pɔɔsəɣɩ - m sɩ : Sɔɔlɩ Sɔɔlɩ pepe tɔɔ kɛ ́ n tʋɣʋ - m kʋnyɔŋ kɛ mpʋ ?

text: And I answered , Who art thou , Lord ? And he said unto me , I am Jesus of Nazareth , whom thou persecutest .
text2: Tənaɣa ma pɔɔsaa sɩ : Tacaa , nyaɣa aweɣe ye ? Ɩlɛna pə ́ cɔ - m sɩ : Maɣa Nasalɛtɩ Yesu wei n tʋɣɩ kʋnyɔŋ tɔ .

text: And they that were with me saw indeed the light , and were afraid ; but they heard not the voice of him that spake to me .
text2: Má na mpa tə tɔŋaɣa tɔ pɛlɛ pa na nyaləməlɛ ńtɛ ́ . Ama pa ta nɩɩ pə yɔɣɔtaɣana - m tɔ .

text: And I said , What shall I do , Lord ? And the Lord said unto me , Arise , and go into Damascus ; and there it shall be told thee of all things which are appointed for thee to do .
text2: Tənaɣa ma pɔɔsaa sɩ : Tacaa , ɩsənaɣa maa la ? Ɩlɛna Tacaa cɔ - m sɩ : Kʋlɩ na ń polo Tamasɩ , tənaɣa paa heeli - ŋ pə təna mpi Ɩsɔ tʋ - ŋ sɩ ń la tɔ .

text: And when I could not see for the glory of that light , being led by the hand of them that were with me , I came into Damascus .
text2: Kɔkɔ nyaləməlɛ ńtɛ ́ tə katatəlaɣa tɔɔ pə kʋ ma ɩsɛ maa tasəɣɩ naʋ . Ɩlɛna ma na mpa tɔ pá hɔ ma niŋ taa na pá pona - m Tamasɩ .

text: And one Ananias , a devout man according to the law , having a good report of all the Jews which dwelt there ,
text2: Apalʋ nɔɣɔlʋ ɩ ka wɛ təna na pá yaa - ɩ sɩ Ananiyasɩ . Ɩ təŋaɣa Ɩsɔ mpaaʋ kɛ teu tɔtɔ , na ɩ təŋaɣa tá kʋsəsɩɩtʋ kɛ teu , na Tamasɩ Yuta nyə ́ ma təna pʋɣʋlaɣa - ɩ .

text: Came unto me , and stood , and said unto me , Brother Saul , receive thy sight . And the same hour I looked up upon him .
text2: Apalʋ ɩnɩ ɩ kɔma ɩ ́ maɣana - m , na ɩ ́ səŋ ma kɔŋkɔŋ taa na ɩ ́ tɔ - m sɩ : Ma taapalʋ Sɔɔlɩ , nyá ɩsɛ ɩ ́ kuli . Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ ma ɩsɛ kula tənɛ ɩnəɣɩ kpakpaa na má sʋʋ - ɩ naʋ .

text: And he said , The God of our fathers hath chosen thee , that thou shouldest know his will , and see that Just One , and shouldest hear the voice of his mouth .
text2: Ɩlɛna ɩ ́ heeli - m sɩ : Tá caanaa caanaa Ɩsɔ ka ləsa - ŋ tuu lɔŋ kɛ ́ , sɩ n ká nyɩ ɩ luɣu nyəntʋ , na n ká ná wei ɩ tike ɩ kɛ ́ tampana tʋ tɔ , na ń nɩɩ ɩ maɣamaɣa ɩ nɔɣɔ təsiɣisiɣi .

text: For thou shalt be his witness unto all men of what thou hast seen and heard .
text2: Pə taɣa pʋlʋ tɔɔ , n ka heeli yəlaa kɛ ɩ tɔm , na ń kɛɛsɩ pa tənaɣa mpi n nawa na n nɩɩwa tɔ pə tɔm .

text: And now why tarriest thou ? arise , and be baptized , and wash away thy sins , calling on the name of the Lord .
text2: Ye mpʋ ɩlɛ , n tasəɣɩ weɣe taŋʋɣʋ tɔtɔ ? Kʋlɩ na pá yaa ɩ hətɛ na pá sɔ - ŋ Ɩsɔ lʋm na pə ́ taɣanɩ - ŋ nyá ɩsaɣatʋ .

text: And it came to pass , that , when I was come again to Jerusalem , even while I prayed in the temple , I was in a trance ;
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ ma kʋlaa na má məlɩ Yosalɛm . Ma sələmaɣa Ɩsɔ təsɛɛlɛ taa , ɩlɛna pə ́ la - m ɩsɩɩ toosee taka ,

text: And saw him saying unto me , Make haste , and get thee quickly out of Jerusalem : for they will not receive thy testimony concerning me .
text2: na má ná Tacaa , na ɩ ́ tɔ - m sɩ : La na ń lɩɩ Yosalɛm kɛ lɔŋ . Pə taɣa pʋlʋ tɔɔ , ɩcatɛ tənɛ tə nyə ́ ma kaa mʋ ma tɔm nti tə tampana n ka hʋ ́ lɩ ́ - wɛ tɔ .

text: And I said , Lord , they know that I imprisoned and beat in every synagogue them that believed on thee :
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ ma cɔ - ɩ sɩ : Tacaa , pa nyəmá teu sɩ má cɔɔkaɣana Yuta nyə ́ ma təkotilenaa taa na má kpaa mpa mpa pa mʋ nyá tɔm tɔ na má təkəɣɩ na má makɩ - wɛ .

text: And when the blood of thy martyr Stephen was shed , I also was standing by , and consenting unto his death , and kept the raiment of them that slew him .
text2: Pa kʋkaɣa nyá yʋlʋ Ɩtiyɛɛnɩ tɔ ma wɛ təna tɔtɔ . Ma laŋlɛ hɛɛna mpa pa kʋ - ɩ tɔ , na má tɔkəna pa tɔɔ wontu .

text: And he said unto me , Depart : for I will send thee far hence unto the Gentiles .
text2: Ɩlɛna Tacaa tɔ - m sɩ : Kʋlɩ na ń polo pooluŋ kɛ mpa pa ta kɛ Yuta nyə ́ ma tɔ pa kiŋ .

text: And they gave him audience unto this word , and then lifted up their voices , and said , Away with such a fellow from the earth : for it is not fit that he should live .
text2: Samaa nɩɩna Pɔɔlɩ haləna pə tala tɔm tənɛ ɩnɩ , ɩlɛna pá sʋʋ kapusi mapʋ sɩ : Ɩ ́ ləsɩ ɩ weesuɣu . Pə wɛɛ sɩ pá kʋ - ɩ kɛ ́ . Pə ta nəɣəsəna pá yele - ɩ na ɩ weesuɣu .

text: And as they cried out , and cast off their clothes , and threw dust into the air ,
text2: Pa kiisaɣa mpʋ na pá ciɣitiɣi pa wontu na pá faləɣɩ tɛtʋ .

text: The chief captain commanded him to be brought into the castle , and bade that he should be examined by scourging ; that he might know wherefore they cried so against him .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ yoolaa kʋmataŋ tɔma sɩ pá sʋʋna Pɔɔlɩ kɛ yoolaa kutuluɣu toŋ nyəŋkʋ taa na pá casa - ɩ akpatɛɛ kɛ teu na pə ́ cɔ ́ ɩ ́ heeli mpi pə tɔɔ samaa təna makɩ ɩ tɔɔ kɛ ́ kapusi kɛ mpʋ tɔ .

text: And as they bound him with thongs , Paul said unto the centurion that stood by , Is it lawful for you to scourge a man that is a Roman , and uncondemned ?
text2: Ama waatʋ wei pa tɛma - ɩ hɔkʋɣʋ sɩ pa makɩ tɔ , Pɔɔlɩ pɔɔsa yoolaa sɔsɔ wei ɩ səŋa ɩ kiŋ tɔ sɩ : Ɩ ́ wɛna mpaa sɩ ɩ ́ ma Lom tʋ kɛ yem na ɩ ́ ta nata ɩ tasəkəlɛ ?

text: When the centurion heard that , he went and told the chief captain , saying , Take heed what thou doest : for this man is a Roman .
text2: Yoolaa sɔsɔ ɩnɩ ɩ nɩɩ tɔm tənɛ ɩnɩ ɩlɛna ɩ ́ polo ɩ ́ maɣana yoolaa kʋmataŋ na ɩ ́ heeli - ɩ sɩ : Sɛsɛ apalʋ ɩnɩ Lom tʋ ntɛ ́ fa . Hei n lakɩ ɩsəna ?

text: Then the chief captain came , and said unto him , Tell me , art thou a Roman ? He said , Yea .
text2: Tənaɣa kʋmataŋ polaa na ɩ ́ pɔɔsɩ Pɔɔlɩ sɩ : N kɛ ́ Lom tʋ yaa , heeli - m . Tənaɣa Pɔɔlɩ cɔ - ɩ sɩ : Mm .

text: And the chief captain answered , With a great sum obtained I this freedom . And Paul said , But I was free born .
text2: Ɩlɛna kʋmataŋ ɩnɩ ɩ ́ tasa yɔɣɔtʋɣʋ sɩ : Liɣitee kɛ ma huta teu na pə ́ cɔ ́ má pəsɩ Lom tʋ . Tənaɣa Pɔɔlɩ ná cɔ - ɩ sɩ : Pa lʋla maɣa Lom tʋ kɛ ́ .

text: Then straightway they departed from him which should have examined him : and the chief captain also was afraid , after he knew that he was a Roman , and because he had bound him .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ mpa pa caakaɣa - ɩ mapʋ sɩ ɩ ́ yɔɣɔtɩ tɔ pa sʋʋ sewa . Ɩlɛna sɔɣɔntʋ kpa kʋmataŋ maɣamaɣa kɛ waatʋ wei ɩ nawa sɩ Pɔɔlɩ kɛ ́ Lom tʋ pəyele ɩnɩ ɩ lapəna na pá hɔkɔ - ɩ alukpala tɔ .

text: On the morrow , because he would have known the certainty wherefore he was accused of the Jews , he loosed him from his bands , and commanded the chief priests and all their council to appear , and brought Paul down , and set him before them .
text2: Kʋmataŋ ɩnɩ ɩ caakaɣa sɩ ɩ ́ nyɩ mpi pə maɣamaɣa pə nyʋɣʋ tɔɔ Yuta nyə ́ ma lakaɣa Pɔɔlɩ kɛ tɔm tɔ . Pə tɔɔ kɛ ́ kʋ fema ɩlɛna ɩ ́ hɛtɩ Pɔɔlɩ alukpala na ɩ ́ tɔ sɩ : Kɔtəlaa sɔsaa na kotuɣu sɔsɔɔʋ nyə ́ ma ɩ ́ koti . Ɩlɛna ɩ ́ kɔna Pɔɔlɩ na ɩ ́ sɩɩ pa ɩsɛntaa .

text: And Paul , earnestly beholding the council , said , Men and brethren , I have lived in all good conscience before God until this day .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Pɔɔlɩ pama ɩsɛ kɛ kotuɣu nyə ́ ma tɔɔ na ɩ ́ tɔ sɩ : Ma tɛɛtʋnaa mɛ , na lotu kʋlʋmtʋ təkpataa kɛ ́ ma tɔmna Ɩsɔ ɩsɛntaa kɛ ́ haləna saŋa .

text: And the high priest Ananias commanded them that stood by him to smite him on the mouth .
text2: Tənaɣa kɔtʋlʋ sɔsɔ Ananiyasɩ tɔma mpa paa səŋa Pɔɔlɩ kiŋ tɔ sɩ pá ma ɩ nɔɣɔ kɛ kataŋa .

text: Then said Paul unto him , God shall smite thee , thou whited wall : for sittest thou to judge me after the law , and commandest me to be smitten contrary to the law ?
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Pɔɔlɩ tɔma - ɩ sɩ : Nyənɩ ɩ wɛʋ ɩsɩɩ koluŋa kʋhʋlʋmaɣa , Ɩsɔ ka mana - ŋ . N caɣaa na ń hʋʋkəna - m tɔm ɩsɩɩ kiiu səŋaa tɔ pə teitei . Pəyele n ŋmaana kiiu ŋkʋ kʋ tɔɔ na ń tɔ sɩ pá ma - m ?

text: And they that stood by said , Revilest thou God ' s high priest ?
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ mpa paa caɣaa na pá kpətəna Pɔɔlɩ tɔ pa tɔma sɩ : Ha , Ɩsɔ kɔtʋlʋ sɔsɔ kɛ n tʋʋkɩ mpʋ ?

text: Then said Paul , I wist not , brethren , that he was the high priest : for it is written , Thou shalt not speak evil of the ruler of thy people .
text2: Tənaɣa Pɔɔlɩ tɔma sɩ : Ma tɛɛtʋnaa , ma ta nyɩ sɩ ɩ kɛ ́ kɔtʋlʋ sɔsɔ se . Pə taɣa pʋlʋ tɔɔ , pa ŋmaa Ɩsɔ Tɔm takəlaɣa taa sɩ : Pə fɛɩ sɩ n ká yɔɣɔtɩ nti tə fɛɩ teu tɔɣɔ nyá tɛtʋ sɔsɔ .

text: But when Paul perceived that the one part were Sadducees , and the other Pharisees , he cried out in the council , Men and brethren , I am a Pharisee , the son of a Pharisee : of the hope and resurrection of the dead I am called in question .
text2: Pɔɔlɩ nawa sɩ kotuɣu ŋkʋ kʋ taa Satusee nyə ́ ma wɛɛ na pə kaasa Falisanaa wɛɛ tɔtɔ . Ɩlɛna ɩ ́ yɔɣɔtəna nɔɣɔ sɔsaɣa kɛ pa təna pa ɩsɛntaa sɩ : Ma tɛɛtʋnaa mɛ , ma kɛ ́ Falisa kɛ ́ . Falisa siɣisiɣi lʋləna - m . Saŋa taa pa hʋʋkəna - m sɩ pepe tɔɔ kɛ ́ ma wɛna tɛɛlʋɣʋ sɩ yəlaa ɩ ́ səpa pa feŋ .

text: And when he had so said , there arose a dissension between the Pharisees and the Sadducees : and the multitude was divided .
text2: Pɔɔlɩ tɛma ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ yɔɣɔtʋɣʋ , ɩlɛna Falisanaa na Satusee nyə ́ ma pa sʋʋ yoou kɛ pa taa pa tike , ɩlɛna kotuɣu faɣa tɔm naalɛ .

text: For the Sadducees say that there is no resurrection , neither angel , nor spirit : but the Pharisees confess both .
text2: Mpi pə tɔɔ tɔ , Satusee nyə ́ ma ná tɔŋ sɩ yʋlʋ ɩ ́ səpa pə tɛmaɣa , ɩ kaa tɛ na ɩ ́ fe . Pəyele sɩ ɩsɔtaa tillu fɛɩ . Mpi tə naana tá ɩsəpee anɛ tɔ pə paasi pʋlʋ fɛɩ . Falisanaa ná tɔŋ sɩ pə tənaɣa mpʋ pə wɛɛ .

text: And there arose a great cry : and the scribes that were of the Pharisees ' part arose , and strove , saying , We find no evil in this man : but if a spirit or an angel hath spoken to him , let us not fight against God .
text2: Pə tɔŋna təmaɣa holinaʋ kɛ sɔsɔm sɔsɔm , ɩlɛna Falisanaa kpekəle taa nyə ́ ma napəlɩ mpa pa kɛ ́ Ɩsɔ Tɔm sɛɣɛsəlaa sɔsaa tɔ pá kʋlɩ na pá səŋ nɔɔhɛɛ naalɛ sɩ : Tá tá ná apalʋ ɩnɛ ɩ kiŋ kɛ taalɩ nɔɣɔlʋ . Ntanyɩ ɩsɔtaa tillu yaa pʋlʋpʋ yɔɣɔtənana - ɩ .

text: And when there arose a great dissension , the chief captain , fearing lest Paul should have been pulled in pieces of them , commanded the soldiers to go down , and to take him by force from among them , and to bring him into the castle .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ yoou kɔma na kʋ haŋ sɔsɔm , haləna sɔɣɔntʋ la yoolaa kʋmataŋ sɩ pə taa kɔɔ na pá cəlɩ Pɔɔlɩ təpʋtʋpʋtʋ . Tənaɣa ɩ kʋsa ɩ yoolaa sɩ pá polo samaa taa na pá kpaɣa Pɔɔlɩ na pá ləsɩ - ɩ pa hɛkʋ təna , na pá məŋna - ɩ yoolaa yoou kutuluɣu ŋkʋ kʋ taa .

text: And the night following the Lord stood by him , and said , Be of good cheer , Paul : for as thou hast testified of me in Jerusalem , so must thou bear witness also at Rome .
text2: Ahoo yuwa ɩlɛna Tacaa lɩɩ Pɔɔlɩ tɔɔ na ɩ ́ tɔmɩ - ɩ sɩ : Tɔkɩ tɔnʋɣʋ . Ɩsɩɩ ɩsəna mpi n heela ma tɔm kɛ Yosalɛm tɔ mpʋ ɩnəɣɩ n ká heeli - təɣɩ Lom .

text: And when it was day , certain of the Jews banded together , and bound themselves under a curse , saying that they would neither eat nor drink till they had killed Paul .
text2: Tɛʋ fema , ɩlɛna Yuta nyə ́ ma caɣa Pɔɔlɩ acaɣa kɛ teu na tuunaʋ , sɩ ye mpɛ pa ta kʋ - ɩ kpem , pʋlʋ kaa sʋʋ pa nɔɔsɩ taa .

text: And they were more than forty which had made this conspiracy .
text2: Mpa pa caɣa ɩ acaɣa kɛ mpʋ tɔ pa kəla yəlaa pee nɩɩlɛ .

text: And they came to the chief priests and elders , and said , We have bound ourselves under a great curse , that we will eat nothing until we have slain Paul .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ pa kʋlaa na pá polo pá maɣana kɔtəlaa sɔsaa na nyʋɣʋ nyə ́ ma nyʋɣʋ nyə ́ ma na pá heeli - wɛ sɩ : Tə sɩɩ tá nɔɔsɩ na ɩsəlɛ kʋsɛɛmlɛ na tuunaʋ , sɩ tə kaa təŋ pʋlʋ haləna tə ́ tɛ Pɔɔlɩ kɛ kʋɣʋ na pə ́ cɔ ́ .

text: Now therefore ye with the council signify to the chief captain that he bring him down unto you to morrow , as though ye would inquire something more perfectly concerning him : and we , or ever he come near , are ready to kill him .
text2: Mpʋ tɔ , mə na Kotuɣu sɔsɔɔŋkʋ nyə ́ ma ɩ ́ tɔ kʋmataŋ sɩ ɩ ́ cɛlɛ - mɛɣɛ Pɔɔlɩ , sɩ ɩ ́ caa ɩ ́ wiili ɩ tɔm taa kɛ ́ teu na ɩ ́ cɛkəna . Ye ta ɩlɛ tá sɔɔlʋ ná pɩɩwa sɩ ye ɩ ́ lɩɩ mpaa tə kʋ - ɩ , na ɩ ́ ta tata mə kiŋ cənɛ .

text: And when Paul ' s sister ' s son heard of their lying in wait , he went and entered into the castle , and told Paul .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ tɔm tənɛ tə sʋʋ Pɔɔlɩ kɔɣɔpəyaɣa ŋkpaŋʋɣʋ taa . Tənaɣa ka pola yoolaa kutuluɣu ŋkʋ kʋ taa , na ká heeli - təɣɩ Pɔɔlɩ .

text: Then Paul called one of the centurions unto him , and said , Bring this young man unto the chief captain : for he hath a certain thing to tell him .
text2: Ɩlɛna Pɔɔlɩ yaa yoolaa sɔsaa taa nɔɣɔlʋ na ɩ ́ tɔmɩ - ɩ sɩ : Pona pu ɩfepu ɩnɛɣɛ yoolaa kʋmataŋ kiŋ , ɩ caa ɩ heeli - ɩ natəlɩ .

text: So he took him , and brought him to the chief captain , and said , Paul the prisoner called me unto him , and prayed me to bring this young man unto thee , who hath something to say unto thee .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ yoolu ná kpaɣa pu ɩfepu ɩnɩ na ɩ ́ pona pa kʋmataŋ kiŋ sɩ : Saləka tʋ Pɔɔlɩ yaana - m na ɩ ́ tɔ sɩ má kɔna pu ɩfepu ɩnɛɣɛ nyá kiŋ , sɩ ɩ wɛna natəlɩ sɩ ɩ heeliɣi - ŋ .

text: Then the chief captain took him by the hand , and went with him aside privately , and asked him , What is that thou hast to tell me ?
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ kʋmataŋ hɔma pu ɩfepu ɩnɩ ɩ niŋ taa na ɩ ́ lɩɩna kpeeŋa na ɩ ́ pɔɔsɩ - ɩ sɩ : Ntiɣi n caa - m heeluɣu ?

text: And he said , The Jews have agreed to desire thee that thou wouldest bring down Paul to morrow into the council , as though they would inquire somewhat of him more perfectly .
text2: Ɩlɛna ɩfepu ɩnɩ ɩ ́ heeli - ɩ sɩ : Yuta nyə ́ ma caɣaa na pá sɛɣɛsɩ sɩ mpɛ pa kɔŋ na pá sələmɩ - ŋ sɩ cele ń pona Pɔɔlɩ kɛ kotuɣu sɔsɔɔʋ taa , sɩ kotuɣu caa kʋ wiili ɩ tɔm taa kɛ ́ teu na kʋ cɛkəna .

text: But do not thou yield unto them : for there lie in wait for him of them more than forty men , which have bound themselves with an oath , that they will neither eat nor drink till they have killed him : and now are they ready , looking for a promise from thee .
text2: Taa nɩɩ , pə taɣa pʋlʋ tɔɔ , pa taa yəlaa ɩsɩɩ nɩɩlɛ na waalɩ kɛ mpʋ caa pa papɩ na pá taŋɩ - ɩ . Pa tɛma pa nɔɔsɩ kɛ sɩɩʋ na tuunaʋ , sɩ mpɛ pa nɔɔsɩ taa kaa sʋʋ pʋlʋ haləna pá tɛ Pɔɔlɩ kɛ kʋɣʋ . Nyá nɔɣɔ kɛ pa taŋa nɔɔnɔɔ ɩsəntɔ , tɔfɔ pa sɔɔlʋ pɩɩwaɣa .

text: So the chief captain then let the young man depart , and charged him , See thou tell no man that thou hast shewed these things to me .
text2: Tənaɣa kʋmataŋ heela - ɩ sɩ : Tɛɛ , ama taa yele na nɔɣɔlʋ tasa nti n heela - m mpʋ tɔɣɔ nɩɩʋ .

text: And he called unto him two centurions , saying , Make ready two hundred soldiers to go to Caesarea , and horsemen threescore and ten , and spearmen two hundred , at the third hour of the night ;
text2: Pəlɛ pə waalɩ , kʋmataŋ yaa ɩ yoolaa taa sɔsaa kɛ naalɛ na ɩ ́ tɔ - wɛ sɩ : Ɩ ́ caa yoolaa kɛ ŋmʋnʋɣʋ ( 200 ) , na kpaɣanəŋ caɣalaa kɛ nɩɩtoso na naanʋwa , na yəlaa ŋmʋnʋɣʋ ( 200 ) tɔtɔ na pɛlɛ na pa ŋmantaasɩ , na ɩ ́ la sɔɔlʋ . Pa tɛŋ ahoo tɔɣɔʋ tɔ , ɩ ́ kpaɣa mpaaʋ na ɩ ́ tɛɛ Sesalee .

text: And provide them beasts , that they may set Paul on , and bring him safe unto Felix the governor .
text2: Ɩ ́ kpɛɛlɩ kpaɣanəŋ wei ɩ ká kpaɣa Pɔɔlɩ na ɩ ́ tana - ɩ kʋfənɛɛ Felikisi kiŋ na alaafəya tɔ .

text: And he wrote a letter after this manner :
text2: Ɩlɛna kʋmataŋ ŋmaa takəlaɣa sɩ :

text: Claudius Lysias unto the most excellent governor Felix sendeth greeting .
text2: Tacaa kʋpaŋ kʋfənɛɛ Felikisi , maɣa Koloti Lisiyasɩ , má sɛɛna - ŋ .

text: This man was taken of the Jews , and should have been killed of them : then came I with an army , and rescued him , having understood that he was a Roman .
text2: Yuta nyə ́ ma kpana apalʋ ɩnɛ sɩ pa kʋɣɩ . Ma nɩɩwa sɩ ɩ kɛ ́ Lom tʋ , ɩlɛna ma na ma yoolaa tə ́ polo na tə ́ lɛɛkɩ - ɩ pa niŋ taa .

text: And when I would have known the cause wherefore they accused him , I brought him forth into their council :
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ ma pona - ɩ pa kotuɣu sɔsɔɔʋ taa sɩ ma naa taalɩ wei ɩ lapa Yuta nyə ́ ma tɔ .

text: Whom I perceived to be accused of questions of their law , but to have nothing laid to his charge worthy of death or of bonds .
text2: Tənaɣa ma maɣanaa sɩ pa kiiŋ kʋlapʋtʋnaa taa kɛ ́ ɩ lapa - wɛ na taalɩ , tɔfɔ ɩ ta la natəlɩ nti tə tala pá kʋ - ɩ yaa pá tʋ - ɩ saləka tɔ .

text: And when it was told me how that the Jews laid wait for the man , I sent straightway to thee , and gave commandment to his accusers also to say before thee what they had against him . Farewell .
text2: Pəlɛ pə waalɩ ma nɩɩwa sɩ Yuta nyə ́ ma caɣa ɩ acaɣa sɩ pa kʋɣɩ - ɩ . Pə tɔɔ kɛ ́ ma tɔma sɩ pá kɔna - ŋɩ - ɩ kpakpaa . Ma heela mpa pa tɔŋ sɩ ɩ lapa - wɛ na taalɩ tɔ sɩ pá kɔɔ pá maɣana - ŋ na pa tɔm ntɩ .

text: Then the soldiers , as it was commanded them , took Paul , and brought him by night to Antipatris .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ yoolaa lapa nti pa kɛɛsa - wɛ tɔ . Pa kpaɣa Pɔɔlɩ kɛ ahoo anɩ na pá tɛɛna - ɩ halɩ Antipatilii .

text: On the morrow they left the horsemen to go with him , and returned to the castle :
text2: Pə kɔma pə fe , ɩlɛna yoolaa mpa pɛlɛ pa tɔŋaɣa nɔɔhɛɛ tɔ pɛlɛ pa məlɩ pa təcaɣalɛ , na pə ́ kaasɩ na kpaɣanəŋ nyə ́ ma kpaɣa Pɔɔlɩ na pɛlɛ pá tɛɛ .

text: Who , when they came to Caesarea , and delivered the epistle to the governor , presented Paul also before him .
text2: Pa kɔma pa tala Sesalee , ɩlɛna kpaɣanəŋ caɣalaa cɛla takəlaɣa ŋkɛɣɛ kʋfənɛɛ , na pá tʋsɩ Pɔɔlɩ kɛ ɩ niŋ taa .

text: And when the governor had read the letter , he asked of what province he was . And when he understood that he was of Cilicia ;
text2: Kʋfənɛɛ wiila takəlaɣa ŋkɛ ka taa , ɩlɛna ɩ ́ pɔɔsɩ Pɔɔlɩ sɩ : N kɛ ́ Lom tɛtʋ hɔɣɔlʋɣʋ ŋku kʋ tʋ ? Ɩ nɩɩwa sɩ ɩ kɛ ́ Silisii tʋ ,

text: I will hear thee , said he , when thine accusers are also come . And he commanded him to be kept in Herod ' s judgment hall .
text2: ɩlɛna ɩ ́ tɔmɩ - ɩ sɩ : Mpa sɩ n lapa taalɩ tɔ , ye pa talaa ɩlɛ , maa paasəna nyá tɔm . Ɩlɛna kʋfənɛɛ tɔ sɩ : Ɩ ́ pona Pɔɔlɩ kɛ wulaʋ Helɔtɩ təyaɣa taa na ɩ ́ təkɩ - ɩ .

text: And after five days Ananias the high priest descended with the elders , and with a certain orator named Tertullus , who informed the governor against Paul .
text2: Pə lapa wɛɛ kakpasɩ ɩlɛ kɔtʋlʋ sɔsɔ Ananiyasɩ kɔma Sesalee kɛlɛ , na ɩ waalɩ kɛ ́ sɔsaa kɛ pəcɔ , na akewe nɔɣɔlʋ wei ɩ kɛ ́ tɔm hʋʋlʋ tɔ , pa yaakɩ - ɩ sɩ Tɛlətilusi . Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ pa pola kʋfənɛɛ Felikisi kiŋ na pá heeli - ɩ sɩ : Pɔɔlɩ tɔm kɛ tə kɔnaa .

text: And when he was called forth , Tertullus began to accuse him , saying , Seeing that by thee we enjoy great quietness , and that very worthy deeds are done unto this nation by thy providence ,
text2: Tənaɣa pa yaa Pɔɔlɩ , ɩlɛna Tɛlətilusi kʋlɩ na ɩ ́ niki Pɔɔlɩ taalɩ kɛ ́ hʋ ́ lʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ sɩ : Tacaa kʋpaŋ , nyá yelina tə caɣa pɛlɛkɛtɛɛ . N cɛkəna tɛtʋ tɔkʋɣʋ kɛ teu tɔɣɔ pə təna pə laɣasaa na pə ́ te tɛtʋ tənɛ tə taa .

text: We accept it always , and in all places , most noble Felix , with all thankfulness .
text2: Pə təna mpi tə tɔŋna hikuɣu kɛ paa timpi tɔ , pə tɔɔ tə sama - ŋ na tə ́ lɛlɩ .

text: Notwithstanding , that I be not further tedious unto thee , I pray thee that thou wouldest hear us of thy clemency a few words .
text2: Tɔʋ , má taa laɣasɩ - ŋ sɔsɔm , ma wiikina - ŋ sɩ ń la suulu na ń nɩɩ nti tə caa - ŋ heeluɣu kɛ pəcɔ tɔ .

text: For we have found this man a pestilent fellow , and a mover of sedition among all the Jews throughout the world , and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes :
text2: Tə maɣanaa sɩ yʋlʋ ɩnɛ ɩsaɣaʋ kpitikpiti kɛ ́ . Ɩ cɔɔkɩ na ɩ ́ yoosiɣi Yuta nyə ́ ma tənaɣa paa timpi . Ɩnɩ ɩ kɛna Nasalɛtɩ nyə ́ ma kpekəle sɔsɔ .

text: Who also hath gone about to profane the temple : whom we took , and would have judged according to our law .
text2: Halɩ ɩ maɣasaa sɩ paa Ɩsɔ təsɛɛlɛ ɩ ́ wakəlɩ , ɩlɛna tə ́ kpa - ɩ . Tə caakaɣa tə kɛɛsəna tá kʋlapʋtʋ na tə ́ hʋʋna - ɩ .

text: But the chief captain Lysias came upon us , and with great violence took him away out of our hands ,
text2: Ama kʋmataŋ Lisiyasɩ tʋ niŋ kɛ pə taa , na ɩ ́ lɛɛkɩ - ɩ na toŋ sɔsɔɔŋ .

text: Commanding his accusers to come unto thee : by examining of whom thyself mayest take knowledge of all these things , whereof we accuse him .
text2: Ɩlɛna Lisiyasɩ ɩnɩ ɩ ́ heeli mpa sɩ ɩ lapa - wɛ na taalɩ tɔ sɩ pá kɔɔ nyá kiŋ . Ye n pɔɔsa ɩ maɣamaɣa n ká cɛkəna mpi pə tɔɔ tə tɔŋ sɩ ɩ lapa - tʋɣʋ taalɩ tɔ .

text: And the Jews also assented , saying that these things were so .
text2: Tənaɣa Yuta nyə ́ ma tisaa sɩ pə təna mpi ɩ yɔɣɔtaa tɔ ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ pə wɛɛ .

text: Then Paul , after that the governor had beckoned unto him to speak , answered , Forasmuch as I know that thou hast been of many years a judge unto this nation , I do the more cheerfully answer for myself :
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ kʋfənɛɛ hʋla Pɔɔlɩ sɩ ɩ ́ yɔɣɔtɩ . Tənaɣa Pɔɔlɩ tɔma sɩ : Ma nyəmá teu sɩ tuu pɩɩsɩ paɣalɛ taa nyaɣalɛ tɛtʋ tənɛ tə taa tɔm taɣanlʋ . Pə tɔɔ kɛ ́ ma caa ma pɛtɩ - ŋ ma tɔm tənɛ na naani təkpataa .

text: Because that thou mayest understand , that there are yet but twelve days since I went up to Jerusalem for to worship .
text2: Saŋa taa ma talʋɣʋ Yosalɛm sɩ ma sɛɛ Ɩsɔ tɔ pə kʋyɛɛŋ ta kəlɩ naanʋwa na naalɛ . Nyá maɣamaɣa ń pɔɔsaa n ká ná mpʋ .

text: And they neither found me in the temple disputing with any man , neither raising up the people , neither in the synagogues , nor in the city :
text2: Pa ta maɣana - m Ɩsɔ təsɛɛlɛ taa na má na nɔɣɔlʋ tə ́ hɔŋ tɔm natəlɩ . Pəyele pa ta na - m Yuta nyə ́ ma təkotile natəlɩ tə taa , yaa ɩcatɛ taa kɛ ́ tiili na má yoosiɣi yəlaa .

text: Neither can they prove the things whereof they now accuse me .
text2: Tɔm nti pa suu - m ɩsəntɔ sɩ ma lapa tɔ , pa kaa pəsɩ na pá hʋ ́ lɩ ́ pə tampana təsiɣisiɣi .

text: But this I confess unto thee , that after the way which they call heresy , so worship I the God of my fathers , believing all things which are written in the law and in the prophets :
text2: Tampana yaa , paa nyá ɩsɛntaa cənɛ maa ŋmɛsəɣɩ - tɩ . Mpaaʋ ŋku mpɛ pa yaa sɩ kʋtooluɣu tɔ kʋ taa kɛ ́ ma wɛɛ na má lakɩ tá caanaa caanaa Ɩsɔ təmlɛ . Pəyele mpi pa ŋmaa kʋsəsɩɩtʋ takəlasɩ taa na Ɩsɔ kʋyɔɣɔtʋtʋ tɛləsəlaa nyəŋsɩ taa tɔ ma tisaa sɩ pə wɛ tampana .

text: And have hope toward God , which they themselves also allow , that there shall be a resurrection of the dead , both of the just and unjust .
text2: Ma wɛna naani sɩ Ɩsɔ ká taɣanɩ sətaa kɛ feesuɣu , paa kʋpama paa asaɣaa , na mpɛ pa maɣamaɣa pa wɛna naani ɩnəɣɩ Ɩsɔ tɔɔ kɛ ́ mpʋ .

text: And herein do I exercise myself , to have always a conscience void of offence toward God , and toward men .
text2: Pə tɔɔ kɛ ́ ma maɣamaɣa ma lʋkɩ tam sɩ má taa wɛɛna taalɩ nɔɣɔlʋɣʋ Ɩsɔ kiŋ na yəlaa kiŋ .

text: Now after many years I came to bring alms to my nation , and offerings .
text2: Pə lapa pɩɩsɩ paɣalɛ ma fɛɩ , nɔɔnɔɔ kɛ ́ ma taɣana məlʋɣʋ kɛ Yosalɛm sɩ ma cɛləɣɩ ma yəlaa kɛ liɣitee nna pa ha - wɛ tɔ , ɩlɛna má lá Ɩsɔ kɛ ́ kɔtasɩ .

text: Whereupon certain Jews from Asia found me purified in the temple , neither with multitude , nor with tumult .
text2: Mpʋ ɩnɩ pə təlatɛ kɛ pa maɣana - m Ɩsɔ təsɛɛlɛ taa . Tənaɣa ma lapa nyʋɣʋ tɔɔ asilima kɛɛlʋɣʋ kɔtaɣa , na pə taɣa samaa nɔɣɔlʋ ɩ kotina - m . Pəyele nɔɣɔlʋ na nɔɣɔlʋ paa yoo .

text: Who ought to have been here before thee , and object , if they had ought against me .
text2: Ama Asii Yuta nyə ́ ma napəlɩ paa wɛnna təna , pɩɩ nəɣəsəna ɩsɩɩ mpɛ pá kɔnna na pá səŋ nyá ɩsɛntaa cənɛ , na ye ma lapa - wɛɣɛ taalɩ nɔɣɔlʋ , pa lana - m tɔm .

text: Or else let these same here say , if they have found any evil doing in me , while I stood before the council ,
text2: Pəlɛ pə paasi , waatʋ wei ma səŋa Kotuɣu sɔsɔɔŋkʋ taa tɔ , mpa pa wɛ cənɛ tɔ , ye pa nawa ma ɩsaɣatʋ natəlɩ pá yɔɣɔtɩ .

text: Except it be for this one voice , that I cried standing among them , Touching the resurrection of the dead I am called in question by you this day .
text2: Nti pa tɔkəna - m tɔɣɔlɛ timpi ma səŋa pa ɩsɛntaa na má yɔɣɔtəna nɔɣɔ sɔsaɣa sɩ : Saŋa taa pa hʋʋkəna - m tɔm kɛ mə ɩsɛntaa , sɩ pepe tɔɔ kɛ ́ ma wɛna naani sɩ ye yəlaa ɩ ́ səpa pa feŋ .

text: And when Felix heard these things , having more perfect knowledge of that way , he deferred them , and said , When Lysias the chief captain shall come down , I will know the uttermost of your matter .
text2: Felikisi ka nyəmá teu kɛ ɩsəna mpaaʋ kʋnɛ kʋ tɔm wɛɛ tɔ , ɩlɛna ɩ ́ sɛkɩ pa tɔm ntɩ na ɩ ́ heeli - wɛ sɩ : Yoolaa kʋmataŋ Lisiyasɩ ɩ ́ kɔma ɩlɛ maa nyɩ ɩsəna maa lana mə tɔm ntɩ tɔ .

text: And he commanded a centurion to keep Paul , and to let him have liberty , and that he should forbid none of his acquaintance to minister or come unto him .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ ɩ heela yoolu sɔsɔ wei ɩ nyənəɣɩ Pɔɔlɩ tɔ sɩ ɩ ́ pona - ɩ saləka taa . Ama ɩ ́ taa lana - ɩ toŋ toŋ . Ye ɩ taapalaa caa pa kɔɔ ɩ cɔlɔ na pá lapɩ - ɩ pʋlʋ , ɩ ́ ha - wɛɣɛ mpaa .

text: And after certain days , when Felix came with his wife Drusilla , which was a Jewess , he sent for Paul , and heard him concerning the faith in Christ .
text2: Pə lapa wɛɛ naalɛ , ɩlɛna Felikisi na ɩ alʋ Yuta tʋ Tulisili pá caɣa na pá tili sɩ Pɔɔlɩ ɩ ́ kɔɔ na ɩ ́ heeli - wɛɣɛ Yesu Kilisiti mpaaʋ tɔm .

text: And as he reasoned of righteousness , temperance , and judgment to come Felix trembled , and answered , Go thy way for this time ; when I have a convenient season , I will call for thee .
text2: Pɔɔlɩ yɔɣɔtaɣa taa ɩ kɛɛsa ɩsəna yʋlʋ ka təŋ tampana mammam kɛ ́ ɩ kʋlapʋtʋ taa tɔ pə tɔm , na ɩsəna ɩ ká tɔkɩ ɩ tɩ , na ɩsəna Ɩsɔ ká hʋʋna yəlaa kɛ tɔm kɛ cele tɔ . Ɩlɛna sɔɣɔntʋ kpa Felikisi na ɩ ́ tɔmɩ - ɩ sɩ : Lɩɩ mpʋ . Ye ma kɔma na má hika caɣalɛ ɩlɛ maa tasa - ŋ yaaʋ .

text: He hoped also that money should have been given him of Paul , that he might loose him : wherefore he sent for him the oftener , and communed with him .
text2: Na ɩ tɛɛlaɣaa sɩ ntanyɩ Pɔɔlɩ ká ha - ɩ liɣitee yaa . Pə tɔɔ kɛ ́ ye pə kɛɛsaa ɩlɛ ɩ yaa - ɩ sɩ ɩ ́ na - ɩ pá caɣa .

text: But after two years Porcius Festus came into Felix ' room : and Felix , willing to shew the Jews a pleasure , left Paul bound .
text2: Pɩɩsɩ naalɛ sikaa , ɩlɛna pá kʋsɩ Felikisi na pá kɔna Pɔɔsiyusi Fɛsətusi . Felikisi caakaɣa sɩ Yuta nyə ́ ma laŋa ɩ ́ hɛɛna - ɩ , ɩlɛna ɩ ́ yele Pɔɔlɩ kɛ saləka taa təna .

text: Now when Festus was come into the province , after three days he ascended from Caesarea to Jerusalem .
text2: Fɛsətusi tala tɛtʋ ntɩ tə taa na pə la wɛɛ tooso , ɩlɛna ɩ ́ kʋlɩ Sesalee na ɩ ́ polo Yosalɛm .

text: Then the high priest and the chief of the Jews informed him against Paul , and besought him ,
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ kɔtəlaa sɔsaa na Yuta nyə ́ ma taa nyʋɣʋ nyə ́ ma pa kʋlaa na pá pona Pɔɔlɩ tɔm kɛ ɩ kiŋ . Ɩlɛna pá wiina Fɛsətusi sɩ

text: And desired favour against him , that he would send for him to Jerusalem , laying wait in the way to kill him .
text2: ɩ ́ la suulu na ɩ ́ yele na pá pona Pɔɔlɩ kɛ Yosalɛm . Pə taɣa pʋlʋ tɔɔ , paa caɣa ɩ acaɣa kɛ ́ sɩ ɩ ́ lɩɩ mpaa ɩlɛ pa kʋ - ɩ .

text: But Festus answered , that Paul should be kept at Caesarea , and that he himself would depart shortly thither .
text2: Ama Fɛsətusi ná tɔma - wɛ sɩ : Pɔɔlɩ wɛ saləka taa kɛ ́ Sesalee , ma mələɣɩ tənaɣa nɔɔnɔɔ .

text: Let them therefore , said he , which among you are able , go down with me , and accuse this man , if there be any wickedness in him .
text2: Mpʋ tɔ , mə taa sɔsaa ɩ ́ təŋ ma waalɩ kɛ ́ Sesalee na pá lana - ɩ tɔm , ye ɩsɩɩ tampana ɩ wakəla pʋlʋ .

text: And when he had tarried among them more than ten days , he went down unto Caesarea ; and the next day sitting on the judgment seat commanded Paul to be brought .
text2: Fɛsətusi caɣa pa kiŋ kɛ wɛɛ pəlefɛi yaa naanʋwa kɛ mpʋ , ɩlɛna ɩ ́ məlɩ Sesalee . Tɛʋ fema ɩlɛna ɩ ́ kpa puloo , na ɩ ́ tili sɩ pá kɔna Pɔɔlɩ .

text: And when he was come , the Jews which came down from Jerusalem stood round about , and laid many and grievous complaints against Paul , which they could not prove .
text2: Pɔɔlɩ talaa , ɩlɛna Yuta nyə ́ ma mpa pa lɩɩna Yosalɛm tɔ pá kotina - ɩ . Ɩlɛna pá sʋʋ - ɩ tɔm yuŋ nyəntʋ kɛ sʋkʋɣʋ . Pəyele paa pəsəɣɩ na pá hʋ ́ lɩ ́ tə tampana təsiɣisiɣi .

text: While he answered for himself , Neither against the law of the Jews , neither against the temple , nor yet against Caesar , have I offended any thing at all .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Pɔɔlɩ kpɛɛsaa sɩ : Ma ta coti Yuta nyə ́ ma kiiu taa kɛ ́ natəlɩ . Pəyele ma ta wakəlɩ Ɩsɔ təsɛɛlɛ , ma ta pəntəna Lom wulaʋ sɔsɔ kɛ tiili .

text: But Festus , willing to do the Jews a pleasure , answered Paul , and said , Wilt thou go up to Jerusalem , and there be judged of these things before me ?
text2: Fɛsətusi caakaɣa sɩ Yuta nyə ́ ma laŋa ɩ ́ hɛɛna - ɩ , ɩlɛna ɩ ́ pɔɔsɩ Pɔɔlɩ sɩ : N caa sɩ pá pona - ŋ Yosalɛm na pá hʋʋna - ŋ tɔm tənɛɣɛ ma ɩsɛntaa ?

text: Then said Paul , I stand at Caesar ' s judgment seat , where I ought to be judged : to the Jews have I done no wrong , as thou very well knowest .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Pɔɔlɩ cɔwa sɩ : Lom wulaʋ sɔsɔ puloo taa kɛ ́ ma səŋa cənɛ , na ɩ puloo taa kɛ ́ pə wɛɛ sɩ pá hʋʋna - m tɔm . Ma ta la Yuta nyə ́ ma kɛ pʋlʋ , nyá maɣamaɣa n nyəmá mpʋ təkelekele .

text: For if I be an offender , or have committed any thing worthy of death , I refuse not to die : but if there be none of these things whereof these accuse me , no man may deliver me unto them . I appeal unto Caesar .
text2: Ye ma lapa ɩsaɣatʋ natəlɩ , yaa ma lapa pʋlʋ na pə ́ tala pá kʋ - m , ma ta kisi səm se . Ama ye tɔm nti pa tʋ - m na tə ́ fɛɩna tapʋɣʋ tə fɛɩ nɔɣɔ tɔ tə tɔɔ ɩlɛ , nɔɣɔlʋ fɛɩ wei ɩ ká kpaɣa - m na ɩ ́ cɛlɛ - wɛɣɛ yem tɔ . Lom wulaʋ sɔsɔ kiŋ kɛ pɩɩ tɛna .

text: Then Festus , when he had conferred with the council , answered , Hast thou appealed unto Caesar ? unto Caesar shalt thou go .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Fɛsətusi na ɩ laɣatʋ tasəlaa pa lapa təmaɣa saawala , ɩlɛna ɩ ́ tɔ Pɔɔlɩ sɩ : Timpi n tɔma sɩ Lom wulaʋ sɔsɔ kiŋ kɛ pɩɩ tɛna tɔ , tɔʋ , tənaɣa n ká tɛɛ .

text: And after certain days king Agrippa and Bernice came unto Caesarea to salute Festus .
text2: Pə lapa wɛɛ naalɛ , ɩlɛ wulaʋ Akilipa na Pelenisi pa kɔma Sesalee kɛlɛ sɩ pa sɛɛkɩ Fɛsətusi .

text: And when they had been there many days , Festus declared Paul ' s cause unto the king , saying , There is a certain man left in bonds by Felix :
text2: Pa caɣalɛ tɔɔwa təna , ɩlɛna kʋyakʋ nakʋlɩ Fɛsətusi kpaɣa Pɔɔlɩ tɔm na ɩ ́ kɛɛsɩ wulaʋ Akilipa sɩ : Felikisi ka təka apalʋ nɔɣɔlʋɣʋ saləka taa kɛ ́ cənɛ , na ɩ ́ wɛ haləna saŋa .

text: About whom , when I was at Jerusalem , the chief priests and the elders of the Jews informed me , desiring to have judgment against him .
text2: Ma pola Yosalɛm , ɩlɛna kɔtəlaa sɔsaa na Yuta nyʋɣʋ nyə ́ ma kɔɔ ma kiŋ sɩ mpɛ pa wɛna tɔm sɩ paa lana Pɔɔlɩ , na pá tɔŋna - m sɩ má yele na pá kʋ - ɩ .

text: To whom I answered , It is not the manner of the Romans to deliver any man to die , before that he which is accused have the accusers face to face , and have licence to answer for himself concerning the crime laid against him .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ ma cɔ - wɛ sɩ : Pə fɛɩ sɩ Lom nyə ́ ma ɩ ́ yele na pá kʋ yʋlʋ kɛ yem na ɩ ́ na mpa pa lapa tɔm tɔ pá tá səŋ na pá kaalɩ pa tɔm na pá nɩɩ .

text: Therefore , when they were come hither , without any delay on the morrow I sat on the judgment seat , and commanded the man to be brought forth .
text2: Tənaɣa pa təŋa - m na pá kɔɔ cənɛ , ma ta la kaninika . Kʋ fema kpakpaa tɔ , ma kpa puloo na má tili sɩ pá kɔna apalʋ ɩnɩ .

text: Against whom when the accusers stood up , they brought none accusation of such things as I supposed :
text2: Ama ɩ kolontunaa kɔma tɔ , pa ta hʋ ́ lɩ ́ ɩsaɣatʋ natəlɩ na pə ́ tala ɩsɩɩ ma tɛɛlaɣaa tɔ .

text: But had certain questions against him of their own superstition , and of one Jesus , which was dead , whom Paul affirmed to be alive .
text2: Pa Ɩsɔ sɛɛʋ tɔm tɔɔ kɛ ́ pá na - ɩ pa hɔŋ . Na pə ́ kaasɩ nɔɣɔlʋ ɩ tɔm , pa yaa ɩ ́ lɛ ́ sɩ Yesu . Sɩ ɩ ́ lɛ ́ ɩ ka səpa na Pɔɔlɩ náá sɛɛsa ɩsəlɛ sɩ ɩ wɛna ɩ weesuɣu .

text: And because I doubted of such manner of questions , I asked him whether he would go to Jerusalem , and there be judged of these matters .
text2: Ma ta cɛkəna ɩsəna maa paasəna tɔm ɩsɩɩ mpʋ pə taka tɔ . Pə tɔɔ kɛ ́ maa pɔɔsa Pɔɔlɩ sɩ yaa ɩ ká tisi na pá pona - ɩ Yosalɛm na pá paasəna ɩ tɔm tənɛɣɛ təna .

text: But when Paul had appealed to be reserved unto the hearing of Augustus , I commanded him to be kept till I might send him to Caesar .
text2: Ama Pɔɔlɩ tɔma sɩ Lom wulaʋ sɔsɔ kiŋ kɛ pɩɩ tɛna . Ɩlɛna ɩ ́ kisi sɩ pá taa tʋlɩ - ɩ , pá pona ɩ tɔm kɛ Lom wulaʋ sɔsɔ na ɩ ́ paasəna - tɩ . Pə tɔɔ kɛ ́ ma tɔma sɩ pá sɩɩ - ɩ saləka taa , haləna kʋyaŋku maa pona - ɩ Lom wulaʋ sɔsɔ kiŋ tɔ .

text: Then Agrippa said unto Festus , I would also hear the man myself . To morrow , said he , thou shalt hear him .
text2: Tənaɣa Akilipa tɔma Fɛsətusi sɩ : Ma sɔɔlaa sɩ ye pə wɛ pəsʋɣʋ ma nɩɩ ɩ tɔm . Ɩlɛna Fɛsətusi cɔ - ɩ sɩ : Cele n ká nɩɩ ɩ tɔm .

text: And on the morrow , when Agrippa was come , and Bernice , with great pomp , and was entered into the place of hearing , with the chief captains , and principal men of the city , at Festus ' commandment Paul was brought forth .
text2: Kʋ fema ɩlɛna Akilipa na Pelenisi pá sɔ lʋm kɛ teu . Ɩlɛna pá na pa yoolaa sɔsaa na ɩcatɛ nyʋɣʋ nyə ́ ma pá pɩɩlɩ na pá sʋʋ təkotile na pə na pə yuŋ kɛ sɔsɔm . Tənaɣa Fɛsətusi tilaa na pá kɔna Pɔɔlɩ .

text: And Festus said , King Agrippa , and all men which are here present with us , ye see this man , about whom all the multitude of the Jews have dealt with me , both at Jerusalem , and also here , crying that he ought not to live any longer .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Fɛsətusi tɔma sɩ : Wulaʋ Akilipa , nyá na mə təna mpa mɛ tá na - mɛ tə wɛ cənɛ ɩnɩ ɩsəntɔ tɔ , ɩ ́ naa apalʋ ɩnɛ tɔ , Yuta samaa təna kpaɣana ɩ tɔm na pá kɔna ma cɔlɔɣɔ Yosalɛm na cənɛ tɔtɔ , na pá makɩ kapusi sɩ paa ləsɩ ɩ weesuɣu kɛ ́ .

text: But when I found that he had committed nothing worthy of death , and that he himself hath appealed to Augustus , I have determined to send him .
text2: Ma wiila ɩ tɔm taa , ɩlɛ ma ta na pʋlʋpʋ mpi ɩ lapa na pə ́ tala pá kʋ - ɩ tɔ . Ɩsɩɩ ɩ maɣamaɣa ɩ tɔma sɩ Lom wulaʋ sɔsɔ kiŋ kɛ pɩɩ tɛna tɔ , ma tisaa tɔtɔ sɩ pá pona - ɩ təna .

text: Of whom I have no certain thing to write unto my lord . Wherefore I have brought him forth before you , and specially before thee , O king Agrippa , that , after examination had , I might have somewhat to write .
text2: Ma fɛɩna tɔm siɣisiɣi wei maa tʋ takəlaɣa na má cɛla Lom wulaʋ sɔsɔ tɔ . Pə tɔɔ kɛ ́ ma ləsa - ɩ saŋa kɛ mə ɩsɛntaa na nyá maɣamaɣa nyá tɔɔ kɛ ́ ma lapa mpʋ . Wulaʋ Akilipa , ye waatʋ wei n tɛma ɩ tɔm maɣasʋɣʋ ɩlɛ , ma hiki nti maa tʋ takəlaɣa taa tɔ .

text: For it seemeth to me unreasonable to send a prisoner , and not withal to signify the crimes laid against him .
text2: Ye ma pona saləka tʋ kɛ ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ yem kɛ ́ səkpɛtʋɣʋ , na má tá kɛɛsɩ mpi pə tɔɔ pa kpa - ɩ tɔ , pə ta maɣa .

text: Then Agrippa said unto Paul , Thou art permitted to speak for thyself . Then Paul stretched forth the hand , and answered for himself :
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Akilipa tɔma Pɔɔlɩ sɩ : Mpaa wɛɛ , kɛɛsɩ nyá tɔm . Tənaɣa Pɔɔlɩ lapa kaafala na ɩ ́ niki ɩ tɔm kɛɛsʋɣʋ sɩ :

text: I think myself happy , king Agrippa , because I shall answer for myself this day before thee touching all the things whereof I am accused of the Jews :
text2: Tacaa wulaʋ , ma laŋlɛ hʋlʋma sɔsɔm ɩsɩɩ pə lapa na má səŋ ɩsəntɔɣɔ nyá ɩsɛntaa sɩ má kɛɛsɩ tɔmnaa mpa Yuta nyə ́ ma suu - m tɔ .

text: Especially because I know thee to be expert in all customs and questions which are among the Jews : wherefore I beseech thee to hear me patiently .
text2: Timpi pə tɩɩ pamsəna nyá tɔ , pə maɣanaa kɛlɛ . Nyá nyəmna teu kɛ Yuta nyə ́ ma kɔtasɩ nsɩ sɩ təna , na pa ntɔŋkpɛɛsaɣa . Mpʋ tɔ , ma wiikina - ŋ sɩ ń ha nyá təɣɩ suulu na ń nɩɩ ma tɔm .

text: My manner of life from my youth , which was at the first among mine own nation at Jerusalem , know all the Jews ;
text2: Yuta nyə ́ ma təna nyəmá mpi mpi ma lapa ma yəlaa hɛkʋ na Yosalɛm taa kɛ ́ hatoo ma kʋlʋɣʋ tɔ .

text: Which knew me from the beginning , if they would testify , that after the most straitest sect of our religion I lived a Pharisee .
text2: Pa nyəmá ma tɔm tɔ pə tɔɔwa . Ta Ɩsɔ sɛɛʋ taa kpekəle nte tə nyəntʋ kəla katɛ , na pá yaa - tɛ sɩ Falisanaa kpekəle tɔ , tə taa kɛ ́ ma wɛɛ . Saŋa taa , ye pa nɔkaa pa pəsəɣɩ pá ləsɩ ma seliya sɩ maa cɛsəɣɩ .

text: And now I stand and am judged for the hope of the promise made of God unto our fathers :
text2: Pənɛntɛ pa hʋʋkəna - m tɔm sɩ pepe tɔɔ kɛ ́ ma tɛma ma taa sɩ nti Ɩsɔ ka heela tá caanaa caanaa tɔ tɩɩ la .

text: Unto which promise our twelve tribes , instantly serving God day and night , hope to come . For which hope ' s sake , king Agrippa , I am accused of the Jews .
text2: Tá kpeka naanʋwa na naalɛ tɛma pa taa sɩ Ɩsɔ ká la mpi ɩ sɩɩwa sɩ ɩ ká la tɔ . Pə tɔɔ kɛ ́ pa lakɩ Ɩsɔ təmlɛ kɛ ilim na ahoo na ɩsəlɛ kʋsɛɛmlɛ . Haɩ , Tacaa wulaʋ , ɩsɩɩ ma tɛma ma taa kɛ ́ mpʋ ɩnɩ tɔɣɔ Yuta nyə ́ ma lakəna - m tɔm kɛ ɩsəntɔ yoo .

text: Why should it be thought a thing incredible with you , that God should raise the dead ?
text2: Yuta nyə ́ ma mɛ , pepe tɔɔ kɛ ́ ɩ ́ hʋʋkɩ sɩ Ɩsɔ kaa pəsɩ na ɩ ́ feesi sətaa .

text: I verily thought with myself , that I ought to do many things contrary to the name of Jesus of Nazareth .
text2: Ma maɣamaɣa maa hʋʋwa sɩ maa yoona Nasalɛtɩ Yesu kɛ ́ na laakalɩ kʋlʋm .

text: Which thing I also did in Jerusalem : and many of the saints did I shut up in prison , having received authority from the chief priests ; and when they were put to death , I gave my voice against them .
text2: Na pə maɣamaɣa kɛ ma lapa Yosalɛm . Kɔtəlaa sɔsaa paasaa na pá ha - m mpaa sɩ má təkəɣɩ mpa pa mʋ Kilisiti tɔm tɔ . Haləna waatʋ wei pa tɔŋaɣa sɩ pá kʋ - wɛ tɔ , pə maɣa - m teu təmammam .

text: And I punished them oft in every synagogue , and compelled them to blaspheme ; and being exceedingly mad against them , I persecuted them even unto strange cities .
text2: Tɔm paɣalɛ kɛ ma tʋ - wɛɣɛ cɛɣɛcɛɣɛ kɛ Yuta nyə ́ ma təkotilenaa taa sɩ pə ́ haŋ - wɛ na pá tɔ sɩ pa kisa Ɩsɔ mpaaʋ . Ma pááná ka tɔɔwa katatəlaɣa kɛ pa tɔɔ kɛ ́ . Haləna má kpɛŋna acalɛɛ kpaɩ nyəna taa , na má polo na má tʋ - wɛɣɛ kʋnyɔŋ kɛ teu .

text: Whereupon as I went to Damascus with authority and commission from the chief priests ,
text2: Pə tɔm taa kɛ ́ kɔtəlaa sɔsaa ha - m mpaa na pá tʋ - m təmlɛ sɩ má polo Tamasɩ .

text: At midday , O king , I saw in the way a light from heaven , above the brightness of the sun , shining round about me and them which journeyed with me .
text2: Tacaa , ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ ilim sikuɣu ma tɔŋna tɔntɛ , ɩlɛ pə lɩɩna ɩsɔtaa kɛlɛ ɩsɩɩ kɔkɔ nyaləməlɛ , na pə ́ tee kɔkɔ na pə ́ kəlɩ ɩsɩɩ ilim , na pə ́ ná na pə ́ cɔɔna má na ma taapalaa mpa tɔ .

text: And when we were all fallen to the earth , I heard a voice speaking unto me , and saying in the Hebrew tongue , Saul , Saul , why persecutest thou me ? it is hard for thee to kick against the pricks .
text2: Tənaɣa tá təna tə hotaa , na má nɩɩ pə yɔɣɔtəɣəna - m Alaamee tɔm taa sɩ : Sɔɔlɩ Sɔɔlɩ , pepe tɔɔ kɛ ́ n tʋɣʋ - m kʋnyɔŋ kɛ mpʋ ? N wɩɩkɩ nyá təɣɩ yem kɛ ́ ɩsɩɩ pa nyaasʋɣʋ naʋ na kpátʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ kʋsɛŋtʋɣʋ , na ɩ ́ tɔɔkɩ nɔɔhɛɛ na ɩ ́ yakɩ - kʋ na pə ́ məlɩ - ɩ kʋɣʋ tɔ .

text: And I said , Who art thou , Lord ? And he said , I am Jesus whom thou persecutest .
text2: Tənaɣa ma pɔɔsaa sɩ : Tacaa , nyaɣa aweɣe ye ? Ɩlɛna Tacaa cɔ - m sɩ : Maɣa Yesu wei n tʋɣɩ kʋnyɔŋ tɔ .

text: But rise , and stand upon thy feet : for I have appeared unto thee for this purpose , to make thee a minister and a witness both of these things which thou hast seen , and of those things in the which I will appear unto thee ;
text2: Tɔʋ , kʋlɩ na ń səŋ ɩsɔ . Ma lɩɩ nyá tɔɔ kɛ ́ sɩ ń pəsɩ ma təmlɛ tʋ . N ká la ma yʋlʋ na ń kɛɛsɩ lɛlaa kɛ ɩsəna n na - m saŋa wʋlɛ tənɛ tɔ , na ń heeli - wɛɣɛ mpi maa tasa - ŋ hʋ ́ lʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ tɔ .

text: Delivering thee from the people , and from the Gentiles , unto whom now I send thee ,
text2: Maa ya - ŋ Yuta nyə ́ ma niŋ taa , maa ya - ŋ tɔtɔɣɔ yəlaa lɛlaa mpa pa kiŋ maa tili - ŋ tɔ pa niŋ taa .

text: To open their eyes , and to turn them from darkness to light , and from the power of Satan unto God , that they may receive forgiveness of sins , and inheritance among them which are sanctified by faith that is in me .
text2: Ma tiliɣi - ŋ kɛ ́ sɩ ń polo ń kuli pa ɩsɛ na ń ləsɩ - wɛɣɛ səkpɛtʋɣʋ taa , na ń pona - wɛɣɛ tənaŋŋ taa . Ləsɩ - wɛɣɛ Satanɩ niŋ taa na ń tʋsɩ - wɛɣɛ Ɩsɔ nyəŋ taa , na pá mʋ ma tɔm na pə ́ hɩɩsɩ pa ɩsaɣatʋ , na pá hiki lonte kɛ Ɩsɔ yəlaa hɛkʋ .

text: Whereupon , O king Agrippa , I was not disobedient unto the heavenly vision :
text2: Tacaa wulaʋ , ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ ma tɔka mpi pə hʋla - m mpʋ na pə ́ lɩɩna ɩsɔtaa tɔ .

text: But shewed first unto them of Damascus , and at Jerusalem , and throughout all the coasts of Judaea , and then to the Gentiles , that they should repent and turn to God , and do works meet for repentance .
text2: Ɩlɛna má niki Tamasɩ na Yosalɛm pə nyə ́ ma kɛ waasʋ lapʋ . Pəlɛ pə waalɩ , ɩlɛna má la waasʋ kɛ Yuta tɛtʋ nyə ́ ma na piitim lɛmpɩ nyə ́ ma . Nti ma heelaɣa - wɛ tɔɣɔlɛ sɩ , pá laɣasɩ tɔntɛ na pá kɛɛsəna Ɩsɔ tɔɔ . Pa kʋlapʋtʋ ɩ ́ hʋ ́ lɩ ́ sɩ tampana pa laɣasaa .

text: For these causes the Jews caught me in the temple , and went about to kill me .
text2: N ta na mpi pə tɔɔ Yuta nyə ́ ma kpa - m Ɩsɔ təsɛɛlɛ taa na pá nyɩ sɩ pa kʋɣʋ - m tɔɣɔlɛ .

text: Having therefore obtained help of God , I continue unto this day , witnessing both to small and great , saying none other things than those which the prophets and Moses did say should come :
text2: Ama Ɩsɔ kenta ma tɔɔ na pə ́ tala saŋa wʋlɛ tənɛ . Na má wɛɛ na má tɔŋna sɔsaa na piya kɛ kɛɛsʋɣʋ kɛ mpi mpi ma nawa tɔ pə tɔm . Mpi mpi Ɩsɔ kʋyɔɣɔtʋtʋ tɛləsəlaa na Moisi paa tɔma sɩ pɩɩ kɔɔ tɔ , ntɩ tə maɣamaɣa tə tampana kɛ ma hʋ ́ lə ́ ɣɩ ́ .

text: That Christ should suffer , and that he should be the first that should rise from the dead , and should shew light unto the people , and to the Gentiles .
text2: Ntəɣəlɛ sɩ Mesii ká sɩ , na ɩnəɣɩ paa caaləna heeluɣu sɩ ɩ ́ heeli Yuta nyə ́ ma tá , na piitim lɛmpɩ nyə ́ ma kɛ mpi pə tɔm yasəɣɩ səkpɛtʋɣʋ ɩsɩɩ kɔkɔ lakɩ tɔ .

text: And as he thus spake for himself , Festus said with a loud voice , Paul , thou art beside thyself ; much learning doth make thee mad .
text2: Pɔɔlɩ tɔŋna ɩ tɔm yɔɣɔtʋɣʋ kɛ mpʋ , ɩlɛna Fɛsətusi holina - ɩ sɩ : Pɔɔlɩ , n fɛɩna nyá ɩsɛ . Takəlaɣa nyəm katatəlaɣa sʋsa - ŋ kpaŋʋɣʋ kɛ ́ .

text: But he said , I am not mad , most noble Festus ; but speak forth the words of truth and soberness .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Pɔɔlɩ cɔ - ɩ sɩ : Tacaa kʋpaŋ , má na ma ɩsɛ kɛ ́ . Tɔmnaa mpa ma yɔɣɔtəɣɩ ɩsəntɔ tɔ pa wɛ tampana , na natəlɩ tə fɛɩ tə taa kɛ ́ kʋliɣititu .

text: For the king knoweth of these things , before whom also I speak freely : for I am persuaded that none of these things are hidden from him ; for this thing was not done in a corner .
text2: Tacaa wulaʋ tɛma tɔm tənɛɣɛ nɩɩʋ . Pə tɔɔ kɛ ́ ma pəsəɣɩ na má heeli - ɩ na má tá nyána pʋlʋ . Ma nyəmá teu sɩ ɩ nyəmá paa tə taa nti . Pə taɣa pʋlʋ tɔɔ , mpi pə lapa mpʋ tɔ patəma taa kɛ ́ , pə taɣa səkpɛtʋɣʋ tɛɛ .

text: King Agrippa , believest thou the prophets ? I know that thou believest .
text2: Tacaa wulaʋ , n hʋʋkɩ sɩ Ɩsɔ kʋyɔɣɔtʋtʋ tɛləsəlaa yɔɣɔta nti tɔ tə wɛ tampana yaa ɩsəna ? Ma nyəmá teu sɩ n hʋʋkɩ sɩ tə wɛ tampana mɛɛ .

text: Then Agrippa said unto Paul , Almost thou persuadest me to be a Christian .
text2: Tənaɣa Akilipa tɔma Pɔɔlɩ sɩ : Pə lakɩ - ŋ ɩsɩɩ ye má na - ŋ tə wɛɛ na tə ́ wɛɛ n ká la na má pəsɩ Kilisiti təŋlʋ yɛɛ ?

text: And Paul said , I would to God , that not only thou , but also all that hear me this day , were both almost , and altogether such as I am , except these bonds .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Pɔɔlɩ cɔ - ɩ sɩ : Nn ma caa kɛ ́ sɩ paa nɔɔnɔɔ paa wulee , Ɩsɔ luɣu ɩ ́ la na ń pəsɩ ɩsɩɩ ma wɛʋ ɩsəntɔ tɔ , alukpala anɛ a paasi . Pə taɣa nyá tike . Ama na pa təna mpa pa caɣaa na pá nɩɩkɩ ma tɔm kɛ saŋa ɩsəntɔ tɔ .

text: And when he had thus spoken , the king rose up , and the governor , and Bernice , and they that sat with them :
text2: Tənaɣa wulaʋ na kʋfənɛɛ na Pelenisi na pa cɔlɔ nyə ́ ma təna pa kʋlaa .

text: And when they were gone aside , they talked between themselves , saying , This man doeth nothing worthy of death or of bonds .
text2: Pa lɩɩ kpeeŋa , ɩlɛna pá tɔŋ pa taa pa tike sɩ : Apalʋ ɩnɛ ɩ ta la taalɩ nɔɣɔlʋ wei ɩ tɔɔ paa kʋ - ɩ , yaa pá tʋ - ɩ saləka tɔ .

text: Then said Agrippa unto Festus , This man might have been set at liberty , if he had not appealed unto Caesar .
text2: Ɩlɛna Akilipa tɔ Fɛsətusi sɩ : Apalʋ ɩnɛ ɩ nəɣəsəna tʋlʋɣʋ kɛ ́ . Ye pə taɣa ɩsɩɩ ɩ tɔma sɩ Lom wulaʋ sɔsɔ kiŋ kɛ pɩɩ tɛna tɔ .

text: And when it was determined that we should sail into Italy , they delivered Paul and certain other prisoners unto one named Julius , a centurion of Augustus ' band .
text2: Pə kɔma na pə ́ lɩɩ sɩ tɩɩ sʋʋ kpɩɩlʋɣʋ na tə ́ polo Italii , ɩlɛna pá kpaɣa Pɔɔlɩ na saləkatʋnaa lɛlaa na pá tʋ yoolaa sɔsɔ nɔɣɔlʋ ɩ niŋ taa . Pa yaa y + o + olú ɩnɩ sɩ Yuliyusi . Ɩ kɛ ́ Lom yoolaa tintiɣile nte pa yaa sɩ Lom wulaʋ sɔsɔ nyəntɛ tɔ tə taa nɔɣɔlʋ .

text: And entering into a ship of Adramyttium , we launched , meaning to sail by the coasts of Asia ; one Aristarchus , a Macedonian of Thessalonica , being with us .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ tə sʋʋ Atilamiti kpɩɩlʋɣʋ nakʋlɩ . Kʋlɛ kʋ pukina Asii tɛtʋ taa kpɩɩləŋ teesaŋnaa kiŋ . Tá na Masetoni tʋ nɔɣɔlʋ , pa yaa - ɩ sɩ Alisitaakɩ . Ɩ lɩɩna Tɛsalonikɩ , tá na - ɩ tə sʋʋna kpɩɩlʋɣʋ kɛ mpʋ .

text: And the next day we touched at Sidon . And Julius courteously entreated Paul , and gave him liberty to go unto his friends to refresh himself .
text2: Tɛʋ fema ɩlɛna tə ́ sʋʋ Sitɔŋ . Yuliyusi lakaɣa Pɔɔlɩ təpamm na suulu . Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ ɩ ha - ɩ nɔɣɔ sɩ ɩ ́ polo na ɩ ́ na ɩ taapalaa pá ná təma , na ye pʋlʋpʋ caala - ɩ pa waasɩ - ɩ .

text: And when we had launched from thence , we sailed under Cyprus , because the winds were contrary .
text2: Tə kʋla təna na heelim suliɣi - tʋɣʋ kʋsulu , ɩlɛna tə cɔɔləna Sipili hɔɣɔlʋɣʋ lɛŋkʋ tɔɔ .

text: And when we had sailed over the sea of Cilicia and Pamphylia , we came to Myra , a city of Lycia .
text2: Ɩlɛna tə ́ polo tə ́ faɣana teŋku taa kɛ ́ Silisii na Pamfili pə cɔlɔ , na tə ́ lɩɩ Mila kɛ Lisii tɛtʋ taa .

text: And there the centurion found a ship of Alexandria sailing into Italy ; and he put us therein .
text2: Yolú nawa tənaɣa Alɛkəsantilii kpɩɩlʋɣʋ na kʋ caa Italii kɛ pote , ɩlɛna ɩ ́ sʋsɩ - tʋɣʋ kʋlɛ kʋ taa .

text: And when we had sailed slowly many days , and scarce were come over against Cnidus , the wind not suffering us , we sailed under Crete , over against Salmone ;
text2: Kʋyɛɛŋ paɣalɛ taa ta tɔntɛ lapaɣa təniinɔɔ , na təcatɩ təyaʋ kɛ ́ na pə ́ cɔ ́ tə tala Kinite . Heelim tɔŋna - tʋɣʋ səŋʋɣʋ na tə kpisi təna tɔɔ kɛ ́ tɔntɛ , ɩlɛna tə məŋna tɛtʋ paŋtaɣa ŋka ka sʋʋ teŋku taa na pá yaa - kɛ sɩ Saləmonee tɔ ka kiŋ . Tə lapa mpʋ sɩ tə ́ cɔləna Kəlɛɛtɩ hɔɣɔlʋɣʋ tɔɔ .

text: And , hardly passing it , came unto a place which is called The fair havens ; nigh whereunto was the city of Lasea .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ tə mala kʋteŋ , na təcatɩ təyaʋ kɛ ́ na pə ́ cɔ ́ tə ́ tala timpi pa yaa sɩ kpɩɩləŋ teesaŋ kʋpaŋ na pə ́ kpətəna Lasee ɩcatɛ kiŋ tɔ .

text: Now when much time was spent , and when sailing was now dangerous , because the fast was now already past , Paul admonished them ,
text2: Pə məŋna - tʋɣʋ waalɩ kɛ ́ sɔsɔm na tə ́ tɔŋna pote na tə ́ wɛ asola taa . Pə taɣa pʋlʋ , salaŋ nɔhɔkʋtʋ kʋyakʋ tɛma tɛɛʋ . Pə tɔɔ kɛ ́ Pɔɔlɩ kpaala - wɛ sɩ :

text: And said unto them , Sirs , I perceive that this voyage will be with hurt and much damage , not only of the lading and ship , but also of our lives .
text2: Apalaa mɛ , ma nawa sɩ tá mpaaʋ kʋnɛ kɩɩ la asola kɛ sɔsɔm . Asalaʋ sɔsɔ ká la . Pə taɣa kpɩɩlʋɣʋ na kʋ wontu tike ká lana yem . Ye pə ta səŋ təca , pɩɩ kpɛŋna ta maɣamaɣa tɔtɔ .

text: Nevertheless the centurion believed the master and the owner of the ship , more than those things which were spoken by Paul .
text2: Ama Lom yolú ɩnɩ ɩ nɩɩ kpɩɩlʋɣʋ tʋ na saalʋ pa nyəntʋ na pə kəlɩ Pɔɔlɩ nyəntʋ .

text: And because the haven was not commodious to winter in , the more part advised to depart thence also , if by any means they might attain to Phenice , and there to winter ; which is an haven of Crete , and lieth toward the south west and north west .
text2: Təna kpɩɩləŋ teesaŋ ta nəɣəsəna caɣaʋ kɛ hilimatɛ waatʋ . Pə tɔɔ kɛ ́ pa taa paɣalɛ hʋʋwa sɩ ye pə wɛ pəsʋɣʋ paa kʋlɩ təna na pá tala Fenikisi kpɩɩləŋ teesaŋ kɛ Kəlɛɛtɩ tɛtʋ taa na pá caɣa hilimatɛ waatʋ . Təna teesaŋ təsʋʋlɛnaa nyənaɣana ilim tətʋlɛ tɔɔ tɔɔ .

text: And when the south wind blew softly , supposing that they had obtained their purpose , loosing thence , they sailed close by Crete .
text2: Pə pamna heelimaɣa nakəlɩ ka lɩɩna ilim mpətəŋ tɔɔ tɔɔ , ɩlɛna saalaa hʋʋ sɩ pɩɩ səna - wɛ . Tənaɣa pa kpɛsa kuula sɔsɔ wei paa kamna kpɩɩlʋɣʋ tɔ , na pá malɩ Kəlɛɛtɩ kʋteŋ təkpam na pá puki .

text: But not long after there arose against it a tempestuous wind , called Euroclydon .
text2: Pə tasaa ɩlɛ heelimuɣu nakʋlɩ kʋ lɩɩna tɛtʋ nti lʋm cɔɔna mpʋ tɔ tə pɔɔŋ taa kɛlɛ na pə kɔŋ , pa yaa - wɩ sɩ Ɩlakətɔŋ .

text: And when the ship was caught , and could not bear up into the wind , we let her drive .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ heelimuɣu ŋkʋ kʋ tɛɛna kpɩɩlʋɣʋ , na pá maɣasɩ na pá kpisi , ɩlɛna pá yele na pə ́ tɛɛna - tʋ ɩlɛ .

text: And running under a certain island which is called Clauda , we had much work to come by the boat :
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ kpɩɩlʋɣʋ polaa na kʋ təŋna tɛtʋ nti lʋm cɔɔnaa na pá yaakɩ - tɩ sɩ Kota , na tə ́ wɛ maɣana tɔ , tə pə tɛɛ tɔɔ . Ɩlɛna təlɛ tə kenti kpɩɩlʋɣʋ kɛ pəcɔ . Wahala na wahala kɛ ́ na pə ́ cɔ ́ saalaa pəsɩ na pá kpaasɩ kpiiliya .

text: Which when they had taken up , they used helps , undergirding the ship ; and , fearing lest they should fall into the quicksands , strake sail , and so were driven .
text2: Ama waatʋ wei pa kɔma na pá kpaasɩ - kɛɣɛ ɩsɔ , ɩlɛna pá sɔɔsɩ ŋmɩɩsɩ kɛ nyɔɔsʋɣʋ kɛ kpɩɩlʋɣʋ hɛkʋ taa təkeŋkeŋ . Pa sɔɣɔmaɣaa Lipii tɛtʋ kanyəŋa huwa . Ɩlɛna pá tisi kpɩɩlʋɣʋ kuula wei ɩ tiiki lʋm hɛkʋ hɛkʋ tɔ , na pə ́ kaasɩ na heelim pukina kpɩɩlʋɣʋ təpamm .

text: And we being exceedingly tossed with a tempest , the next day they lightened the ship ;
text2: Heelim tɔŋna kpɩɩlʋɣʋ kɛ cɛɣɛtʋɣʋ kɛ ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ tam . Kʋ fema ɩlɛna pá pasəɣɩ kpɩɩlʋɣʋ səɣəla lɛnna na pá pɛtəɣɩ teŋku taa .

text: And the third day we cast out with our own hands the tackling of the ship .
text2: Pəlɛ pə tɛʋ kʋfemuɣu , pa kpaɣa kpɩɩlʋɣʋ wontu na pa maɣamaɣa pa niŋ na pá lɔ .

text: And when neither sun nor stars in many days appeared , and no small tempest lay on us , all hope that we should be saved was then taken away .
text2: Halɩ wɛɛ paɣalɛ heelim tɔŋna mapʋ kɛ ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ tam tə ta keesi ilim . Pəyele tə ta keesi ɩsɔtʋlʋŋa . Tənaɣa tə nyəmá kpakpaa sɩ tá tɔm tɛma kʋtɛm .

text: But after long abstinence Paul stood forth in the midst of them , and said , Sirs , ye should have hearkened unto me , and not have loosed from Crete , and to have gained this harm and loss .
text2: Mpa paa wɛ kpɩɩlʋɣʋ ŋkʋ kʋ taa tɔ hatoo tete waalɩ pa taa nɔɣɔlʋ ta təŋ pʋlʋ . Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Pɔɔlɩ səŋa pa hɛkʋ taa na ɩ ́ tɔ sɩ : Apalaa mɛ , ye ɩ ́ ka nɩɩna - m na tə ́ caɣa Kəlɛɛtɩ , tə taa ná asalaʋ na taŋkaasi ɩnɛ .

text: And now I exhort you to be of good cheer : for there shall be no loss of any man ' s life among you , but of the ship .
text2: Tɔʋ , pənɛntɛ ma heeliɣi - mɛ sɩ ɩ ́ tɔkɩ tɔnəŋ , tá taa nɔɣɔlʋ kaa sɩ . Ama kpɩɩlʋɣʋ tike ká lana asaala .

text: For there stood by me this night the angel of God , whose I am , and whom I serve ,
text2: Ɩsɔ wei ɩ tɩ - m na má lakɩ ɩ təmlɛ tɔ ɩ ɩsɔtaa tillu kɔma ma kiŋ kɛ ahoo taa .

text: Saying , Fear not , Paul ; thou must be brought before Caesar : and , lo , God hath given thee all them that sail with thee .
text2: Na ɩ ́ tɔ - m sɩ : Pɔɔlɩ taa nyá , pə wɛɛ sɩ n ká polo na ń səŋ Lom wulaʋ sɔsɔ ɩsɛntaa . Na ɩsɩɩ Ɩsɔ luɣu wɛ - ŋ teu tɔ , nyá tɔɔ ɩ ká ya nyá na mpa ɩ ́ tɔŋ tɔ pa weesiŋ .

text: Wherefore , sirs , be of good cheer : for I believe God , that it shall be even as it was told me .
text2: Pə tɔɔ kɛ ́ apalaa mɛ ɩ ́ ká tɔkɩ tɔnəŋ , ma wɛna naani kɛ ́ Ɩsɔ tɔɔ sɩ pɩɩ la teitei ɩsɩɩ pə hʋla - m tɔ .

text: Howbeit we must be cast upon a certain island .
text2: Ama pɩɩ lɔɣɔ - tʋɣʋ tɛtʋ səkpetu natəlɩ nti lʋm cɔɔnaa tɔ tə kʋteŋ tɔɔ kɛ ́ .

text: But when the fourteenth night was come , as we were driven up and down in Adria , about midnight the shipmen deemed that they drew near to some country ;
text2: Saŋa taa ahoo naanʋwa na liɣiti nyəna taɣanna ntɛɣɛ yuɣu na pə ́ wɛɛ na pə ́ tɔŋna - tʋɣʋ laŋtʋɣʋ kɛ Metitelanee teŋku tɔɔ . Pə kɔma ɩsɩɩ ahoo hɛka ɩlɛ , pə lapa kpɩɩlʋɣʋ saalaa ntɛ ́ ɩsɩɩ tə wʋsəna tɛtʋ natəlɩ .

text: And sounded , and found it twenty fathoms : and when they had gone a little further , they sounded again , and found it fifteen fathoms .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ pa tisa kʋmaɣasʋɣʋ , ɩlɛna pá maɣana sɩ pə luma ɩsɩɩ mɛɛtələnaa hiu na naanʋwa na naatosompɔɣɔlaɣa . Pa tasa tɔntɛ na pá tasa maɣasʋɣʋ na pá maɣana mɛɛtələnaa pəlefɛɩ hiu na naanʋwa .

text: Then fearing lest we should have fallen upon rocks , they cast four anchors out of the stern , and wished for the day .
text2: Pa nyama sɩ pə ́ taa kɔɔ na kpɩɩlʋɣʋ yoona kʋkpaməŋ , ɩlɛna pá tisi kuulanaa sɔsaa kɛ liɣiti na kpɩɩlʋɣʋ waalɩ tɔɔ , na pá taŋaa tətɛɣɛtɛɣɛ sɩ pə ́ nyaalɩ .

text: And as the shipmen were about to flee out of the ship , when they had let down the boat into the sea , under colour as though they would have cast anchors out of the foreship ,
text2: Kpɩɩlʋɣʋ saalaa caakaɣa sɩ pá se na pá yele kpɩɩlʋɣʋ kɛ təna . Tənaɣa pa tisa kpiiliya ŋkɛ na pá cɛsɩ sɩ pa caa pa tʋ kuulanaa lɛlaa kɛ kpɩɩlʋɣʋ ɩsɛntaa tɔɔ .

text: Paul said to the centurion and to the soldiers , Except these abide in the ship , ye cannot be saved .
text2: Ɩlɛna Pɔɔlɩ heeli Lom yoolaa sɔsɔ ɩnɩ na ɩ yoolaa lɛlaa sɩ : Ye panɛ ɩnɩ pa se kpɩɩlʋɣʋ taa cənɛ mə taa nɔɣɔlʋ kaa tʋlɩ - tɩ .

text: Then the soldiers cut off the ropes of the boat , and let her fall off .
text2: Tənaɣa yoolaa sɛta kpiiliya ŋkɛ ka ŋmɩɩsɩ na pá pɛtɩ - kɛ .

text: And while the day was coming on , Paul besought them all to take meat , saying , This day is the fourteenth day that ye have tarried and continued fasting , having taken nothing .
text2: Pa wɛ təna na pá taŋaa sɩ pə ́ nyaalɩ , ɩlɛna Pɔɔlɩ tɔ - wɛ sɩ : Ɩ ́ cáálɩ ́ mə tɩ na ɩ ́ tɔɣɔ tɔɣɔnaɣa . Na ɩ ́ tɔ - wɛ sɩ : Saŋa taa kʋyɛɛŋ naanʋwa na liɣiti kɔlɔ ɩ ́ wɛ kookalɩ taa , pʋlʋ ta sʋʋ mə nɔɔsɩ taa .

text: Wherefore I pray you to take some meat : for this is for your health : for there shall not an hair fall from the head of any of you .
text2: Tɔʋ , ɩ ́ cáálɩ ́ mə tɩ na ɩ ́ tɔɣɔ tɔɣɔnaɣa na ɩ ́ hiki weesiŋ . Pə kaa cətəlɩ mə taa nɔɣɔlʋɣʋ cətəlʋɣʋ maɣamaɣa .

text: And when he had thus spoken , he took bread , and gave thanks to God in presence of them all : and when he had broken it , he began to eat .
text2: Pɔɔlɩ tɛma ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ yɔɣɔtaɣa , ɩlɛna ɩ ́ kpaɣa potopoto na ɩ ́ sɛɛ Ɩsɔ kɛ ́ pa təna pa ɩsɛntaa , na ɩ ́ faɣa - ɩ na ɩ ́ sʋʋ tɔɣɔʋ .

text: Then were they all of good cheer , and they also took some meat .
text2: Tənaɣa pa təna pa hika apalʋtʋ na pá tɔɣɔ tɔtɔ .

text: And we were in all in the ship two hundred threescore and sixteen souls .
text2: Mpa tá tá təna tɩɩ wɛ kpɩɩlʋɣʋ taa tɔ tɩɩ wɛ yəlaa pee ŋmʋnʋɣʋ na nɩɩtoso na naanʋwa na naatoso ( 276 ) .

text: And when they had eaten enough , they lightened the ship , and cast out the wheat into the sea .
text2: Pa tɔɣaa na pá haɣa , ɩlɛna pá kpaɣa tɔɣɔnaɣa pee na pá lɔɔkɩ teŋku taa sɩ pə ́ yele kpɩɩlʋɣʋ təfaɣafaɣa .

text: And when it was day , they knew not the land : but they discovered a certain creek with a shore , into the which they were minded , if it were possible , to thrust in the ship .
text2: Pə kɔma pə nyaalɩ ɩlɛ , kpɩɩlʋɣʋ saalaa ta nyɩ tɛtʋ ntɩ . Ama pa loosa tiili na teŋku kuɣutaa na pə kʋteŋ wɛ ɩhəntaʋ . Ɩlɛna pá tɔ sɩ : Ye tɩɩ pəsɩ tə ́ pona tá kpɩɩlʋɣʋ kɛ təna .

text: And when they had taken up the anchors , they committed themselves unto the sea , and loosed the rudder bands , and hoised up the mainsail to the wind , and made toward shore .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ pa hɛta kuulanaa na pá yele - wɛɣɛ lʋm taa , na pá kpɛntɩ pa ləsɩ kpatəŋ wei pa kɛɛkaɣana kpɩɩlʋɣʋ tɔ ɩ ŋmɩɩsɩ . Pəlɛ pə waalɩ pa tamsa pʋʋɣʋ kɛ kpɩɩlʋɣʋ nyʋɣʋ taa kɛ ́ kʋ lɔlɔ tɔɔ sɩ pə ́ la - wɛɣɛ heelim . Ɩlɛna pá kɛɛna kʋteŋ ŋkʋ kʋ tɔɔ tɔɔ .

text: And falling into a place where two seas met , they ran the ship aground ; and the forepart stuck fast , and remained unmoveable , but the hinder part was broken with the violence of the waves .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ pa polaa na pá yoona kanyəŋa huɣule natələɣɩ lʋm hola naalɛ hɛkʋ na pə ́ saalɩ . Kpɩɩlʋɣʋ nyʋɣʋ ka sʋʋ kanyəŋa taa kɛ ́ na pə tɔkɩ təkeŋ . Na lʋm hola náá tɔŋa kʋ waalɩ tɔɔ kɛ ́ mapʋ na pə ́ yɔkɩ təkpɔɣɔkpɔɣɔ .

text: And the soldiers ' counsel was to kill the prisoners , lest any of them should swim out , and escape .
text2: Yoolaa nyəmá sɩ pa kʋɣɩ saləkatʋnaa mpɛ sɩ pə ́ taa kɔɔ na pá ya lʋm na pá se .

text: But the centurion , willing to save Paul , kept them from their purpose ; and commanded that they which could swim should cast themselves first into the sea , and get to land :
text2: Ama yoolaa sɔsɔ ɩnɩ ɩ ́ lɛ ́ ɩ ta sɔɔlɩ sɩ Pɔɔlɩ ɩ ́ sɩ , ɩlɛ ɩ ta tisina - wɛ . Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ ɩ tɔma sɩ mpa pa nyəmá lʋm tɔ pá hoti kancaalaɣa na pá ya na pá lɩɩ .

text: And the rest , some on boards , and some on broken pieces of the ship . And so it came to pass , that they escaped all safe to land .
text2: Pə ́ kaasa mpa , pɛlɛ pá papɩ kpatəŋ tɔɔ yaa kpɩɩlʋɣʋ hɔɣɔlasɩ tɔɔ na pá tɛsɩ . Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ tə lapa na tá təna tə ́ tɛsəna alaafəya təmammam .

text: And when they were escaped , then they knew that the island was called Melita .
text2: Waatʋ wei tə lɩɩna mʋʋlaɣa pʋ ́ ʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ kɛ mpʋ tɔɣɔ tə nyəmá sɩ pa yaa tɛtʋ nti lʋm cɔɔna mpʋ tɔ sɩ Malətɩ .

text: And the barbarous people shewed us no little kindness : for they kindled a fire , and received us every one , because of the present rain , and because of the cold .
text2: Təna nyə ́ ma tɔka - tʋɣʋ teu pə tɩɩ fɛɩ . Pə pamna tɛʋ tɔŋna nɩɩʋ na pə wɛ watʋ , ɩlɛna pá taɣanɩ kɔkɔ kɛ teu na pá hʋ ́ lɩ ́ tá təna sɩ tə ́ caɣa na tə ́ cɔɔna - kɛ .

text: And when Paul had gathered a bundle of sticks , and laid them on the fire , there came a viper out of the heat , and fastened on his hand .
text2: Ḿpʋ ́ ɣʋ ́ Pɔɔlɩ kuu tuputu sɩ ɩ tʋɣɩ kɔkɔ taa , ɩlɛna kɔkɔ haŋaɣa tɔɔ tʋm nɔɣɔlʋ ɩ lɩɩ na ɩ ́ nyasa ɩ niŋ na ɩ ́ nyɔkəlɩ .

text: And when the barbarians saw the venomous beast hang on his hand , they said among themselves , No doubt this man is a murderer , whom , though he hath escaped the sea , yet vengeance suffereth not to live .
text2: Tɛtʋ ntɩ tə nyə ́ ma nawa tʋm nyɔkələna Pɔɔlɩ niŋ , ɩlɛna pá sʋʋ yɔɣɔtʋɣʋ sɩ : Tampana , apalʋ ɩnɛ ɩ ta laŋ yʋlʋkʋlʋ . Nyənɩ teŋku ná cɛɛ - ɩ kɛlɛ , na pə tɔŋna ɩ mpaaʋ kɛ pɛɛkʋɣʋ .

text: And he shook off the beast into the fire , and felt no harm .
text2: Tənaɣa Pɔɔlɩ ŋmɩɩsa tʋm ɩnəɣɩ kɔkɔ taa , ɩ ta tɩɩ nɩɩ wʋsasɩ nasəlɩ .
